position: Jul-Dec' 21 - Data Engineering & Software Development Internship
description:
APPLICATIONS CLOSE 15JUL2021

PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING

This role will require you to:
a. Intern with us for atleast 4 months
b. Be continuously remotely available 6 days a week
c. Be willing to relocate to New Delhi for a Full TIme role subsequent to your internship & post-pandemic

Desirables

We are looking for a person who has

Resourcefulness - We're looking for versatile developers who are good at figuring out what they need to use, learn, build, re-purpose to get the job done quickly and efficiently. If you get stuck we expect you to figure things out vs wait for someone to help you out.

Work Ethic - We’ve grown up on Wall Street. We work hard, and have aggressive goals. We want our team-mates to be focused, goal-oriented and consistent high achievers.

Execution Focus - Our business is about getting things done, and getting things done right. We want outcome focused colleagues who can multi-task, and execute quickly and elegantly.

Opportunity

Here’s are some of the things you might have to do on any given day:

  • Build and maintain data acquisition processes to collect, organize and store large amount of structured and unstructured data both from online and offline resources
  • Deconstruct unstructured data sources with Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing technologies
  • Infrastructure Development such as building databases, creating and maintaining automated jobs
  • Work on existing and new product features right from concept, to building & testing and push to production

Ideal Background / Experience

  • 7th semester of Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science
  • Expertise in programming in Python or similar scripting languages
  • Familiarity/Expertise in setting up and manipulating RDBMS through SQL queries; Experience with MongoDB is a plus
  • Basic understanding of technologies used in web-deployed SaaS products, including Rest APIs
  • Exposure to Natural Language Processing or Computer Vision techniques is a bonus

What we need from you if you are interested

Co-ordinates: CV, Phone Number, Current City, Email, Profiles on LinkedIn, Github, Kaggle and others are welcome

*What we are looking for: *

We are looking for one or two development interns to work with us on native app development. Knowledge about React Native, Google APIs, AWS and Firebase are a bonus, but a drive to work with us as a team, continuously learn and develop an outstanding platform is what we are mostly looking for.

This is what you will be dealing with:

  • Native App Development in React Native 
  • Google APIs 
  • Firebase Database 
  • Amazon Web Services 
  • Redux 
  • Experience in integrating Swift/Objective-C/Java libraries with React Native 

*What's in it for you: *

We are an early stage startup, but all our platforms are already under development or live. We want to grow together with you and not only cash in on the free labor, so if you like working with us and we make great progress, we'd love to know you on board! Since we are still a small company, you can decide how much you want to work on. Just create code for the app? Great! Also develop our UI and IT infrastructure? Awesome! Have a look at our web app? Terrific!

We are located in Athens, but if you are traveling the world or located elsewhere, we have a ton of experience in our virtual office and welcome nomads from anywhere on the team! If this sounds like something you might want to do, feel free to get in touch and let's meet up for a chat!

Web applications
UI UX
REST API
MERN stack

Summary

We are looking for a passionate full stack developer to help develop our React and NodeJs Apps and microservices ecosystem. That person will have worked in the past with other frontend and back end projects and will have a clear understanding of how to deliver high-performing backends. The successful candidate will be working on high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design.

Key Responsibilities

  • Delivery of microservices and lambda functions that will form the backbone of our integration with 3rd party providers.
  • Write high-quality code with excellent code coverage.
  • Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges.
  • Able to efficiently multitask between multiple business-critical projects.
  • Ability to guide and mentor junior developers independently.
  • Active team player who will establish healthy working relationships and lead others by example.

Required skills

  • Experience of over 1 year in software development.
  • You have a B.S. in Computer Science or you can make up for it with your skill.
  • You will have developed multiple microservices and tumbled with the good and the bad.
  • Prior experience with any database.
  • Experience with GraphQL, NodeJS such as AWS DynamoDB or Azure Cosmos.
  • A BDD and TDD focus is a must, you must know tools such as Jest or Mocha.
  • Experience with creating integrations with 3rd party APIs.
  • Experience with Blockchain is a plus.

position: Software Engineer Intern/Contract -Dynamic simulation - Climate tech
description:
Remote role, +- 5 hrs to GMT

What is this Sylvera you speak of? 👩‍👨

Sylvera is scaling carbon markets with software. Sylvera does this by applying advanced machine learning techniques to satellite data to quantify with unprecedented accuracy the amount of carbon stored in landscapes. We also provide a holistic picture of offset projects, providing people with the information they need to make informed decisions.

By providing transparency, Sylvera intends to underpin functioning voluntary carbon markets. This will allow the market to scale to keep the planet under 2C of warming, and unlock huge co-benefits for nature and society.

Sylvera is backed by world leading investors and is on a super steep trajectory over the next couple of years - we want incredible people that are as passionate as we are about the mission and want to build an amazing organisation with us to achieve it.

What’s my impact? 👩‍💻👨‍💻

  • Helping prototype next generation approaches to natural carbon quantification
  • Contribute to development of new machine learning architectures, models and analytics products using geospatial data
  • Working alongside our academic partners who are leaders in the earth observation and natural carbon community to push forward the state of the art

Requirements

What do I need? ❓

  • Strong working knowledge of Python
  • Demonstrated experience in building dynamic simulations such as climate models, physics/ode models, computational neuroscience, artificial chemistry or any other physically grounded time stepping model
  • To be able to work both from first principles and from the literature
  • Good foundations of software architecture, object-oriented design
  • Capable of making informed decisions about choice of tools, models and approaches
  • Version control (Git) and collaborative software development experience
  • To care about the future of the planet - you want to solve climate change in the most high leverage way possible

Brownie Points 🍰

  • Have worked with geospatial data, forest or soil data sets
  • Science training in Physics/Biology/ Chemistry
  • Experience with working with real world sensor data
  • MSc or PhD level in relevant area
  • Experience working in a commercial software development environment

Feel free to apply even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. As long as you're a quick learner, and are excited about changing the carbon markets for the better, we're happy to support you as you come up to speed.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Sylvera is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Benefits

Paid internship @fair junior engineer market salary

Paid access to global co-working spaces

Opportunity to convert to permanent role

You also get paid to save the world which is nice.

NO AGENCIES THANKS

description:
Bodo can be translated into “Run” or “Accelerate”, and our technology does just that. Python is the de facto language for data applications but has limited performance and scalability. Bodo is the first Python Supercomputing Analytics platform that empowers data scientists to run Python workloads with the extreme performance and scalability of High Performance Computing (HPC) without code rewrites. The exponential growth of data in the enterprise presents an immense opportunity for transforming industries through advanced analytics and AI/ML, and we aim to enable this transformation.

Bodo’s technology provides automatic parallelization and acceleration for analytics workloads for the first time. This allows data scientists to focus on solving business problems instead of scalability and performance of their codes. Bodo is already deployed at Fortune 500 enterprises with great success.

Description

Bodo is looking for a software engineering intern interested in distributed systems to develop Bodo’s revolutionary cloud analytics platform. This requires a strong entrepreneurship spirit and the ability to turn challenging technical ideas into reality. As a software engineer you will be building the cloud platform that hosts the fastest, most scalable and accessible analytics platform for data scientists and data engineers, with significant impact in large-scale enterprise cluster and cloud compute environments.

Responsibilities

  • Help develop, deploy and maintain Bodo’s cloud analytics platform
  • Help enhance simplicity, robustness, efficiency and scalability of the Bodo Cloud Platform
  • Contribute to various efforts in platform development
  • Design and implement automated CI/CD pipelines to build, test, and release infrastructures
  • Debug complex distributed system issues

Qualifications and Skills

  • BS/MS/PhD student in Computer Science or a related field
  • Strong programming experience (Java, C++, JavaScript, Python, etc.)
  • Experience in distributed systems
  • Experience working with cloud technologies: Kubernetes (K8s), Docker, Terraform, microservices, AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
  • Team work, strong communication skills, and attention to detail

Company

Terra Cover’s mission is to build solutions that help manage and mitigate the ever-growing water-related challenges for businesses and government agencies. We use satellite images together with advanced AI techniques to track changes in water availability across the globe. With support from the NSF (National Science Foundation), we are building a geospatial platform to monitor global water resources that will be used by Terra Cover partners.

Role: Applied Machine Learning Intern

We are looking for an applied machine learning scientist to work on our water monitoring platform. You will work with the lead machine learning scientist to develop novel physics-guided machine learning techniques to integrate satellite images from multiple sources to monitor water resources at high spatial resolution and temporal frequency. The platform will also use advanced uncertainty quantification techniques to integrate sparse ground observations with our satellite-derived observations effectively.

Impact

This opportunity will provide invaluable experience in working with petabytes of data on cloud infrastructure in a fast-paced environment of a startup company. Building solutions to socially and environmentally relevant problems requires close collaboration with the stakeholders. This opportunity will provide hands-on experience in communicating the science to stakeholders with diverse backgrounds.

Desirable Candidates

  • Graduate degree or pursuing a degree in computer science or data science.
  • Experience developing/implementing complex machine learning models on large datasets (knowledge of uncertainty quantification methods is a plus!).
  • Coding proficiency in Python.
  • Experience in working with satellite imagery and cloud infrastructure is preferred but not required.
  • Willing to work at the intersection of multiple disciplines with little guidance to solve complex problems from scratch and quickly learn new methods when needed to fill the knowledge gap.
  • Passion for seeing research through from initial conceptualization to final application.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of Bayesian deep learning and multi-source data fusion models to combine multiple sources and incorporate uncertainty quantification within our water monitoring platform.
  • Work closely with industry stakeholders to develop case studies and translate scientific research into operational products.
  • Build effective strategies to evaluate model performance in different geographies and improve the robustness of the underlying machine learning techniques.
  • Manage the processing pipeline to extract imagery data into machine learning compatible format.

Location

This role is remote, but candidates based in Denver, CO, or Minneapolis, MN, are preferred.

Duration: 3 months - 6 months

Benefits:

Competitive package in a disruptive startup
Health/Dental Insurance

Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Successful candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.

About Glooko:

There are over 420 million people in the world with diabetes and Glooko helps them, as well as their physicians and care team, manage the disease more easily and cost effectively. Glooko is the Unified Platform for Diabetes Management and provides an FDA cleared, HIPAA compliant Web and Mobile (iOS and Android) application for people with diabetes and the clinicians who treat them. The platform seamlessly unifies data from over 80 of the leading blood glucose meters, insulin pumps, continuous glucose monitors, activity trackers, and biometric devices to deliver insights that improve personal and clinical decision support.

Glooko’s mobile app and web dashboard enable patients to easily track and proactively manage all aspects of their diabetes care. Glooko’s Population Tracker and APIs offer diabetes-centric analytics and supply insightful reports, graphs and pattern-triggered notifications to patients, health systems, and payers. The Glooko platform also allows customers and third-party developers to create branded modules for Glooko users.

Glooko has a global footprint and is funded and managed by visionary technologists and leaders in healthcare.

Glooko provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Glooko complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

As an intern on the Advanced Hardware Engineering team, you'll be working alongside those that architect, design, and develop our state-of-the-art hardware systems required for enabling autonomous mobility. The hardware systems is comprised of engineering disciplines which work cohesively with the rest of the company for a successful product launch.

You will be involved in a wide variety of coding at all levels of the embedded software stack, including drivers, middleware, libraries, and applications. You will often be the first person to bring up custom hardware and integrate it with Zoox's software stack. You should be passionate about developing production-quality code and designing a product that meets the high safety requirements needed for autonomous driving. You will be interfacing closely with the electrical, mechanical, and optical engineers designing the hardware, as well as the Perception team for the evaluation of sensors and the Core team for writing and bringing up hardware drivers.

  • Able to commit to a minimum of a 12-week internship

position: Ruby On Rails & Javascript Internships (Sports Fans Wanted!)
description:
We are looking for passionate sports fan programmers to help bolster our product under the counsel and leadership of senior programmers and management.

At the moment, watching sports is an utterly broken experience. Wasting time Googling for game times, streaming links, and tv information is commonplace, and this presents a massive opportunity.

SportsBot5000 makes watching ALL your favorite sports and teams 10X easier.

Instead of forcing viewers to hunt for game times, stream links, and tv listings, SportsBot5000 centralizes everything that a fan needs to get to their games as quickly as possible, and enables them to watch ANY game in just one click. Highlights, links to buy tickets, gambling info and SMS notifications are also all presented at every fan's fingertips to make every aspect of watching and monetizing sports more effective.

You can see our current proof-of-concept beta at: http://sb5k2.herokuapp.com/. This demo is not ssl-protected so you may need to bypass some https browser security concerns to view it.

SportsBot5000 is seeking passionate young engineers to help bolster and scale our code to grow this application quickly. Both frontend and backend roles will be considered--if you can bring something useful to the table, then we are interested.

Jobs include:

  • Maintaining match and team data (database is currently Ruby on Rails)
  • Maintaining television and stream data
  • Maintaining data-collecting scrapers
  • Maintaining dev and production servers
  • Upgrading front end and UX
  • Successfully launching to production
  • Abiding by good standards of engineering, including testing and pipeline adherence

Being an avid sports fan is a plus, though not essential. We are currently a very dedicated and motivated team, and we are looking for someone equally skillful to help us bolster the codebase foundation of this application.

If you are interested in solving this problem and helping build the dominant go-to source of sports entertainment in the near future, please apply. Generous equity is available to the right talent if you can controbute effectively. Part-time is also an option.

description:
About Injective Protocol

Injective is building a decentralized exchange that provides limitless access to all financial markets. Injective Protocol enables fully decentralized trading without any restrictions, allowing individuals to trade on any derivative market of their choosing. Injective Protocol is backed by a prominent group of stakeholders including Pantera Capital, Binance, Mark Cuban, Hashed, and many others. We have offices in New York City and Hong Kong. Injective is valued at over $1 Billion and has been dubbed the "DeFi Robinhood" by the likes of TechCrunch.

Job Description

Algorithm developers are responsible for building and maintaining the models that drive our trading. A typical day involves applying rigorous statistical analysis to vast quantities of market and financial data to produce provably predictive trading models. Working in close collaboration with fellow algo developers and core developers, you will research, develop, and test novel order execution and model training methods to increase trading efficiency.

Requirements

Candidate must have a bachelor's degree at minimum from a prestigious university in CS, Physics, or Math. Candidates must be capable of working independently as well as part of a team. Must have great experience with Rust. Previous exposure in trading strategy implementation in a production environment will be a plus.

Remote work is acceptable. Working language is Chinese
and/or English.

We can provide working visa sponsorship in the US / HK for any qualified candidates. We can also provide US green card sponsorship for fulltime position. Please send your resume to maxim.shen@injectiveprotocol.com

*About Injective Protocol *

At Injective Protocol, you'll have the opportunity to work at the bleeding edge of decentralized finance on products that will redefine our global financial markets. By joining us at this early stage, you will be able to have a high impact on the growth of Injective as well as advance the state of DeFi.

Injective Protocol is reimagining trading and decentralized finance. Injective enables fully decentralized trading without any restrictions, allowing individuals to trade on any derivative market of their choosing. Our goal is to enable anyone to create and trade limitless markets whether they be digital assets, synthetics, or stocks.

Injective is backed by a prominent group of stakeholders including Pantera Capital, Binance, Mark Cuban, Hashed, and many others.

Injective is valued at over $1 Billion and has been dubbed the "DeFi Robinhood" by the likes of TechCrunch.

Job Description

Researchers are responsible for applying, adapting latest deep learning, machine learning and reinforcement learning techniques to achieve various goals in order to make impactful deliveries, while also conducting novel research as required. We are interested in all aspects of ML including: predictive modelling, clustering, time series analysis, natural language processing. Successful researchers manage all aspects of the research process including methodology selection, data collection and analysis, implementation and testing, prototyping, and performance evaluation.

Some successful researchers have joined us from similar backgrounds at other firms. Others have joined from related fields or directly from academia and have thrived with hands-on guidance from our large team of experienced portfolio managers and researchers. Our most exceptional team members combine strong technical skills and a passion for problem solving with an intense curiosity about financial markets and human behavior.

Requirements

● Students enrolled in a master/PhD program in machine learning, computer science, statistics, or a related field.
● Superb analytical and quantitative skills, along with a healthy streak of creativity.
● Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research utilizing large data sets.
● Passion for seeing research through from initial conception to eventual application.
● Curiosity about financial markets, especially in crypto currency markets.
● Strong scientific programming in Python, Tensorflow 2.0, Keras and PyTorch.
● Sense of ownership of his/her work, working well both independently and within a small collaborative team
● Empirical, detail-oriented mindset.

Note: We sponsor CPT/OPT. Depending on individual candidates, we can also sponsor H1B after the internship

| role |

Samaritan seeks a team member to join us in helping people on the street access the resources needed to find a home. If that sounds like you, and you've got a gift for building frontends on web or mobile, we'd love for you to consider sharing your gifts with the people we serve.

Outreach teams and case managers use our smart wallets—called beacons—as a resource for people experiencing homelessness. Individuals set their own housing and health goals and then can access the financial and social capital needed to meet those goals.

| about |

Samaritan enables providers to issue beacons, update goals & needs, and help beacon holders spend money. It also enables everyday individuals and organizations learn the stories of individuals and join their team of supporters to help them meet set goals. Over 10,000 "samaritans" invested more than $100K and 1,000 letters of encouragement into a pilot cohort of 500 beacon holders, enabling dozens to reach life-changing outcomes. This is just the start, with additional pilots in LA, OKC, and NYC coming online soon.

| what you'll be doing |

You'll be joining an incredible task-force of 6 (one backend, one backend/Android, one iOS, and three non-technical). You will collaborate to build frontends that not only grow the impact among current beacon holders and care providers, but also communicate to reach new beacon holders and care providers in need.

| compensation and hiring |

Samaritan hackers are compensated on a bounty system: every feature or upgrade has a bounty on it, which goes to you when you ship it. So the higher the impact you have for our users, the higher your compensation.

Strong preference given to candidates who can be onsite with us in Seattle (once this virus blows over). Will also consider a FT remote candidate in the right circumstances. Look forward to hearing from you!

| skills required |

  • html/css/js
  • react.js
  • Git and Version Control

| skills requested |

  • interfacing with rails templates (html.erb or haml)
  • testing suites
  • continuous integation

| soft skills |

  • Balance engineering excellence with velocity

  • Communicate effectively with teammates, onsite and remote

  • Translate information between technical and non-technical team members

  • Eagerness to own a feature from conception to deployment

  • Willingness to wear many hats (you might help design implementations for features that span multiple codebases and platforms—you'll be responsible for doing whatever needs to be done to get features to users)

  • Quickly adapt and reprioritize to the needs of the team (no two days here are the same)

  • Ability to learn independently

Love what you do. It’s a core value that drives our business. Plus, we’re pretty fun.

We also believe people do their best work where they feel most comfortable so the work location of this position is flexible except that the position may not be performed remotely from Colorado, California, Florida, or Washington and the candidate must be eligible to work inside the United States.

The Fall 2021 Business Development internship program allows you to build broad business experience, gain executive exposure, and grow your skills through professional education and development. This role has a focus on on-boarding new merchants to work with Brad's Deals and our affinity shops ( eco-shop, SHE Shop, LatinX Shop, Pride Shop, etc.) We are seeking students with a track record of high performance, diverse skills, and professional or educational experience in Fashion/Retail, Internet Marketing, or Business roles.

Who you are:

  • Keep it real: You are comfortable speaking with new people and authentically expressing yourself.
  • Entrepreneurial: You love coming up with new ideas, love to express them, and seeing a project through to completion.
  • Exceptional Together: You have good relationship-building skills and value teamwork.
  • Challenge the ordinary: You have an interest in how things work and comfortable asking questions. You welcome change, keep a flexible open mind, and up for a challenge.
  • Love what you do. High energy and enthusiasm. E-commerce industry is inspiring and of interest to you. Uses creativity with customer engagement and problem-solving.
  • Embrace Diversity: You want to see retail be a diverse and representative space for all voices.
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors in Retail, Internet Marketing, Communications, and/or Business.
  • Leadership experience through, but not limited to, an extra-curricular activity, organization, club, sports team, or employment.

Our Story
Brad’s Deals continues to save consumers over $200 million a year by sharing the best deals out there. We live out our core values with a ‘Consumer’s first, always’ mindset to deliver the most value every day.

Started by Brad in 2001, our purpose remains the same to help create smarter shopping habits and to keep it real with expert lifestyle and financial advice.

Our culture embraces diversity with different talents, experiences, and backgrounds that help us be exceptional together. With competitive pay, full health benefits, 401K match, plenty of paid time off including a paid sabbatical, and creative perks, we also believe in work-life integration and continued learning.

As one of the 50 Best Places to Work, located in the heart of Chicago’s River North neighborhood, we partner with over 2,500 retailers to help 5.5 million consumers save more every month. So if you want to challenge the ordinary and love what you do, we want to hear from you.

Brad’s Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion
'Embrace diversity’ is one of our core values because our differences make us stronger together. To make the world a more inclusive and safe place, we start within our company to intentionally lead with equal opportunities. We encourage the value that unique talents, ethnicities, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences bring to our company, our employees, and our future applicants. We welcome all applicants, whether or not you meet every qualification, to share your unique talents with us.

*Please note: Due to the potential personal and business impacts of Covid-19, Brad's Deals is taking a proactive approach by allowing our employees to work from home. As such, our hiring teams will be conducting virtual interviews with potential candidates as we continue to monitor the effects of the pandemic across our local community.

position: W3LL: A Wellbeing Exploration & Discovery Platform (UX/UI Design Internship)
description:
W3LL’s wellbeing exploration and discovery platform is an APP with SMS messaging, engaging/encouraging nudges (our secret sauce!), peer-to-peer support thru AI matched affinity groups (more secret sauce), and wellbeing resources that are easy to access and use. Most importantly, W3LL makes our community healthier, happier, and more hopeful.

*We are looking for candidates that want to change the world, and improve access to wellbeing/mental health resources. People with interests in positive psychology, neuroscience,and in transformative technology. Mental Health/Wellbeing tech is a rapidly growing veritcal. See https://pitchbook.com/news/articles/mental-health-startups-venture-capital-outpace-2019. *

W3LL is building a wellbeing exploration and discovery platform for seniors (then teens!). Seniors share how they feel on the W3LL platform. Our sentiment algorithms create well-being profiles and recommend scored media, product/services and educational content. And then we measure the impact.

By making W3LL accessible to everyone, we help seniors, care-providers, and family members know:

  • What song to play,
  • What class to attend
  • What app to download In order to streamline care and improve downstream outcomes.

In the last 11 months, we have run 2 senior discovery cohorts, meet with seniors and B2B partners and we have learned a lot. seniors want easy to find, easy to access, easy to use low tech + no tech solutions. What they have is a fragmented - hard to navigate well-being experience. This is a massive opportunity and big market. We are looking for our 2021 team!
W3LL is building a wellbeing exploration and discovery platform for seniors. Connecting Seniors 65+ With Effective, Evidence-based Wellbeing Solutions Including Product & Services, Classes & Courses, And Media That Makes You Feel Better (Movies, Music, & More)! W3LL offers assessment tools, AI based recommendation engine, community reviews of products and services, and easy to understand resources on the science of wellbeing (aka “why does it work”). This is a massive opportunity and big market. *We are looking for our 2021 team! *

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear. W3LL is building a platform within the W3LL Marketplace, called SilverW3LL to help seniors improve their wellbeing. We are seeking a design/development/science intern to support the following:

  • User Discovery
  • UX/UI
  • Community Engagement & Social outreach for AGEW3LL. Connecting seniors with wellbeing resources that have an impact.*
  • Science of senior wellbeing research. What works & Why?
  • APP Development - "proof of concept". Simple, easy to use app for seniors that increases offerings as users increase their mastery with our app.
  • Gamification integration in “AGEW3LL”. How do we GAMIFY senior experience? LA/Berkeley based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.

What will you get working with W3LL?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging Transformative Technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building a marketplace that changes lives.
  • Access: W3LL is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (AI/ML, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ http://www.w3ll.xyz/. Contact bst@w3ll.xyz for more info and/or with any questions!

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at W3LL available.
  • Requires a minimum ~10-20 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!). Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder - W3LL

W3ll team:
Brandon Howard: UI/UX Designer, Mindful Economist @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bcehoward/
Ben Simon-Thomas: Ecosystem & Marketplace Developer @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bensimonthomas/

position: Community Builder - Content Creator - Story Teller Internship
description:
W3LL’s wellbeing exploration and discovery platform is an APP with SMS messaging, engaging/encouraging nudges (our secret sauce!), peer-to-peer support thru AI matched affinity groups (more secret sauce), and wellbeing resources that are easy to access and use. Most importantly, W3LL makes our community healthier, happier, and more hopeful.

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear. W3LL wants to give a voice to the senior community. Our thesis: When you share your voice, your experiences, your perspectives - it helps us all see each other in ourselves or see ourselves in each other. It is healing. It is educational. It is something that connects us all. W3LL is building a community platform that will collect the stories of older adults/seniors and turn them into podcasts. We are seeking a design/development intern to support the following.

  • Community Building - We are following the “Build In The Open (BitO)” framework to build a senior community around sharing insights, wisdoms, and perspectives. We want our community to tell us what questions they want to be asked, and how they want to share (short 2 min clips, longer podcast, conversations).
  • Content Creator - Collect insights, wisdoms, perspectives from the AgeW3LL community. Create long and short form audio to share on the AgeW3ll platform and social channels.
  • Story Teller - Find the narratives. Craft the story arcs. Tell the stories that resonate with the W3LL community and beyond. Imagine crafting the story arc of seniors' experiences during Covid? What did they miss the most? What are they most excited about post Covid? This is just the beginning.
  • LA/Berkeley based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.

W3LL is building a wellbeing exploration and discovery platform for seniors. We feel that giving a voice to older adults is a great place to begin! In the last 11 months, we have run 2 senior discovery cohorts, meet with seniors and B2B partners and we have learned a lot. seniors want easy to find, easy to access, easy to use low tech + no tech solutions. ** UNPAID POSITION - EQUITY PARTNERSHIP - 20~ hour weekly committment **

GymHop is a startup that’s poised to change the fitness industry. By offering a way for users to get unlimited access to an entire network of gyms and fitness facilities, GymHop is bringing an offering that has never been seen before.

We are looking for a developer who is willing to join our growing team as a React Native/ReactJS front-end developer.This role will assist in development of a Native mobile app and a ReactJS web-app. You will be working under our CTO and head of frontend who will do code reviews, more difficult features and team management. This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a promising startup with a tangible offering and an app that is already built out but needs significant improvements and continual work to improve the tech.

Current app overview: GymHop is an app that offers a map of gyms to the user along with gym information, allows the user to check in & work out based on proximity to gym location, includes user profiles/editing, and subscription payments with Stripe API/ApplePay/GooglePay. Please note the app is already built but could use considerable upgrades both in UX/UI and additional features. We are largely considering an effective reboot of the app as it was coded using class-based components and redux as opposed to functional components and context.

Any ReactJS or React Native experience welcome. Someone “right out of the bootcamp” would be a viable candidate as we have another React developer who will assist in all complicated matters.

Feature examples:

  • UI updates/layout changes
  • Add Stripe Checkout (Allow users to type in credit card info instead of only using Apple Pay)
  • Optimize sign-up process
  • If this something that interests you, reach out to us and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This role is for equity - not paid until company is funded (4-6 month timeline)

GymHop is a startup that’s poised to change the fitness industry. By offering a way for users to get unlimited access to an entire network of gyms and fitness facilities, GymHop is bringing an offering that has never been seen before.

However an understanding of SQL database, table structure, and hosting will go a long way.

Nomad is looking for a Front-End Designer to help create a beautiful UI/UX for our web application (https://visitnomad.com/). The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful interfaces and experience prototyping simple product designs. The Front-End Designer will work with the development team to style React components, provide feedback on design iterations, and conceive new feature ideas.

We are a pre-seed startup who have already raised $35K as we begin to build a disruptive travel startup. If you are growing as a person or professional, please apply. We are interested in helping your career development in every which way!

Requirements:

  • UI/UX design experience
  • Exposure to HTML/CSS/JavaScript (React.js)
  • Experience with design softwares, ie. Figma
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills
  • Up-to-date with latest UI trends and techniques

About Upped

Upped Events is a SaaS Fintech startup that uses AI-constructed engagements to measure and manage every stakeholder at an event (attendees, staff, managers, vendors, the event owner, sponsors, etc). Using attendee smartphones, Upped’s software-only infrastructure can scale to any event size, use-case, or format. Real-time event data is combined with external data sources and analyzed by its AI model to maximize engagement opportunities that can be provided to the event owner or each attendee individually. While beta-testing its predecessor’s mobile payment prototype, Upped achieved ‘average attendee spend’ numbers as high as 115% over those attendees without Upped. A prior Wharton Business Plan Competition semi-finalist, Upped was recently designated by Startupbootcamp as a top-20 up-and-coming EvenTech company after winning Cambridge Innovation Center’s 3675 competition. The company’s Phase 1 product will be completed by the end of October 2020, during which time the company will be raising investment, growing its management team, and refining its AI offering.

Your Role

Upped is currently looking for a Wordpress/Elementor website developer and designer to assist with the refinement of Upped’s website ahead of product launch. Successful candidates will be hardworking, driven, and self-starters. Primary work topics will be reviewing, updating, making visual enhancements to, fixing bugs, and giving time estimates for future changes of Upped’s Wordpress/Elementor website. These individual will be joining a global team of developers and business persons, and should have skills surrounding Wordpress/Elementor as well as UI/graphic design capabilities. This individual will work under the guidance of Upped’s CEO, advisers (e.g. NASA Lead Electrical Engineer), and development lead in a remote/virtual work environment.

These individuals will be joining a lean and growing startup, so will need to thrive in a fast-paced and complex environment, be organized and detail oriented, and maintain a can-do attitude with a willingness to pitch in wherever needed. Following the internship, Upped will work with them to assess whether there is a match for a full-time position or consultation opportunities, and is happy to provide a strong recommendation letter for future employment.

Duties & Responsibilities will include:
• Working with internal Upped’s CEO, IT Architects, usability associates, and advisers to understand business objectives, needs, processes, development standards, and optimal user experience for Upped’s technology
• Doing Wordpress (Elementor) website review, including content updates & visual enhancements, fixing identified bugs/display issues, and giving time estimates for future changes to design or functionality
• Develop responsive WordPress themes, including website setup and configuration
• Helping to make Upped approachable, including trying to portray customer-facing, revenue-generating features such as Upped’s AI and chatbot functionalities in the best light
• Being a client advocate in all ways, using Upped’s product to provide clients value they will grow to need
• Keeping communicative, actively engaged, and detail oriented so as to produce quality work and update management. Problem-solve, troubleshooting and debugging complex issues or working with available resources/the CEO to create solution pathways.
• Being present at all company-wide meetings to ensure opportunities, challenges, and ongoing accountability against company benchmarks
• Learn. At Upped we support you in any way that we can – if you’re looking for something else, just ask Mark.

Basic qualifications and character traits:
• Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science or related field (unless you are entirely self-taught in Wordpress/Elementor)
• Stack: HTML, CSS, Wordpress, Elementor, and graphic design tools (to make website look great)
• Ability to communicate precisely and clearly (in both spoken and written English), breaking down complex subjects into easy-to-understand concepts
• Desire and ability to work autonomously and ability to juggle multiple projects at once
• Enthusiasm for a startup environment and an optimistic energy that pushes you to excel for the sake of making a difference in the world/life

Cyber Alarm is a cyber security platform for small and medium size enterprises (SME). We are working to make the internet safer for everyone but giving SMEs cheap and simple access to the very best security tools usual only available to large organisations with huge budgets and large IT teams.

Using just your domain name, we build a profile of your internet-based assets then constantly scan the internet for any signs of a breach, potential risks, or open vulnerabilities. Think of us as your burglar alarm for the internet.

Founded by the former Chief Information Security Officer of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange we have built the platform using a combination of proprietary technology and APIs to a wide range of partners. We are now looking to expand our team to dramatically improve the UI and UX while continue to develop new automated security tests.

The rest of our founding team is consists of our CTO who is a world class security architect and engineer from HSBC and Vodafone and our CMO a leading sales & marketing head who has successfully launched and grown many businesses across the creative and retail industries.

Our ideal candidate is a young and ambitious technologist who already has a proven passion for development. They would be the sort of person who comes up with solutions to challenging problems and then executes their idea with relentless drive.

Must have skills are Ruby on Rails, React and PostgreSQL. Exposure to a range of AWS services is also valuable.

Ideally you will also have experience:

  • Working with UI/UX principles and designing solution for non-technical users.
  • Building eye pleasing and intuitive web-based applications.
  • Integrating with 3rd party platforms via APIs
  • Managing your own workload and ensuring deadlines are achieved without supervision.
  • Working in a security focused business.
  • Working in a start-up.

The successful candidate will write code that gets used by our clients on a daily basis and will be able to contribute to the development of the business through discussion and debate with the rest of the team.

If you want to know more check out our website at www.cyberalarm.org.

position: Internship in Computer Vision and Deep Learning
description:
Hi,
Are you excited about applying computer vision and deep learning in a variety of
settings?
Are you one who'd like to speed up their exposure to CV & DL?

We are a consultancy that provides modeling and implementation solutions to
students, individuals and organizations. Our services include:

  • doing a survey of methods and implementations to approach a problem. From options on how to model it ( is it a CNN/GAN/VAE? what preprocessing is required? how much time will it take to run?) to figuring out resources ( this blog/github repo has part of the solution, we need to add that part in)
  • customizing solutions for organization's problem (this model was trained on so & so data, we can retrain it for your limited data) , and even providing fixes to existing code (your code is messy, we'll simplify it) and algorithm snippets (stuck on a small subproblem, like scripting for files, preprocessing/postprocessing, we'll handle it).

We are looking for interns to get involved in this high pace and exciting work.
As an intern you will learn to :

  • think on your feet as a CV-DL engineer with new problems and ideas coming up frequently. (expect things to change week to week)
  • understand code quickly, and figure out minimal modifications needed for the situation. (Thinking like an engineer before a scientist)

We are currently solving problems on classification, segmentation, attribute prediction
with new problems on the horizon
Technical Requirements:

  • past exposure to at least 1 of pytorch/tensorflow, with bonus points for both
  • past experience with some Deep Learning in computer vision projects (with github profile)

Soft Skills:

  • professional about scheduling and deadlines.
  • willingness to take instructions and suggestions.
  • communication skills, let us know fast about updates/ restrictions/ issues.

INR 10,000/- per month. Current duration 3 months.

description:
Scatter

Front End Engineer

Scatter is a map based personal and social travel tool. We have built an application which streamlines the process of sharing and receiving recommendations, very much similar to the way in which Venmo created a platform to send and receive money. Think of and information or recommendation bank; Scatter is that bank. Within the Scatter app users can request and send recommendations for both the physical and non-physical world. For recommendations based in the physical world, they are categorized, subcategorized and plotted on the map portion of the application. The user then accumulates and creates a map of their own personally curated locations around the globe; the user can then share this map or any of the individual map pins with anyone in their trusted network. For recommendations of the non-physical world, the app categorizes, and subcategories the information within the users personal profile. Some categories might be podcasts to listen to, books to read, or shows to watch. Further, recommendations in the non-physical world would revolve around how to do something, how to prepare something, or what to purchase. The technology we have created provides a tool which users can use to sift through and classify the infinite amounts of information that exists in our world. Each user's Scatter profile will be a personal, unique, and extremely valuable compilation of all information that is valuable to that individual. We believe that Scatter will revolutionize not only travel and social media, but the way that we exchange information as a human species.

We are launching on the App Store soon and are looking for a Front-End Engineer who has experience working with mobile frameworks to help the front end design and work alongside the Back End Engineer to make sure the app runs smoothly.

Some understanding of TypeScript or are keen to learn
Some understanding of GraphQl or keen to learn
Understand git workflow and push/pull requests
Have used Figma before to design / work from
Shipping an app to the App Store would be a huge bonus!

Company description:
Our purpose at Changing Room is to move people towards more sustainable decisions, starting with the fashion industry. Changing Room aims to bring environmental transparency to the fashion industry by empowering consumers to make more sustainable purchases. We provide a solution where consumers can find the environmental ratings of their favorite brand’s fashion products, and receive more eco-responsible products suggestions.

Changing Room is composed of dynamic and open-minded individuals that deeply care about making a positive change in the industry. We recently joined the Columbia Startup Lab and have WeWork offices in West SoHo, Manhattan. Changing Room was incubated through Columbia University’s Summer Startup Track 2020 and won the competition grant prize. We presented in the New York TechDay, the largest startup event in the U.S., as well as in the sustainability week at both University College London and the London School of Economics. We are ambitionning to join the Y-Combinator cohort S2021.

Under the Covid-19 pandemic, our team currently operates remotely.

The role:

-Able to adapt javascript libraries (anime.js, jQuery or others);

-Good interpersonal skills.

Learn something every day building real products for real users

What you will learn:

  • How our product development process works from inception to deployment
  • How to write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python/Django and ES6/React
  • How to collaborate with other engineers over code review and discussion

What you will do:

There are no intern projects. We treat you like full-time engineers and get you onboarded as quickly as possible.

  • Ship code to users in your first week and every week after
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other engineers on projects small and large
  • Take ownership and lead your own project within 8 weeks

Examples of past intern work include:

  • Architecting the backend database schema and designing the REST API for our trading platform
  • Implementing the redesign and refactor of our entire investment search page in a reactive framework with front-end routing and browser history
  • Building a process for users to upload and unpack zip files and replicate the folder structure in our database

Benefits & opportunities:

  • Autonomy - Work autonomously to set your own timeline, architecture, and task breakdown
  • Mentorship - Meet with mentors one on one to develop technical and non-technical skills
  • 10% Time - Every other Monday, utilize your curiosity to develop your technical skills on personal projects
  • Snack - We're not unique here but we love our coffee and snacks and we've got you covered

What we are looking for:

  • Motivated individuals looking for industry experience and to develop their technical skills
  • People with a foundational understanding of software engineering
  • Curiosity for technologies, concepts, and practices
  • Individuals who enjoy collaborating with roles outside of engineering

What are our goals:

We think it should be just as easy to trade in private companies as it is in public companies. Many believe that startup employee equity is only worth something if the company IPOs or is acquired. However, with a robust, centralized, efficient market to trade in private companies, that equity becomes liquid and is valuable from the day it vests. We are building that market for stockholders and institutional investors, and we could use your help doing it.

Other Details

  • Given the uncertain circumstances around the pandemic, we are only accepting candidates residing in the Bay Area.

Learn more about us at https://www.zanbato.com or https://www.facebook.com/zanbatoinc/

description:
Machine Learning Engineer:

We’d love you to bring:

  • Currently enrolled in or have completed a Master’s or Ph.D. program in a relevant field
  • Candidates about to complete a Bachelor’s degree will be considered with demonstrated ML experience
  • Programming experience in Python and Tensorflow/PyTorchExperience building ML solutions and experimenting to improve ML system performance
  • A desire to build cool cutting edge ML tech
  • Strong understanding of probability and machine learning
  • Self-motivation, and ability to work independently as well as with a remote team
  • Belief in creating diverse, equitable, and inclusive practices and programs that will further Knock’s commitment to making an impact, learning, putting people first, being open, and courageous
  • We encourage you to apply even if you don’t have every listed requirement
  • Knock is a 100% remote, work from home culture and has been since our inception in 2015 As a Machine Learning Engineer, your journey will look like this: Week 1: you will begin learning about our machine learning models. Week 2: you will have a reasonably scoped machine learning project to dive into, enabling you to demonstrate your skills and have an impact immediately. During your journey, you’ll have an opportunity to engage with not only other machine learning engineers and data scientists, but also members of the engineering and product teams. In the process, you’ll gain a better understanding of how our pricing models impact Knock’s operations and ultimately the customer. You will have access to all our data and AWS computing resources to query, explore, and train models using the data using any programming language and packages you feel you prefer. But most importantly, you’ll have the time and space to experiment, read academic literature, develop new skills, and learn about existing methodologies that may contribute to advancing Knock’s machine learning technology!

Our team builds new technologies that protect millions of people from phishing attacks. We aspire and succeed to reach far beyond today’s security market.

We are seeking a talented Security Engineer to identify, track, and defeat sophisticated targeted cyber attackers as part of our new PhishGuard team. In this position, you will examine and mitigate phishing attacks in realtime.

As a Security Engineer, your experience, thinking, and action will be the key to our success. You will develop software and algorithms to help. identify Cyber Attacks in the real world. You will collaborate with our team to develop new ways to present and interact with our insights. You will stop the adversary. You will show the world how the adversary works.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Incoming 2nd or 3rd Year Undergraduate enrollment at US College Degree Program in one of the following majors: Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, or Computer Security. Sorry, graduates of these programs will not be considered for this opportunity. Graduate students are also ineligible for this position.
  • Current GPA of 3.1 or higher. GPA proof will be required.
  • Ability to synthesize technical information and document it in a non-technical manner including through graphical and verbal depictions
  • Excellent english writing skills
  • Experience with Domain Names, IP Addresses, Emails (Subject, From, To, Addresses), Hyperlinks, DNS, IPv4, IPv6

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience writing Go, Python, React
  • Experience with Postgres, BigQuery
  • Experience with REDIS
  • Experience with Kafka

DUTIES

  • Drive the next wave of security technology through prototyping concepts into solutions
  • Define, design and implement software to address tactical and strategic purposes
  • Collaborate with researchers to apply research techniques at scale
  • Work with large scale data systems

TIMING

  • This is a Spring/Summer 2022 position.

Test Engineering Intern (Season Flexible)

We are looking for self-starting interns with a passion for learning and growth mindsets. Candidates must be highly motivated and willing to intern with SOE for three to six months. Interns will gain a range of hands-on test engineering experience going through a range of test campaigns for engineering hardware.

SOE’s interns have the opportunity to gain significant on the job learning and will directly apply engineering fundamentals to produce impactful results.

Responsibilities:

  • Interns will report to a mentor who will be responsible for candidate feedback and learning— mentors will also assign tasks and projects to work closely with the teams
  • Using electrical test equipment to make measurements and troubleshoot components
  • Working with data acquisition systems and control systems to continually improve in-test data recording and usability of the systems
  • Gaining exposure to designing, assembling, and testing custom hardware/electrical systems for our customers
  • Generating and use test systems and procedures while operating hardware under environmental tests
  • Writing automation and interface software in Python for testing, troubleshooting, and production checkouts

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in or graduate of an accredited four-year university or college for relevant degree programs (Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Industrial Engineering, Math, or related field)
  • Programming skills with an object-oriented programming language (e.g., Python, C++, Java) and experience generating maintainable code for applications that interface with test equipment
  • Basic knowledge of physics with respect to electricity, magnetism, and electronic circuits
  • Curious and passionate about electrical engineering and technology with the ability to learn and take instruction
  • Strong attention to detail, with care and consideration when handling test equipment or hardware

Preferred Skills Experience:

  • Experience in a team-based design and build project (e.g., Formula SAE, Solar Car, CubeSat, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Python and/or MATLAB for data parsing and data visualization
  • Exposure to automated test systems and test equipment; experience with datalogging, and data processing software
  • Experience with control system logic and interfacing with test equipment and hardware
  • Familiarity with aerospace environmental testing such as thermal cycling, vibration, shock, thermal vacuum, and EMI/EMC
  • Experience with continuous testing or related high-reliability software development strategies
  • Experience with Linux operating systems

Additional Requirements:

  • Applicant must be willing to work 40 hours a week on-site in El Segundo, CA
  • Applicant must be eligible to work on ITAR projects
  • Job Type: Full-time (Paid, Seasonal)

ITAR Requirements:

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

Algomo is a multilingual chatbot engine that provides instant resolutions to customer and employee queries in any language 🌎 .

We have developed a unique technology that is fluent in 109 languages. All the other commercial players (including Google, Microsoft, Amazon, IBM etc) combined support just 33. Algomo supports an additional 76 languages, bringing AI to the 1.3 Billion people who are currently left behing and are mainly living in emerging economies.

Our mission is to facilitate access to digital goods to anyone in the world, no matter what language they speak.

Algomo was founded in February 2020, by a technical CEO (ex VP of Data Science at Barclays), and is backed by research grantsf from UK and EU, is already generating revenue.

We also have pilots with P&G, Airports, Banks and the public sector.

Here is a 2-minute video demonstrating how the technology works.

The role

As a data science intern, you will have the opportunity to work alongside the technical CEO, who built the core technology, as well the rest of the technical and commercial team which is distributed across the globe.

We are using cutting edge NLP techniques (including zero-shot learning, multi-task learning, and transfer learning) to solve a real word problem of global importance.

Responsibilities

Improve/develop our core ML models, algorithms, and data sets running in production that are fuelling Algomo's contextual and language agnostic search.

Kepler is on a Mission to bring the internet to space. Incorporated in 2015, Kepler’s guiding star is to enable the space economy through the creation of a communication network in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) that will provide connectivity services to other space missions, be they on orbit in LEO, MEO, GEO, or beyond. With an expanding base of early customers and our first 15 satellites in orbit, Kepler is continuing to grow and expand its most important asset – the Team! Based out of our HQ in Toronto and with an office in the UK and a newly formed office in the US we are building towards a truly global company delivering a product for the whole world.

We’re on the hunt for a top-tier Hardware Engineering Intern. Your focus will be on assisting the development and test of hardware, specifically hardware related to both our space-based communications payloads as well as ground-based assets. We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our hardware team. Here is a little more detail on what you can expect to work on:

Responsibilities:

  • Design schematics and PCB layout
  • Own new designs from start to finish or iterate on existing designs based on new feature requests and lessons learnt including switch mode power supplies, high speed design, and analog design
  • Assist with part selection and new project scoping and architecture
  • Participate in design reviews for all active designs
  • Perform functional and performance testing on individual boards or integrated sub-systems as part of prototype bring up, including development of test boards
  • Participate in pathfinding activities, new process planning, and design specification development

Requirements:

  • 3+ years in an electrical engineering degree program (currently enrolled)
  • Significant involvement in a hardware design (schematic and PCB layout) outside of class projects
  • Experience with one or more CAD tools (Altium, Eagle, Allegro, KiCad, Upverter, etc.)
  • Comfortable in a lab environment and experience using standard tools such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, multimeters, VNA’s, etc.
  • Ability to troubleshoot hardware issues
  • Ability to work in a team and independently with little supervision

Bonus Points:

  • Experience in a University design team or building circuits for a personal project
  • Python scripting experience
  • Knowledge of CubeSats

We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our small but strong RF team.

  • Assist more senior engineers in all activities related to RF/Antenna design, manufacture and test for spacecraft, ground terminals and test infrastructure
  • Assist in the design of new RF hardware by performing component selection, schematic capture, layout and fabrication as well as design reviews
  • Perform performance and acceptance testing for RF frontends and antennas using equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna range systems (far-field and near-field)
  • Write software to control test equipment or hardware under test in languages such as Python/C/VEE
  • Build infrastructure to assist in the testing of RF hardware
  • Simulate and model RF systems and structures for new designs and test setups

Requirements:

  • Currently enrolled in an Engineering, Physics or similar degree program
  • Experience in hardware design outside of class projects, particularly related to RF and/or Antennas. Experience on cubesat teams is a strong plus
  • Experience with circuit design/layout tools such as Altium/Eagle/KiCad
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python and C++, particularly as it relates to controlling hardware or modeling RF systems

  • Some experience with RF test equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna test systems (far-field/near-field)

What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we’d like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we’re driven to do this in our manifesto.

The Role
We’re looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

Responsibilities

  • Handling 1-on-1 admissions sessions, technical interview prep and occasional behavioral prep
  • Investing in students’ personal stories and advising them on their career trajectory in the admissions calls and giving proactive feedback
  • Building up and improving on the admissions process for data fellows
  • Conduct data analysis for Pathrise and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the data track

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience working on data-related projects whether that be in academic projects, internships or other related work experience
  • A passion for mentorship!
  • Be available for 10+ hours a week
  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Growing employees: we value giving and receiving feedback (constructively) and we value continuous improvement. We want you to grow professionally and we include a professional development stipend to help you achieve that.
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‘DEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.’ We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We cannot sponsor visas for this role at the time. Thank you for your interest.

Pathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are also interested in the fellowship, please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.

position: MBA Summer Intern - Technical Product Management
description:

Today, 1 in 3 Americans say they suffer from mental health problems like anxiety, depression, or insomnia. Despite this mental health epidemic, seeing a psychiatrist can take up to 3 months and cost as much as $500.

Shocked? Us too. That’s why we started Cerebral, a telemedicine-first mental health startup. We are breaking down the barriers to access mental healthcare so that anybody can get the care they need immediately. We provide tens of thousands of individuals across the nation with medication management, therapy, and counseling services. We launched publicly in January 2020 and are growing at over 40% month-over-month, and need your help.
