Paid Stipend: $800 for 8 weeks
Website: https://beaconapp.info
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/beaconnyc_/

Full Job Description
The Role

We are looking for a new Manager to join our growing team. Our ideal candidate will have a passion for establishing strong relations and natural curiosity for website optimization, and a knack for being proactive in pursuing growth opportunities for their book of business. You will work with a group of amazing SEO team members that you are able to learn from and bounce ideas off of. Read on, if this sounds like your next challenge!

You Will Be

  • Working on multiple client websites by implementing changes to various aspects in order to comply with Google's best practices.
  • Expected to retain existing business, while pursing profitable growth opportunities in assigned clients accounts.
  • Communicating via phone/email with clients on a regular basis. Strategizing with team members to come up with creative solutions for our clients.
  • Keeping up with the SEO industry through blogs, publishers, competitive research, etc
  • Creating reports to gauge progress and inform the client of the value being provided
  • Presenting your findings to the client in order to influence their onsite content strategy
  • Leading the sales process while calling upon others to assist in solution development and proposal delivery
  • Working with a client’s development team to implement changes to their website or on your own with approval from the client.

You Must Have

  • well to do knowledge of website and how to make changes and use different methods to make the product good.
  • 0-4 years experience doing SEO work for clients within an agency environment
  • Proficient with keyword research/data mining tools and competitive analysis
  • Technical knowledge of website architecture (experience with HTML Markup, CSS, XML).
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and other common applications
  • Experience with content management systems such as Wordpress, Joomla, and Magento
  • High level of comfort using email and the Internet, specifically search engines such as Google, Bing, etc.
  • Ability to quickly pick up new skills and learn new tasks
  • Proven track record of successful project management and multi-tasking skills with the ability to hit and exceed deadlines required
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral while paying close attention to details

Send your resume at careers@tripetrip.com

💘 Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

👀 The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society’s relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We’re on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal — we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

Greetings Adventurous Programmer

We, the artists, builders, dreamers and denizens of StartupLandia have evolved to the point that we think we'd like to create an internship program.

We are a small team of senior level engineers and a few designers.

We love the intersection of entrepreneurship, design and technical product engineering.

Many of us have been founders and generally speaking, we build exclusively for founders in the Seed to Series A range.

As an intern, you would have the opportunity to...

  1. Pair with senior engineers on 4 different projects ranging from rails, to node, react native, to flutter with maybe some elixir or swift mixed in there.
  2. Work directly on an in house ticketing app that StartupLandia CTO is hammering on, a rails/twilio/stripe/pay-musicians direct thingy.
  3. Write some cool blog posts about your experiences that hopefully document soon to be accelerated changes in your professional skills.
  4. Gain valuable expeience and possibly some references that will help you make the jump into a full time junior position somewhere.

As an intern, you would...

  • Probably be self taught or someone who completed a coding bootcamp
  • Interested in learning from the fire hose and very self directed
  • Capable of signing an NDA and working like a professional
  • Have a good understanding of the HTTP roundtrip web software process
  • Have some exposure to rails & react
  • Have great communication skills
  • A desire to help Startuplandia's mission while helping yourself

We think that this is a six week kind of program where the payment mechanism is based on us paying you for a weekly blog post, something like $200/post/week would work out to $1200 for 6 weeks (1099 contract). You can pair with senior devs and work on an internal project we have as much or as little makes sense for your growth. After 6 weeks has past, if things go well, you would then have a professional grade commit history and a recommendation from me to assist your journey into the great unknown.

If this sounds interesting to you, please respond to this post with 3-5 bullet points about yourself that support the above scenarios.

Cheers,

John D
Founder, CTO
startuplandia.io

P.S. - DO NOT EMAIL ME OR ATTEMPT TO GET ON MY RADAR DIRECTLY, I'M SUPER BUSY & CONSTANTLY FIGHTING FOR MY FOCUS :)

position: Financial Engineering and Data Science Intern

location.city: Los Angeles • Santa Monica • Los Angeles County

description:
Our new startup, Pace It, is focused on helping retirees convert their hard-earned assets into lifelong paychecks. Millions of baby-boomers are retiring and are facing a tough problem of enjoying their retirement without running out of money. Our digital platform tailors a personalized drawdown strategy for them and assists them to stick by it. By addressing the unique financial circumstances of retirees, PaceIt is poised to become the one-stop solution for all the boomers’ financial needs.

We are four founders with many years of combined experience in the retirement space. We have been helping individuals accumulate for retirement and have realized that there is no good solution to guide them through withdrawals once those individuals retire. We are leveraging our experience and wide network with retirement plan providers and record keepers to distribute our solution. We have already signed a major 401(k) record keeper as our launch partner. We are now focused on building our core team towards a launch of our MVP in 2021. The company is well funded to achieve that goal.

We’re currently looking for a phenomenal financial engineer with data science capabilities for an unpaid internship starting on June 21, 2021. The internship will allow you to grow and to take part in a multi-disciplinary development effort. Two of the founders are UCLA professors with many years of experience coaching graduate students.

Example of the tasks that you might be asked to complete:
• Develop Monte Carlo simulations for modeling retirement portfolios.
• Use machine learning algorithms to improve portfolio modeling.
• Analyze transaction data and develop algorithms for tracking individuals spending versus their budgets.
• Develop machine learning algorithm to predict life expectancy and spending patterns of retirees.

Requirements:
• Previous work in a start-up and/or hi-tech environment is a plus.
• Experience modeling investment risk and return using Monte Carlo simulations.
• Experience using statistical computer languages (mostly Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
• Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, tree-based techniques, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Familiarity with Tensor flow and Keras is a plus.
• Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
• Previous experience with cloud technology (AWS in particular) is an advantage.

This is a rare opportunity to take part in a high-growth venture at an early stage and help build a company with an important mission. If you want to do good and do well, help us create a needed financial solution for the many baby boomers retiring every day.

The Position

KAYAK is growing rapidly and seeks to hire an intern/co-op to bolster the IT Support team. The ideal candidate will understand the basics of troubleshooting hardware and software. A friendly demeanor and great communication skills are very important to ensuring success.

The position will be based in Cambridge, MA.

Responsibilities

  • Deploy new software and hardware to our employees.
  • Provide software and hardware support to our employees in person and remotely.
  • Manage the helpdesk ticketing queue, owning and completing tickets assigned to you.
  • Assist w/ onboarding and offboarding users and equipment
  • Optional project work for prodigious learners

Requirements

  • Initiative: ability to identify and complete tasks on your own.
  • Top-notch troubleshooter: ability to dive into issues, resolve them and find the root cause quickly while under duress.
  • Clear and effective communicator: ability to effectively work with fellow employees in a friendly manner; both in person and over the phone.
  • Multi-tasker: ability to manage multiple tasks and properly prioritize them.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Active Directory.
  • Understanding of Windows, and OS X operating systems.
  • Basic software troubleshooting, hardware troubleshooting and command line/terminal skills.
  • Basic computer software, computer hardware and networking knowledge.
  • Good listening skills: able to process and learn in a fast paced environment
  • Knowledge Transcription: ability to document what you learn in a clear and precise manner for others to use and learn from

About KAYAK

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of meta-search brands including momondo, Cheapflights, Swoodoo, checkfelix and Mundi. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other’s strengths and insights. Together, we’re able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.

Diversity and Inclusion at KAYAK/OpenTable

We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more innovative ideas, products, services, and better business outcomes for our stakeholders. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Alexandria is seeking SWE Full Stack Intern(s) to join our talented team. Your responsibilities will be to develop, optimize and scale our company’s web and mobile products as well as our art databases and related tools. Interns will undertake a variety of projects depending on their technical interests and skill sets, ranging from front end UX feature development to backend database integration and more.

About Alexandria: Alexandria (www.alexandria.app) is an Art Technology startup working to use machine learning methods to make fine art education and consumption accessible to all.

Potential Projects and Responsibilities:

  • Improve, optimize and implement user facing web and mobile features central to Alexandria’s core products
  • Design and implement database search tools to help internal teams manage, select and update artwork data as needed
  • Improve and scale Alexandria’s recommendation systems
  • Research and develop new image classification tools to help expand Alexandria’s artwork dataset.

Requirements:

  • Current undergrad or graduate student studying Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science or other relevant fields.
  • Python experience preferred
  • Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
  • Outstanding problem solver.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.

Preferences:

  • React experience (ReactJS/React Native)
  • Firebase or SQL experience
  • Python experience
  • Strong interest in visual art
  • Experience or desire to gain experience in startup environment

Vendible seeks highly motivated students dedicated to their academic development to work alongside the executive staff to help manage the technical growth of Vendible.

Interns will sharpen their professional and interpersonal skills, work closely with senior staff and major partner stakeholders, and build productive relationships with the Vendible staff and contractors.

Vendible is a mobile payment and banking solution for our modern economy. We are helping to bridge traditional finance by leveraging new digital assets to speed settlement, reduce costs, secure data, and open access to millions of users who incur massive fees for operating outside of the banking system. We secure the financial and personal data of the merchants and consumers we serve using a decentralized credentialing and identification system. Our customers maintain complete control of their data.

Vendible is building a blockchain-based, second-layer application that sits over existing mechanisms to drive the future of finance. Our ideal candidate has a technical background and has a desire to help lead others to success.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Culture

  • Become a champion of the vision of Vendible.

  • Show a sincere concern for the well-being of others and the desire to work towards solutions that better our fellow man.

Strategy

  • Assist with the planning, staffing, organizing, and direction of technical initiatives

  • Participate in strategic brainstorming for implementation of new business development initiatives.

  • Work directly with the CEO to execute the near-term business plan for the company.

Execution

  • Forge and maintain strong relationships with internal and external customers.

  • Develop and leverage the company’s branding and professional profile in coordination with our marketing team.

  • Maintain an ability to work independently within a small, fast-paced team.

  • Create systems and methods for planning and executing various concurrent engineering projects

  • Assist with execution of various concurrent engineering projects

REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, can partner and influence across functions and levels.

  • Exposure to fintech concepts.

  • Display a structured approach to organizational development.

  • Prior experience with complex technology.

  • Strong quantitative and analytical problem-solving skills.

  • Very comfortable presenting both in-person and on the phone.

  • Comfortable working with executives and assisting deal-flow with enterprise businesses.

  • A leader with the ability to navigate ambiguity, operate effectively in a hyper-growth, start-up environment, and motivate a team of high-performing individuals.

  • Background in finance or business management and knowledge of programming.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage

  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

position: Full Stack Software Developer Intern - Editor Team
description:
At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. We are passionate about democratizing science communication in order to accelerate scientific discovery and understanding. We're looking for amazing people to help create the world’s go-to-place and platform where science is communicated. Come join us!

We’re looking for a Full Stack Software Developer Intern to join our Editor Team in September 2021! Our stack includes React.js, Node.js, and MongoDB, with a lot of frontend technical challenges. Bonus points if you’re a fan of drafting/visualization tools or have previous experience working on a similar product!

Our ideal fit

  • Working towards a degree in computer science, computer engineering, or similar
  • Some educational background in mathematics and linear algebra
  • Excellent technical communication skills
  • Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
  • Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
  • Extremely curious, creative problem solver

What you'll be doing

  • Identify and build features that are highest impact to our users. Some projects on the roadmap are improving slides functionality, creating drawing tools (shapes, widgets, ‘bio-brushes’), and improving text functionality.
  • Responsible for the full feature design and implementation: code design, architecture (in collaboration with other team members), implementation, testing, QA, and deployment. You will take on similar projects to a junior full-timer. You’ll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship, and project coordination.
  • Proactively address product issues
  • Conduct peer code reviews, participate in team meetings and contribute to team efforts around code quality improvements

What you bring to the table

  • You have professional experience in our stack (MERN) or extensive web development background and challenging side projects
  • Experience with web-based graphics libraries, mathematics / linear algebra, game development, or animation is a plus (but not necessary for most projects)
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

About us
BioRender is a software tool that allows scientists to accelerate groundbreaking research across the life sciences by reducing the time it takes to visually communicate research from many hours to just minutes while drastically improving outputs. We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them.

An incredible group of investors back us, including Y Combinator, Refactor and some of the most successful life science entrepreneurs in the world. Our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical and biotech companies to the most renowned universities and research institutions.

Our tight-knit group is bonded by its shared commitment to our core values of resourcefulness, curiosity, integrity, empathy and humility. By both individually and collectively embodying these values, we can create clean, powerful, elegant solutions that delight our customers.

We are committed to building a warm, inclusive, and diverse environment. We believe that people do their best work when they feel good, and every member of our team deserves to feel safe, empowered, and supported. To this end, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including:

Competitive salary
Stock options in a hypergrowth startup - we're growing more than 100% year over year!
Health and dental benefits for you and your family from your first day, including an HSA and extended mental health benefits
Annual professional development budget and regular learning opportunities
3 Recharge Long Weekends per year, in addition to vacation days
Veterinary bill reimbursement program
Regular virtual team events to stay connected
Fast-paced, mission and values-driven environment with highly engaged coworkers

Ideally, you would work onsite at our office in Toronto; however, given the ongoing restrictions brought on by COVID-19, this is currently a remote position. We are open to considering continuing in a remote capacity once restrictions are lifted.

If your interest is piqued, please apply. We'd love to hear from you. Also, be sure to check out other listings on our Careers page.

BioRender is an equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Want to make an impact this year? At Assured, you'll work with a 7 person team of extraordinarily passionate engineers working to reimagine the insurance industry.

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.
🏡 If you choose to join us in person in Palo Alto, housing is included!
💸 Highly competitive pay. If we love you, we'll pay whatever it takes.
🛫 Ever wanted to be a pilot? One free flying lesson from our co-founder.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry.

There's so much to do. We can't wait for you to join us.

You'd love this role if...

🔥 You're passionate about reimagining archaic industries
🖖 You want to work on a small, close knit team of brilliant engineers consumed by a consequential and yet-unsolved problem
🐾 Being a trailblazer—in our architecture, in our approach, and in our team—is an inspiration, not a burden

You will...

🌱 Grow as an engineer with our help, working across the stack as you own features from ideation to production
🗣️ Interact with stakeholders ranging from end-users to insurance adjusters
💎 Use modern frontend frameworks like React and GraphQL to build single-page applications
🔎 Collaborate with the CEO and CTO to identify and prioritize the most impactful improvements to our product
😍 Implement delightful, functional user experiences

You may be a fit if you...

🔧 Build software to solve problems
💪 Have substantial, self-initiated projects that you're proud of
🚀 Want to dive into the world of startups

Bonus points...
✨ We're currently using Typescript, Node.js, React, and GraphQL, however that will evolve. The most important thing is that you're nimble, intelligent, and hard working.

At Carta, we design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We’re looking for Engineers skilled at rapid iteration and excited about solving problems that can save lives. This is a startup role, where we will ask you to wear many hats and solve many different types of problems.

You love solving complex engineering problems, by creating beautiful, and well-tested algorithms. You’re a positive individual who leads by example, drives conceptual thinking, and brings a curiosity and experimental approach to solving engineering challenges. You enjoy building new features and writing elegant code. If this describes you--you belong at Carta.

We have open positions in Fall and Winter and we will be reaching out to you in July regarding this role.

Excited to talk to you!

About us:

We're developing a cloud platform that runs any graphical applications, regardless of the desktop environment or device. Our goal is to provide a seamless experience to users, so they can run their favourite programs without installing anything on their personal devices.

In short, we're making it possible for you to access your favorite desktop applications in the same way you'd stream or share a video.

About the role:

We are looking for highly motivated Software Engineering Interns to work alongside our small team of engineers and gain invaluable insights on how to build a scalable and high-performance software platform.
The internship is for 4 to 6 months starting now and can be converted into a full-time position :)
We take internships seriously, and you will have serious mentoring. On top of that, you will be able to see how an ambitious startup rises.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.
As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to drive human learning, Quantcast provides brand marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions across the customer journey.
As a part of the Software Engineering Internship program, you will lead a specialized project while having the mentorship of Engineers from different technical backgrounds. These Engineers have a real passion for technology, solving significant problems, and want to make a tangible impact.
You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

Responsibilites

  • Our unique 10 to 12 weeks summer internship program provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the ad tech industry while being fully integrated into a team
  • You will have full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the entire engineering organization
  • We will pair you with a dedicated mentor on your team to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and educational feedback
  • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events. We believe in order to grow and be successful having access to all resources is key!
  • You will participate in fun and memorable events with fellow interns, mentors, and full-timers. Past events have included Cable Car Trolley Tours, volunteering, CAL Academy, scavenger hunts, and Giants games. While we do work hard we love to have fun!
  • We offer perks, which include intern housing stipend, snacks and drinks, catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours

Requirements

  • Excellent command of one or more programming languages: Java, C++ or Python
  • Deep understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Graduation date between Dec 2020 and June 2022

Through the summer you'd be working with all our engineers, participating in sprints meeting, standup and sprint.

First, please visit liveconvos.tv

Prefered qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
  • Computer Science fundamentals in OO design, functional programming, data structure, and algorithm design
  • Knowledge of web applications and frontend technologies

  • A passion for creating engaging, intuitive, efficient and highly usable user interfaces
  • Experience building rich data-driven web applications
  • Experience with Node.js and the NPM package ecosystem

When you think about your last doctor’s appointment, how much do you actually recall? If you’re like most people, you’ll likely forget over 40% of the conversation. Details fall through the cracks, generic printouts you receive end up in the trash, and important information never makes it to other doctors. Ultimately, you’re left needing to connect the dots in your care. That’s why we started Abridge with a simple thesis: if we can shift agency to consumers, we can help them stay on top of their health. When you use Abridge to record your health conversations, the conversations themselves become your medical record. It’s as easy as that.

We are looking for research interns to working on exciting NLP challenges using our large annotated proprietary healthcare datasets. You will be able to create/customize your internship research statement and collaborate with our in-house Machine Learning research team. At the end of the internship, you will also have the opportunity to publish your work at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, NAACL, and ACL.

The goal of the internship is to advance the state-of-the-art in one or many of the following research areas:

  • Dialog Understanding
  • Sequence-to-Sequence Modeling
  • Clinical Natural Language Processing
  • Information Extraction
  • Machine Learning using Ontologies or Knowledge graphs

Required Qualification:

  • Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in an MS or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or a related field
  • Must have at least one NLP machine learning paper submitted or published
  • Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
  • Ability to communicate complex research ideas in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

*Research internships are offered year-round with flexible durations

Compensation

  • $80,000-$100,000 per year

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and believe that "you need to taste good things to have good taste."

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Join a leading fintech company that’s democratizing real estate investing for all.

Fintor was founded with a simple idea: real estate investing markets should be accessible to all, not just the wealthy. Fintor is a mobile app to buy and sell fractional shares in real estate properties with as little as $5 per share within a few taps. We enable everyone to have access, liquidity, and clarity to the real estate markets that have traditionally been available to a selected few. Just as we focus on our customers, we also strive to create an inclusive environment where our employees can thrive and do impactful work.

You will be joining as one of the first interns at a fast growing startup backed by some of the most recognizable investors including 500 Startups, Graphene Ventures, Hustle Fund, celebrities like Manny Khoshbin, and more. We share the same investor as Robinhood, Lyft, Facebook, Snapchat, Udemy, Canva, Venmo and many more unicorns.

You will be working directly with the co-founders of Fintor. Learn more at https://fintor.com

*Please check out our website to get a better understanding of what we are building.

About the role
Our react native app intern helps us deliver on our mission by creating high quality code and outstanding user experiences. As an intern, you’ll work directly with our team on projects and products from ideation to rollout, and beyond. Security and simplicity is core to Fintor’s mission on the engineering team and critical to how we build our products from inception and design to deployment in the cloud. This role will work closely with our CTO to build beautiful user experiences, highly performant, scalable systems, and develop state of the art support software to power Fintor’s trading engine. Internships are about learning and at Fintor you will learn about startups and what goes on behind the scenes in working with serial entrepreneur founders.

In this role you will be

  • Build customer facing features in our React Native applications for iOS and Android, working with native modules when required.
  • Write and maintain clean, tested, and well-documented code.
  • Work with the mobile app serverless backend on a modern cloud infrastructure and integrate with internal and third-party APIs.
  • Collaborate with UX design and implement designs with clean, modern transitions that provide an excellent user experience.
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs, ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application at scale.
  • Work with CI/CD pipelines for testing and deployments.

We are looking for

  • Someone that believes in our mission with a positive mindset and understanding of the early-stage startup environment.
  • Development experience for high-quality production React Native projects.
  • Experience with serverless architecture on a AWS cloud infrastructure, including integrating with API.
  • Proficient in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES 6), NodeJs, React Native, Expo and experience in related tools like Redux, REST, GraphQL, and Git.
  • Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, and testing platforms.
  • A strong passion for creating innovative user features and interactions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Benefits

  • An opportunity to join a fast-growing fintech startup that is changing the world of finance and real estate investing.
  • Learn about every aspect of building a company by working directly with founders.
  • A seat at the table to share your ideas and make your voice heard.
  • Be part of a company with a real mission you can be proud of.

We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities that we serve, where each team member is empowered to come to work as their true self. Diverse teams are more successful, which is why Fintor aims to be a leader in workplace equality and move both our company and the industry forward.

ABOUT US
At ZaiNar, we’re leveraging patented innovations using software-defined radios and advanced signal processing to build revolutionary new products in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing. Our imaginative team has developed the world’s most precise network time synchronization and distribution capabilities – wirelessly syncing to sub-nanosecond accuracy. We’re solving leading edge problems in RF location tracking and network communications. Our initial target market is asset tracking in dynamic industrial environments ($10B+), and the opportunities beyond that are endless. ZaiNar already complies with release 16 of 3GPP standards for 5G, to enable ZaiNar location tracking for any 5G-NR device without hardware changes. ZaiNar is VC-backed by tier 1 funds including Softbank, and has graduated from multiple accelerator programs including StartX, Alchemist, and Plug and Play.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace, where the best idea wins, is important to us. So, come join a curious, collaborative, and forward-thinking team, where everyone has the freedom to shape their own future, our company‘s, and the world’s – one nanosecond at a time.

THE ROLE
Join a team of brilliant engineers developing the next generation of networked software-defined radio systems to support ZaiNar’s super-precise network time distribution capabilities. We are seeking an Engineering Intern for Summer 2021. ZaiNar is looking for highly motivated software interns to be a part of a star team. Our company is seeking self-starters who are interested in owning real engineering projects during their internship. ZaiNar Engineering is in an important phase of product development, and there are many interesting projects. A well-matched intern will bring excitement, curiosity, and flexibility to the role.

We are prepared for, and flexible with, working from home. Due to the pandemic, the role will be partially or fully remote, but we do have an office in downtown Redwood City, CA that is open with strict safety guidelines in place and in compliance with all the current local, state, and CDC regulations.

COMPELLING ATTRIBUTES
● Studying computer science, EE, or related fields towards a post-graduate degree (PhD preferred)
● Strong data analytics, signal processing and/or wireless communication background
● Familiarity with super-resolution algorithms for angle of arrival estimation
● Background in estimation theory and statistical signal processing
● Solid knowledge of convex and non-convex optimization techniques
● Experience with Python, C++, and comparable programming languages
● Experience with Linux development environment
● Experience with radio hardware (hobby or professional)
● Ability to be a self-starter and solve problems proactively
● Excited about working in an agile, startup work environment
● Ability to work independently and provide creative solutions
● Excited about deploying tech in multiple test environments and locations
● Fluency in English (written and spoken)

ALSO INTERESTING
● Web development and data visualization
● Embedded firmware experience
● Hardware build skills
● Knowledge of RF lab equipment

Please note, this role will be virtual for Summer 2021. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply!

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds.

Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Site Reliability Engineer internship position is responsible for a variety of process and infrastructure initiatives, including platform maintenance and enhancements for our flagship cloud-based genomics product, automating existing pipelines to improve efficiency and long-term ecosystem health, performing software updates across our AWS platform, and ensuring that managed assets are performing as expected through the use of telemetry, automated alerts, and self-healing infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an intern, your job duties may involve some or many of the below duties:

  • Ensure that the infrastructure supporting our genomics platform is highly available, scalable, and maintainable
  • Maintain and extend existing configuration management deployments
  • Perform software installations using existing infrastructure and configuration management tools
  • Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to migrate existing deployment tools into a fully automated and managed process
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to extend and enhance existing CI/CD pipelines
  • Work directly with the DevOps team and software engineers to ensure system integrity
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve telemetry gathering, reporting, and alerting
  • Follow all best practices and procedures as established by company
  • Review, understanding, and compliance with Invitae HIPAA Security policies and procedures
  • Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data
  • Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology

EXPERIENCE

As an intern, you should be familiar with many of the items below, though it is also expected that many of these skills would be developed while serving in this position:

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience
  • 3 years in an SRE/DevOps role, or related IT or operations field
  • Familiar with Linux and Bash
  • Familiar with configuration management tools (e.g. Salt, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Familiar with AWS tools and infrastructure (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS, Lambda, and CloudWatch)
  • Familiar with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and scripting languages (Python strongly preferred)
  • Familiar with IAC tools such as Terraform (preferred)
  • Familiar with containerized systems in a cloud environment
  • Familiar with Scrum and Agile development methodologies
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Drive and determination
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively to enhance the success of the projects and maintain strong relationships within all parts of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-starter
  • Driven to perform
  • Able to organize, prioritize, and delegate tasks to efficiently move projects forward

EDUCATION

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience

position: Data Science Intern, Decision Science (Fall 2021) - Canada
description:
Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

At Coursera, our Data Science team is helping to build the future of education through data-driven decision making and data-powered products. We drive product and business strategy through measurement, experimentation, and causal inference. We define, develop, and launch the models and algorithms that power content discovery, personalized learning, and machine-assisted teaching and grading. We believe the next generation of teaching and learning should be personalized, accessible, and efficient. With our scale, data, technology, and talent, Coursera and its Data Science team are positioned to make that vision a reality.

We are looking for a creative and collaborative Data Science intern to accelerate decision science at Coursera. During this full-time 16-week internship program, you will be embedded as a full-time member of our Data Science team and paired with a mentor. You will work on real features and build internal tools that inform our decision about how best to serve our 68+ million learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from one of the following Canadian provinces: Ontario, British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, or Saskatchewan. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and share internal reporting for Data Scientists and Product Managers to better understand how learners are interacting with our product
  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, and other Data Scientists to identify opportunities to improve learner experiences on Coursera
  • Design and analyze experiments that will evaluate new features and inform product direction
  • Distill insights from complex data, communicating findings to technical and non-technical audiences

Basic Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related field and returning to the program after the internship
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL for data retrieval

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python)
  • Experience with at least one statistical software package (e.g. R, NumPy/SciPy/Pandas)
  • Experience with explaining technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Experience with designing clear and informative data visualizations
  • Project management and cross-functional collaboration skills

If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:

  • Marketing Analytics
  • Data-Driven Decision Making

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Your main objectives will be the design and implementation of a deep-learning based framework that uses mobile sensor data to perform user-authentication. Apart from the raw sensor data itself, certain high-level aspects related to the user like the walking patterns, phone handling, daily life events, etc. would help identify the real user of the device. Depending on the duration of the internship, you might additionally have the opportunity to gain a first-hand experience of deploying the framework you develop, on a device (mobile phone) and evaluate real-time performance. Zighra transforms mobile sensor data into human-relatable intelligence, and hence this project sits at the heart of its technology.

At Zighra, we're creating something new, something connected, and something with global impact. Zighra has been granted several patents in the sensor based authentication space with over 100+ citations from organizations like Google, Paypal ,Square, IBM, MS, Intel, Mastercard, Blackberry and Alibaba among others. We're a small team with big goals.

As a deep learning intern on the Zighra team, you will push the boundaries of marketing AI, machine learning, sensors and UX. If you are looking to tackle big problems alongside some of the most dynamic, talented people you've ever worked with? Join us!

Desired skills and expertise:

  • Strong background in math and an analytical mindset.
  • Passion for solving challenging deep learning problems.
  • Ability to quickly qualitatively and quantitatively assess a problem.
  • Ability to work productively with team members, identify and resolve tough - issues in a collaborative manner.
  • Basic knowledge of Python and Tensorflow.

Bonus Knowledge and Skills:

  • Being familiar with MySQL, MongoDB.
  • Previous research experience in Machine Learning specifically anomaly detection is a big plus.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We are an Autonomous Delivery Vehicle start-up having teams from several countries like the USA, India, Armenia, etc. We’re looking for a strong mechanical engineer intern to join our organization. Our ideal candidate will have experience with the entire product lifecycle, ushering mechanical solutions from research and design through implementation.

OBJECTIVE OF THE ROLE

  • Analyze mechanical problems and produce innovative solutions using multiple fabrications and material methods, including injection molding, aluminum castings, machined parts, and sheet metal
  • Oversee and engage in product development from design and development through implementation, monitoring progress and status of all assignments and report progress and problems to management
  • Evaluate mechanical designs for potential flaws and offer modifications to eliminate potential problems
  • Comply with all federal regulations and maintain organizational values and standards

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work on product-sustaining projects, which involve replacement or redesign for obsolete components, product improvement features, cost reduction, manufacturing support, and field complaints
  • Prepare assembly or product layout and detailed drawings, and participate in the manufacture or building of prototype product or system
  • Provide tolerances studies, apply GD&T, conduct stress-analysis studies, develop reliability testing procedures, and generates appropriate design verification reports
  • Design testing methods to analyze product capabilities and troubleshoot any mechanical or structural flaws
  • Ensure that design implementation, test, and maintenance methods/processes are developed and executed in a manner that supports company quality standards
  • Participate in scheduled department meetings to report the progress of the overall project or portion of the project, and prepare and give design presentations, and mentor junior engineers

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering and relevant professional experience
  • Working knowledge of analytic tools, such as ANSYS and ProMechanica
  • Working knowledge of core engineering concepts, including, but not limited to, mechanics, materials science, and thermodynamics
  • Proven experience with product development and the entirety of the product life cycle
  • Strong ability with computer-aided design systems, including CAM and CAE

BONUS QUALIFICATIONS

  • Master’s degree or a Ph.D in mechanical engineering
  • Experience developing innovative solutions to a range of mechanical problems
  • Experience designing ground vehicle body parts.

TERM
This is an unpaid internship with about 20 hours weekly commitment. The best candidate later will be offered a full-time position.**

APPLICATION PROCEDURES
Interested candidates are welcome to apply for this position by submiting resume and a cover letter using this link.

The Team
Since our founding in 2015, Codecov has evolved from a one person team to a distributed remote family. We have team members all across the world and we’re committed to building disruptive testing tools and code coverage reports that will allow developers to ship healthier code. Similar to the customers we serve, Codecov is a diverse group of curious and creative individuals. Join us on a mission to devise, validate, and oversee the creation of software testing and code coverage products.

The Opportunity
Codecov is searching for an intern to work with our Software Engineering team.

Our engineering team is grouped into three focus areas: The frontend, the core APIs, and the worker. The frontend team is responsible for everything the users sees after they log into codecov (Awesome Dashboards, Insightful Coverage Metrics) The Core API team is in charge of making sure that Codecov reliably handles all API and incoming webhooks requests and the worker team makes sure that all our asynchronous jobs process flawlessly (Calculating Coverage, Setting statuses on the git providers)

The internships focus depends on your interest and you will ship code on products used by over 1M people.

  • Frontend (React.JS)
  • API (Python, Django REST framework, Django, Postgres, Kubernetes, Envoy)
  • Worker (Python, Celery, Postgres, Kubernetes)

This opportunity is conducive for university students looking for a summer internship, but we can also support non-university students for a similar time frame (3-6 months).

Requirements

  • 0-2 years of computer science learning AND/OR software work in a corporation
  • Some combination of experience in React.JS and/or Python

Our Benefits

  • Employer stipend for work computer
  • Remote workforce anywhere from GMT-8 to GMT+3

Orangewood Labs is design-led and a Y Combinator backed tech startup based out of San Francisco and Noida that creates affordable robotic arms for SMEs. We are looking for kickass interns for the summer, if you have a burning flare for robotics then Orangewood Labs is the place for you. Spend your summer internship period with us and explore cutting edge robotics technology!

Skills/Knowledge:

  1. C/C++/Python
  2. Embedded systems work experience with ATm168/ATm328/Arm Cortex
  3. Knowledge of voltmeter, diode, oscilloscope, DC motors, motor driver
  4. Have done projects related to robotics(2 or 3 minimum)
  5. PCB designing using kicad/Orcad/Altium by following PCB standard,
  6. Bom preparation and components finalizing,
  7. Till the time of PCB and components delivery, start preparing flowchart and algorithm designing,
  8. Preparing all library file for the project in Atmel studio and assigning pins in code by pin.h
  9. Linking all library and start writing code for main and ISR
  10. Testing and troubleshooting of Pcb, debugging code by programming Pcb using programmer module
  11. Well documentation skills, attention to detail.

Eligibility: Third Year/Fourth Year B. E./B. Tech. Students and First/Second Year M.E./M. Tech Students.

We are a virtual reality language learning platform called Gabb Global. www.gabbglobal.com We are looking for a front-end developer intern that can help us create language learning experiences for students across the country. Though this internship is unpaid, once we get funding, you will be offered a full time. We are a team of 13. We want to launch our app in August, and we are doing pilots at UC Davis right now. You’ll work with our front and back end team to tackle unique Gabb Global's technical challenges! You will work with a fun and diverse team to build intelligent software used by hundreds of students in California. The goal here is to deliver and develop the most impressive language learning experience for our user. As one of our strategic leaders, the Content Strategist is in charge of a broad scope of product-related activities: We are looking to hire a driven content strategist to develop and execute content strategies that drive traffic and generate leads. The content strategist's responsibilities include determining which formats best communicate various types of content, identifying ways to increase brand awareness, and conducting keyword research. You should also analyze user engagement metrics to determine whether the content is well-received or not.
To be successful as a content strategist, you should collaborate with the marketing team to develop innovative ideas. Ultimately, an outstanding content strategist should demonstrate exceptional content presentation skills and be able to work well under pressure.

Content Strategist Responsibilities:

  • Developing clear and engaging content that is consistent with the company's brand image and addresses both business goals and consumer needs.
  • Analyzing content marketing data to identify trends and anticipate consumer needs.
  • Performing content audits to assess how well existing content is performing.
  • Performing content gap analyses to determine what type of content is missing and what is needed.
  • Delegating tasks to writers and editors and providing feedback.
  • Creating, adjusting, and managing the editorial calendar.
  • Establishing style guides that specify the writing style and tone needed to create engaging content.
  • Developing a solid understanding of the target audience through online and traditional market research.

Content Strategist Requirements:

*** Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, advertising, journalism, or related field.

  • Proven content strategy and project management experience.
  • Sound knowledge of content management systems, keyword research tools, social media platforms, search engine optimization (SEO), and search engine marketing (SEM).
  • The ability to work under pressure.
  • Strong content presentation skills.
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills.
  • Excellent analytical skills.
  • Exceptional marketing and collaborative skills.
  • Effective communication skills

position: Gabb Global UX UI Design Intern

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • San Francisco • Remote

description:
Who we are

Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners.Help us shape the future of education using or virtual reality language learning experiences. Our mission is to make language education accessible, engaging, and immersive for everyone in the world. From grammar schools in England to public high schools in the US and thousands of total users worldwide, Gabb Global is the most immersive way to learn a language online. As a UX UI designer at Gabb Global, you'll help create and define a cohesive user experience throughout products like Gabb Global, the Gabb Global website, and our apps. You will impact our pilot users by working on real projects while developing your career through hands-on learning and mentorship. You will help design the website that we will use to launch in August of this year.

What you'll do

  • Work on the user experience across multiple Gabb Global products, mobile, and web
  • Work closely with other designers to develop and expand product design patterns
  • Develop both broadly defined, loose concepts, as well as on narrowly defined, tactical features
  • Collaborate on projects with a wide variety of product teams
  • Past Projects include:
  • Stories and Leaderboards on Android
  • Improving and adding components to our design system
  • Adding animated characters to our lessons
  • Launching new courses, like Hindi and Indonesian
  • Improving the UI/UX of the Gabb Global website
  • Designing the experience of Gabb Global Events (online or in-person gatherings)
  • Help engineers and product managers define both the long-term strategy and the short-term tactics for our products
  • Sometimes work on very broadly defined, loose concepts, and sometimes on narrowly defined, tactical features
  • Work in a highly collaborative fashion with the design and product teams
  • Consider all parts of the experience, from copy to animations to business model, when designing

**What we're looking for

  • An online portfolio with mobile app design samples
  • Talent for designing user-centered products that look great too
  • A desire to constantly advance your work and attend to all the details
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Why you'll love working here
  • Collaborating closely with world-class product designers
  • Language learning opportunities**
  • Someone who is looking to grow within the company
  • Someone who loves learning languages

You have
An online portfolio with web or app design samples
Design experience in a consumer application, product, or software role
A desire to keep pushing your work until all details are attended to
The ability to explain your work, process, and decisions and seek feedback to help you produce your best work
The ability to work remotely

Exceptional candidates will have...

2+ years of experience working at a high-paced tech start-up
Experience with illustration or animation (or both)
Experience participating in or leading user research sessions
Loves building language learning products

Whether on the go, in the subway, or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colorful by the day, ensuring users see themselves reflected —not just in our product but also in the world, allowing them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Gabb. We currently have fifteen people from more than six nationalities working in New York, Los Angeles, and D.C., challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to connecting with more users in every hemisphere. As we complete our pilots at universities, we need someone to create fun immersive social media content to provide a refreshing language learning experience to our customers for our launch in 2021. We are looking for a talented Social media intern to join our team and create and maintain a robust online presence for Gabb Global. Your role is to implement online marketing strategies through social media accounts. As a Social media coordinator, you will develop original content and suggest creative ways to attract more customers and promote our brand. Ultimately, you should increase web traffic and customer engagement metrics aligned with broader marketing strategies.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As al Back End Developer Spring/Summer Intern you:

  • Are experienced with client-server architectures, networking protocols, application development, and using databases.
  • Have experience using and developing APIs.
  • Understand user and system requirements
  • Have an understanding of or experience with, Agile development methodology.

What You'll Do:

  • You'll work in a dynamic, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code, and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.
  • Design and code servers, services, applications, and databases that are reusable, scalable, and meet critical architecture goals.
  • Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use.
  • Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large-scale systems and Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Who You Are:

  • You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products. Problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • You have a basic understanding of software development and programming languages.
  • You can learn new skills quickly and use the skills efficiently.

More about us here : bit.ly/workatjarapp

Requirements

  • You have the knowledge of developing trends and emerging standards in mobile apps (RxJava, MVP, Kotlin, etc), mobile payments, wearables
  • You have excellent technical knowledge of Java for Android, Android SDK and AndroidStudio
  • Pro with Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
  • You have good understanding of RESTful APIs and how to connect Android applications to back-end services
  • Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
  • You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
  • You contribute to the design, architecture, and development of apps that are elegant, efficient, secure, highly available, and maintainable
  • You are highly motivated and maintain a positive, “can-do” attitude in a fast moving environment
  • You follow and help cultivate consistent development best practices
  • You have 1-2 years of app development experience in Android
  • You have experience shipping one or more android apps, ideally currently available on the Play Store.
  • Open source experience is a huge plus!

Perks

  • Competitive Stipend
  • Certificate and Letter of recommendation
  • Chance to work full-time at Jar
  • Merchandise: T-Shirts and Goodies

More about us : [https://bit.ly/workatjarapp]

Jar is hiring for a Full Stack Engineer Intern. Ideal candidate should have a strong knowledge of Javascript, React, Nodejs, Expressjs as well as experience building single-page web application with interest towards real-time frontend apps.

Requirements

  • 0-1 years of experience building Web apps on MERN stack
  • Fluency using Javascript, HTML/CSS, ReactJS, Nodejs, Expressjs etc.
  • Good understanding of how Client-Server architecture works. experience with WebSockets, AWS is a plus
  • A keen intuition for well designed software and beautiful, usable interfaces
  • Intrinsic motivation and the drive to solve difficult frontend problems
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Perks

  • Fully Remote 🌍
  • Paid Internship 💲
  • PPO if you could SHIP features fast 🎟️
  • You get to witness the global engineering scale 📈

position: ADVISOR - FULL STACK (FRONTEND/BACKEND) PROGRAMMER - Remote Volunteer
description:
ADVISOR — Remote Volunteer

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our mission is to facilitate alms and donations collection and distribution to help the elderly and people with disabilities who work in the informal sector to get better livelihood through micro-business management, giving them greater market exposure.

Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.
Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

ZAKKI is an online platform-based organization (website and mobile application) that is focused on helping the elderly and people with disabilities get better livelihoods to build inclusive communities in Indonesia. ZAKKI facilitates the collection and distribution of donations to help the elderly and people with disabilities working in the informal sector to obtain better livelihoods through the assistance of micro business management and giving them greater market exposure.

Currently, ZAKKI is developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

ZAKKI provides equal volunteering opportunity for everyone regardless of age, sex/gender, color, race, creed, nationality/origin, marital status, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit essential performance job functions. All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one’s ability to perform the job, as well as one’s dedication to ZAKKI’s Mission and needs.

We are recruiting VOLUNTEER as either DEVELOPER ADVISOR and or PROGRAMMER itself.

The DEVELOPER ADVISOR only required to give advice to the UIUX DESIGNER team concerning the feasibility a feature can be developed. We are not expecting the DEVELOPER ADVISOR to do coding (programming). While for the PROGRAMMER, the volunteer require contributing to the development of the product, means to do coding (programming) the product.

General Requirement:
• Keen, enjoy, and excited to contribute for social caused and social change.
• Thinker and Do-er person
• Abundance with idea and initiative working as a team
• Active, helpful and collaborative person (not passive person)
• Good time-management skills
• Communicative (good communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders)
• Proficiency in English
• Have competency to do their chosen role/position
• Open web standards technologies, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, including jQuery, Vue JS and other libraries,
• Able to use versioning control system such as GIT, GitLab, SVN

Specific Requirement:
Knowledge of one or more of these skills below:

PWA DEVELOPER :
• Server-side application development in PHP using frameworks such as Laravel
• Linux system administration, web server configuration, SQL database (Oracle or MySQL or PostgreSQL), No SQL (Mongo DB) and other common web stack technologies

MOBILE DEVELOPER:
• Java Programming
• Hybrid programming for Mobile such as Flutter, Ionic, React Native.

GAME DEVELOPER :
• OpenGL, Unity 3D, WebGL, and languages such as C, C++, and Java, JavaScript, HTML5, Swift
• Have competencies and interest in making games (2D/3D) with levelling system, Building Android app, understand iOS is a plus

https://forms.gle/iY7xUbf63QpmdTXb8

Please submit the Google Form with your CV/resume and portfolio URL link (Github/Gitlab).

After the submission, you still able to edit your submitted respond in case you need to update your supporting documents (i.e CV/Resume)

Data is far more useful when you can see it and interact with it. Rose is about creating a home for your data with an end-to-end system that allows you to find, engage with, and share data.

Rose is actively looking for front-end, back-end, and machine Learning interns to help design and build our data platform. Each intern will have a specific pre-assigned project in their chosen field.

For the Frontend position, we are looking for people with experience in D3, React, and data viz principles. The work will involve wireframing new features for our website, improving/replacing our existing UI/UX to help customers learn our tool better, and building new methods to visualize and explore data.

The backend position is perfect for individuals looking for experience in multi-cloud infrastructure, scaling, and optimization problems. You will work directly with a senior infrastructure engineer at Rose.

For the machine learning internship we are looking for folks with some experience/interest in working with medium/large data sets, and running open source machine learning algos to derive conclusions or add structure to data.

Training is significant part of our culture at Rose. We invest significant time developing and training interns.

Our office is in Manhattan, but depending on the candidate, we will consider remote internships as well.

position: Full Stack - Web and App Developer (Web, IOS and Android)
description:
We are looking for a seasoned full stack developer who is well versed in the latest web and mobile technologies and industry trends.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter who has built enterprise software and can drive projects end to end. This individual will be responsible for developing, testing, and debugging responsive web and mobile applications for our company. They will also be involved with management of more junior teammates who will help with development efforts.

The candidate who excels in this position will have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role with our company, potentially into the executive branch.

Responsibilities

  • Translate wireframes into high quality code
  • Write well documented, maintainable, and clean code
  • Ensure best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of application
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks in stack and fix bugs
  • Collaborate with UI/UX team to implement, launch, and iterate MVP solutions
  • Rapid development and automated test processes creation

Skills/Knowledge

  • Experience with iOS and Android Apps
  • Experience with web based apps
  • Ability to build back-end functionality
  • Experience with integration and use of APIs
  • Knowledge of web and mobile technology
  • Experience working remotely
  • At minimum, have knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript, React Native, React.js, native IOS and Android - Angular and Responsive Design

  • Practical experience in prototyping applications

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in web/app design and implementation
