Overview:

Potato TV is looking for a web developer intern to help develop the foundation of our social streaming product. The ideal applicant will have a passion for social media, streaming, and connecting people through the TV & movies they love. We are looking for people who want to work on a fun product & who want to make an immediate impact. Successful interns will have an ability to understand our technical approaches, provide innovative solutions, and build efficiently for the future.

Opportunities:

  • Agile development of app features based on customer segment analysis
  • Develop backend functionality & frontend experience for an interactive messaging, video, and audio mobile application
  • Contribute to product design processes (ideation, user journeys, roadmapping, etc…) & learn how they are implemented into product development.
  • Troubleshooting and debugging issues that arise using industry standards
  • Develop, maintain, & update technical documentation for team members
  • Build a social platform experience across mobile & web app surfaces
  • Learn and apply software design and development concepts to our mobile application

About you:

  • Minimum Education: currently enrolled in or have previously completed a BS in computer science. (Currently enrolled in or completed an MS in CS is preferred)
  • Familiarity with front-end development – React.js, HTML, CSS and JS
  • Familiarity with using APIs for payments, chat, video streaming, & websockets.
  • Experience working in cloud computing - GCP/firebase & building backend models with noSQL DBs & node JS.
  • Great communication: ability to breakdown technical concepts effectively to non-technical founders
  • Mindset: Human-centered design - Put the user at the center of development
  • Collaborative: With other engineers on projects to seamlessly build a cohesive product using industry standard tools and processes
  • Ability to break down requirements and implement whole features

Commitment:

  • Time: 10-20 hours/week
  • Duration: 10-12 weeks
  • Role: Unpaid internship
  • Location: Remote

Interested in working on hard problems at scale?

We are looking for current and graduating MSc/PhD students who would like to work with us on a research project. You should have some prior practical industry experience, strong coding and software engineering skills, as well as a publications in relevant CV/ML conferences or journals.

IMI builds ML products and services used by some of the largest companies in the world. Come learn from our veteran team of machine learning and distributed systems experts, hailing from Stanford, MIT, Apple, and Cloudera.

We are now opening applications for our 2020 ML Fellows/Interns program. You will be expected to work remotely: we have a large distributed workforce working alongside the teams in our San Francisco, Berlin, or Helsinki centers, and we are highly comfortable with remote collaboration.

We conduct original research in areas like unsupervised and active learning, motivated by the unique problems and datasets we have access to as one of the larger users of cloud resources for ML.

You will have the opportunity to publish with our scientists if your work yields results, and we have a strong commitment to open source code and (when possible) datasets.

Research interests:
A background in representation learning, theoretical computer vision, or statistical physics will be helpful, as well as applied applications of Deep Learning to Computer Vision problems.

Current areas of interest include Active Learning, Self- and Semi-supervised learning, Uncertainty Estimation (Bayesian Neural Networks), Anomaly detection, Deep Hashing for Image Retrieval, Weak Supervision, Zero-shot learning, Domain Adaptation, Meta-Learning.

Functional skills:
We work primarily in Python for research, with pyTorch and Tensorflow being our preferred tools. You will have access to our in-house distributed training and inference infrastructure, which has been designed for ease of use but still benefits from basic knowledge of distributed systems.
Experience with cloud-based training and dealing with preprocessing huge datasets is beneficial.

We also strive for a high degree of programming competence within our research group, as we have found that good discipline in implementing ideas makes your task easier and collaboration more pleasant. If you are one of the many excellent researchers who have never written a unit test this will likely change.

Please send your CV, github, and a brief description of what most interests you, along with your dates of availability and preferred location.

IMI does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, or marital status.

8 hours per week! Weekends and evenings!


Work on live software used by our customers.
Work with the engineering team.
Learn the codebase.
Analyze code defects.
Design defect solutions and implement them.
Code test.

Work hard. Be a team player. Serve the clients. Build your career.

We help with career coaching, resume review, recommendation, and references.

Overview

TABS Suite, a Diligence-as-a-Service platform, is a small but powerful team that goes beyond observation and recommendation, focused on helping startups and current / future investors make better business decisions to identify and mitigate issues through our product, the TABS Score (www.tabsscore.com).

We are relentless in uncovering new opportunities to help them achieve greater returns. Our deep knowledge and expertise stem largely from personal experience building independent ventures over the past decade and advising and investing in many across a variety of industries. We value evidence over opinion, and our team of intellectually curious overachievers works tirelessly to provide clear and effective solutions and strategies. As TABS rapidly gains market traction, we are looking for our Spring/Summer '21 software engineering interns to help mold and augment our existing platform.

What you will do:

• Work on a small team of 3-6 engineers, responsible for entire modules of the Toast product
• Build, and maintain high performance, flexible, and highly scalable web and mobile applications
• Participate in designing, estimating effort, implementing, testing, debugging, configuring, integrating and documenting database, middle-tier and front-end code
• Diagnose performance bottlenecks and implement optimizations
• Think in terms of the end-user and design accordingly
• Actively contribute to product design and feature selection discussions
• Participate in code reviews to ensure technical implementations meet functional requirements

Program Requirements:

• Currently enrolled in an academic program
• Deep self-learning software development experience
• Mobile software development experience a plus
• Well-versed in tiered web application architecture and databases
• Proficient / Fluent in the web front-end basics - HTML, CSS and JavaScript

We are looking for an Angular Developer to join our team, one who strives to develop a firstclass codebase using angular best practices. The primary focus will be to implement a complete user interface in the form of a mobile app and desktop web design.

Even if you don't fulfill all of this, if you have the drive to learn and are interested in the vision of Plant3r, please apply.

Apply now

Using Swift to re-connect millions hearing impaired people

Ava has seen its biggest product and design growth yet and is looking for a new teammate to help improve and enhance our iOS application. If you want to make the world more accessible through great iOS & iPadOS UX then this is the opportunity to leave a mark and make a difference, to use design and technology in order to help those in need of accessibility.

We are looking to hire a talented iOS developer to design, build, and maintain the next generation of our iOS app. Your primary focus will be developing high-end features for the latest Apple mobile devices. Your duties includes collaborating with the design team for new application features, identifying and fixing application bottlenecks, maintaining the core code, and updating the application published on the App Store.

You'd be perfect for this role if:

  • You have a BS in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent
  • You have experience in Swift and Objective-C
  • You're diligent and patient, have an eye for detail, and passion for a high-quality finish.
  • You have a good sense of UX and care about users
  • You are passionate about Apple's eco-system and technologies (CocoaTouch, Cocoa etc.)
  • You have a good understanding of basic frameworks such as Foundation, UIKit.

Bonus ✨

  • Experience with AWS, Firebase etc.
  • Experience with Node.js, Typescript
  • Experience with CoreAudio & CoreData
  • MS in Computer Science

So... what will you do as an iOS developer at Ava?

  • You will help transition from a hybrid code base (Objective-C + Swift) to a 100% Swift code base.
  • You will help create a standalone iPadOS application
  • You will help scale Ava as a key communication service millions of deaf/hard-of-hearing users & their peers can rely on.
  • You will implement new designs for existing and new features

What the first 3 months may look like: 🏃‍♀️

  • You will work on a Calendar integration to provide users with meaningful notifications when their meetings or events are about to start.
  • You will help on re-designing the onboarding experience
  • You will be assigned bug reports and fix issues

What's special about this role?

  • Actually change lives at an unprecedented scale: How often do you hear about apps that make people cry of joy? It is really for us a unique opportunity and privilege to be able to meaningfully improve the lives of 100,000s of people - and yet to still be at the very beginning of our mission!
  • Join us at an incredible time: We're well-funded and hit product-market fit, which gives us a huge green field to work with. You'd join at the perfect time to shape what we build and how we grow, so we can create a more inclusive world.
  • Work with some of the best people in the world: We have an incredibly talented and passionate team that is a lot of fun to work with. We're still super small and have accomplished some things that were thought impossible!
  • Tackle our most interesting and impactful problems: Our team is still small, and people wear many hats. You'd jump between product, marketing, internal tools, process — participating in every phase from inception to implementation. Absolutely no boredom.

description:
Who Are We?

Sanomind is building an audio creator platform for licensed mental health professionals. Think, Patreon for therapists.

We are an open platform where any licensed mental health professional can sign up, create, publish, and earn money from their audio content.

We respect the seriousness of mental health, but we want to make it as fun and cool as going to the gym to work on your physical body.

We're not just another mental health startup, company or directory. We're building a brand and a culture. Not just inside the company, but beyond.

Still with us? Keep reading : )

What's important to us?

We care deeply about the people who are lost and looking for answers. The people who can't afford therapy, but need a little guidance.

We want to help people who can afford therapy find the right therapist.

We care about our partners; the licensed mental health professionals on our platform and the future members.

We're looking for someone that is passionate about using technology for good. You like going in the opposite direction. You don't follow the crowd or what's "in." You start trends and create new lanes. You have ideas and more importantly, you execute on those ideas.

And of course, you are fascinated by the brain and excited about mental health and wellness.

• Actively participating in test suite and test run design for both mobile and web application
• Develop, modify, and execute automated and manual test cases
• Prepare test statistics documentation
• Research and provide astute client software/upgrade recommendations
• Working on MixPanel to analyze the user activities and site traffic

• Understanding of basic software engineering concepts, software testing life cycles, and Agile development
• Knowledge of open source concepts, relational databases, and web/mobile technologies with experience in any of the following areas being a bonus: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, Appsync, AWS Amplify

• Meticulous attention to detail is required
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Proactive, team player able to work adeptly in a fast-paced environment
• Passion for quality assurance and testing of internet websites
• Ability to quickly grasp technical concepts and master new technologies

We are pre-revenue, so there is no salary at the moment

Sisu network is a Ethereum compatible network that allows people deploy smart contract with very low transaction cost. In addition, Sisu leverages Threshold Signature Scheme (TSS) that enables decentralized coin swapping between 2 different chains without going through the hassle of KYC process.

This position allows you to dig deep into Ethereum source code or explore Cosmos's core or how to implement a TSS signing. There are many jobs out there that requires you to write simple smart contracts but they will not be near the level of challenges that this position offers.

If you are a great engineer and want to get into blockchain space, this position is a perfect step for you.

In you application, show me the your AMAZING projects or achievement you have got (e.g. competitive programming prizes or complicated open source Github project you have built).

You will work with me complete the project and launch the testnet. Blockchain is a fast moving space. You will work really hard but also learn a lot.

About LocalScale
LocalScale is an organisation focusing on the development of resilient and sustainable local economies through the use of technology, science and regenerative activities.
Our vision is that, given the challenges faced by our civilisation, the depletion of natural resources, and the decline of fossil energies, the transformation of our societies will only be possible through positivist approaches and intrinsically guided by principles of sustainable/regenerative and ethical development of local communities, while respecting and restoring natural ecosystems and promoting diversity and inclusion.
In order to achieve this vision, LocalScale offers an inclusive, free-to-access organisation and a platform that will promote the creation and use of local products, that will provide local economic alternatives to traditional financial systems, that will foster local entrepreneurship and local communities while advocating for social equality and social justice.
LocalScale is based in San Francisco, California, USA.

I won't bore you here with the list of Java skills you need to have for this role: if you're a Java hacker and know the latest tricks on the stack. we're good. Above all our organisation wants to attract individuals who are inspired to change the status quo, who care about the human and natural ecosystems and believe that their action can contribute to change and make a significant impact.

We still have a very small team but a strong supporting community around the world. Our organisation is guided by 3 foundational principles:

*** The Theory of Small Wins: we know that the task before us is massive but we move fast and celebrate every little victory along the way, because every win is part of a more global step in the right direction.
*** The Two Loop Theory of Organizational Change: this theory suggest that change emerges in human systems out of a spontaneous series of local actions, and these local actions spontaneously link together both organically and purposefully in ways that facilitate the development of integrated networks of relationships that are aligned in the pursuit of mutual interests and goals.

  • The Theory Positive Change Cycle: this one refers to the cycle of emotions experienced when someone discovers that important change is upcoming, and demonstrates the importance of being an actor of that change as a way to transform the negative emotions into positive ones.

We're are building a different kind of organisation. If you are interested in discussing, tell us a bit about your experience, about what motivates you and we'll reach out to discuss the opportunity.

position: Frontend UI / UX / DX Engineering Intern
description:
Location: At the moment, we are all working remotely. However, our headquarters are in New York, and this position will be based in NYC once we are back to working in-person.

About OpenFin

OpenFin is a fast-growing financial technology company backed by the world’s largest banks and most respected Fintech VCs, including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, HSBC, Wells Fargo, SC Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, DRW, Nyca Partners, and Pivot Investment Partners. OpenFin modernizes and democratizes app development and distribution in the finance space. We provide a secure OS that brings a fast and intuitive app experience to the financial desktop. Built on Google’s Chromium and GitHub’s Electron open source projects, OpenFin combines native experience, data sharing, lightning-fast distribution, and robust security with an agile web development and deployment model to accelerate digital transformation and innovation. OpenFin is used by thousands of developers to deploy and run more than 1200 apps at more than 1500 financial institutions.

About the Role

We are looking for a frontend engineer to join our Product Engineering team who is excited about learning new languages, frameworks and technologies.

Responsibilities

Work covers a range of interests and areas of expertise that can scale to what you would like to learn! The following are three area

  • Contribute to the OpenFin UI Library—architect and build accessible, extensible, and well-tested React components used in several OpenFin products shipping this year.
  • Help shape the OpenFin Developer Experience—build out automation and testing, documentation, prototypes, and give tech talks. Help optimize and build engineering processes and community knowledge product engineering teams working with the UI Library.
  • Contribute to building new features—deliver a best-in-class user experience in OpenFin products.

What We’re Looking For

  • A user-focused, empathetic person who wants to collaborate, write, talk, and dream about code that people will love to use.
  • Comfortable building React components and a passion for making them pixel perfect.
  • Awareness of accessibility best practices, progressive enhancement, the DOM / Shadow DOM and how React “works” under the hood.
  • Familiarity and an interest in using Typescript, Styled Components, and Framer Motion.
  • An interest in learning cross-platform development for Mac and Windows using Electron and modern tools and frameworks like Webpack and NextJS.
  • It would be very cool if you’re opinionated / excited about well-tested frontend code (Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library), automation, or other aspects of frontend ops—the force multipliers that make other engineers love working together.

A few of our Product Engineering values

  • Code with Empathy—write your code thinking about the person who might use it next, that person might be you ;)
  • Don’t follow the GPS into the lake—be intuitive and critical, be human when you work, especially when taking an empirical point of view.
  • Don’t take all of the blame—when software breaks, we’re all on the hook. Another way to say this is there are no gatekeepers. We share knowledge, responsibility, and an excitement for fixing things when they inevitably go sideways.

Life at OpenFin

At OpenFin, our mission is to stay on the cutting edge of web technologies and to enable our customers to do the same. While we are currently remote, we pride ourselves on our friendly, diverse, understanding office culture. Our goal is to create a space where employees can learn and innovate, and overall, have a good time doing it. Our employees have a diverse set of interests and experiences, and we encourage you to explore those interests and share with us! We have regular happy hours and social events. Our office and our employees are conducive to a productive learning experience -- all the while creating innovative and compelling solutions for our clients.

We are looking to hire a bunch of Machine Learning Interns who will be working in Natural Language Processing and Speech synthesis domains.
Expected outcome could be a published research paper in top conferences/journal.

You will work in direct collaboration with Software Engineers/ Data Scientists from Google/Facebook/Apple, etc from IIIT Hyderabad and IIT Bombay.

Preferred Qualities:-

  • Previous research track record (published papers, etc) is a strong plus.
  • Inclination towards solving hard research problems.
  • background in NLP or speech is bonus, but doesn't requires you to be an expert on them.

We are looking for sincerity and people who want to grow. If that sounds like you, apply rightaway. Looking forward to meet you ( :

You will work in direct collaboration with Software Engineers from Google/Facebook/Apple, etc and high rated Yellow competitive coders. All of us together, are innovating curiculum for DSA to create minimal effort maximum gain programming ladders by topic instead of currently available monolithic courses.
Work directly with co-founders and be a part of high growth startup.

Preferred Qualities:-

  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • Decent rating on Codeforces or Codechef.
  • Experience of setting/testing problems is a strong Plus!
  • Experience Agnostic - whether you are 1st year or full-time, it doesn't matters!

About Applied
Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you’ll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.

As the foremost enabler of autonomous vehicle development, Applied Intuition equips engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomy to market. Applied’s suite of products, focused on simulation and analytics, delivers sophisticated infrastructure built for scale. Companies of all sizes use Applied to comprehensively test and rapidly accelerate their autonomous vehicle development. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Tokyo, Munich, and Seoul, Applied is composed of software and automotive experts from the top companies in the world (such as Google, Amazon, Apple, Waymo, Tesla, Delphi, GM, and Bosch).

About the Role
(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

At Applied, you will:

  • Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows
  • Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
  • Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
  • Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
  • Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
  • Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)
  • Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middlewares (such as ROS)

We’re looking for passionate, hard-working individuals who aren’t afraid to go above and beyond each and every day for themselves and Arrive. This is an incredible opportunity for those interested in getting experience working with and learning from a highly ambitious and innovative technology team. You will get hands-on experience working directly with our groundbreaking Arrive Edge platform and impact the company in a huge way!

Why Arrive?

Fyusion is a machine learning & computer vision company that enables anyone to capture and display interactive 3D 360 images using their smartphone. Our unique 3D format allows for significant additional functionality that 2D images can’t offer, including: background image effects & automatic damage detection for cars, and an understanding of the human skeleton for tagging products & features in fashion E-commerce. Our investors and customers include large international conglomerates and industry leaders, which puts us in a unique and advantageous position. We have ambitious goals and are looking for new energetic team members to help us reach them together.

The Computer Vision team at Fyusion develops and applies state of the art algorithms in visualization, 3D reconstruction, SLAM, bundle adjustment, state estimation, and sensor fusion. We combine this with the efforts from our Machine Learning team to deliver an intelligent product which is loved by our customers.
We are looking for candidates who are excited about solving complex problems at the intersection of classical 3D geometry and Deep Learning. You will have the resources and opportunities to publish your work at major conferences.

Here are our requirements:

  • Experience with 3D geometry, SLAM, Structure from Motion, bundle adjustment, view synthesis
  • Proficient in C++, OpenCV

Bonus if you have experience with Computer Graphics:

  • NeRF (Representing Scenes as Neural Radiance Fields for View Synthesis)
  • Rendering photorealistic data
  • image based rendering
  • computational geometry

Here's what we can offer you:

Paid company holidays, commuter benefits, company catered lunches, a fully stocked snack pantry, team and company off-sites, but the most exciting: the chance to work on an incredible pioneering technology team that impacts user-facing services.

If you read this and think this is what you want to do, apply! If you read this, and think that you might need some help hitting all of the points, please apply! We have an entire team that is happy to mentor and share their knowledge with you.

Blink Health Pharmacy is a new tech-powered pharmacy revolutionizing the way people access prescription medicine. Our pharmacy is affiliated with Blink Health, which leverages its proprietary technology to provide users with access to low negotiated prices on over 15,000 medications.

Our core mission is to delight our customers and turn them into fans. We understand that in order to do this, we must work closely with pharmacies to ensure prescriptions can be processed quickly and effectively so our customers receive the best experience. You are Blink's champion with the pharmacy. You will field calls to and from pharmacies and prescribers, obtaining prescriptions for Blink’s patients.

We are looking to you to create positive relationships with our pharmacies by assisting them in filling our customers’ medications. This is your opportunity to join a health-tech enterprise. Apply your expertise outside of the retail space in a new and exciting way that offers innovative new services to patients nationwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Field calls from patients, providers and pharmacies across the country
  • Receive, enter, process and fill prescriptions as per Blink protocols.
  • Obtain a fundamental understanding of the Blink Health product for quick pharmacy assistance
  • Resolve open orders through communication with pharmacists and the Blink Health Customer Experience team
  • Perform all tasks in a safe and compliant manner that is consistent with corporate policies as well as State and Federal laws
  • Work collaboratively with the management team and pharmacists
  • Under the direct supervision of a pharmacist, perform tasks such as external pharmacy transfers, internal pharmacy transfers, and internal verbal orders from providers.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by Pharmacist in Charge

Requirements:

  • Must at least be in Professional Year 2 in an accredited Pharmacy School
  • PA Intern License
  • Strong phone presence in a support/service capacity
  • Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy

  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn complex new software

  • On-site in Pittsburgh

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity of all kinds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Us

Greendeck is one of Europe’s leading retail-tech companies. We use artificial intelligence to help retailers and retail brands make better pricing, marketing and merchandising decisions.

We are a small team - based across London and Indore - with a big vision and are growing rapidly. We’re a Techstars company, and are backed by some of London’s biggest VCs. We have been awarded UK’s ‘Startup of the Year’ and also featured by Forbes as a startup 'set to blaze a trail'.

We are looking for

A Data Analyst who will be working on gathering data and improving the processes and systems. You'll also conduct research and analysis to assist the teams deliver the highest quality products to our customers.

You'll work closely alongside our client facing teams, machine learning engineers, frontend and wider technical team to build new capabilities, focused on speed and reliability.

Your work includes

  • Writing scrapers for websites to gather data
  • Creating big data pipelines to standardize the data
  • Own and manage the big data pipeline that collects more than 100M items daily
  • Participate in ad-hoc data extraction requests by customers

Skills/ Requirements

  • Good knowledge and experience of writing scripts in Python.
  • Good knowledge of Beautiful Soup (Python library) and basic html elements and techniques used while scraping.
  • Basic experience and knowledge of using REST APIs
  • Basic knowledge of the Scrapy framework
  • Basic knowledge of any database
  • A good grasp on the basic concepts of any one git tool like Gitlab/Github

What you can expect

  • Attractive pay, bonus scheme and flexible vacation policy.
  • A truly flexible, trust-based, performance driven work culture.
  • A young and passionate team building elegant products with intricate technology for the future of retail and e-commerce. Our average age is 25!
  • The chance to make a huge difference to the success of a world-class SaaS product and the opportunity to make an impact.

position: Looking for a techie for an exciting project
description:
Looking for a friendly, competent, reliable, patient and polite techie who can do the following things flawlessly:

  1. Migrate a small Wordpress site to free hosting. Currently my hosting is not free, and they try to start charging me for php issues. I asked them to leave the site up as is, with the old php, and I want to move it to a different hosting and close this account. I created the site around 2016.

  2. Knowledge and ability in creating e-book on Kindle. All the written material is finished, need help with the entire process of posting it as a book with free hosting on Kindle. I read some of the Amazon manuals but it’s over my head. Will need help with the entire process, creating the pdf’s, posting them, etc. will have to coordinate this project, work well together. If you have previous experience in creating a professional e-book, it’s an advantage. Will need ISBN number.

If you can do all this, and you are a perfectionist who works for optimal results, please reply by email, tell me about yourself and your experience, and why/how you think that you can accomplish this project. Please don’t send tech terminology as I will not understand it. Just describe your experience, interest and pay expectations in plain English. Please send links to work samples, especially for Kindle projects. Don’t forget to send your name and contact info.

Looking forward to discuss,

Thank you

Since 2008, Simulmedia’s mission has been to make TV and video work better for advertisers. Our demand-side TV buying platform generates more wins for advertisers across linear TV, streaming, and gaming. We leverage TV’s unparalleled reach and the power of data to help brands, networks, and agencies find audiences most likely to take notice, tune in, and transact. Our goal is to empower both performance and brand marketers to take direct control of their TV buying and drive greater business impact with every ad dollar spent. We’re already helping hundreds of brands like Experian, 1-800-Flowers, Dollar Shave Club, HBO Max, Michaels, and MassMutual grow their reach, awareness, and conversions.

As an Analytics Intern at Simulmedia, you will face complex technical challenges that relate to the television advertising industry. You will be mining complex datasets to provide useful insights to various stakeholders such as account managers and the product team. You will be engaged in supporting ad-hoc client requests related to the launch, management, and optimization of advertising campaigns. Some of these requests will eventually turn into larger, productionable projects in which you will work with the rest of the Science and Engineering teams.

The Analytics Intern will, at times, be engaged in the information discovery phase to gather requirements and client requests. The ideal candidate is eager to work with Data Scientists and Account Managers and has data mining and data analysis capabilities focusing on SQL and Python, business acumen and strong analytical skills. Additionally, you will write complex queries delivering insights and reports to clients and deliver ad hoc data analyses that provide strategic insights to clients.

Skills & Experience

  • Proficiency in both Python and SQL and can transform data into an appropriate shape to use for modeling
  • Experience with quantitative challenges involving real world data and are comfortable building efficient code to share while learning new technologies
  • A keen analytical mind with the ability to understand business problems communicated by an Account Manager and distill complex information into understandable insights with actionable recommendations

The Simulmedia Experience
We take tremendous pride in maintaining a high bar for employees and fostering a strong team environment. While we work hard every day, we also believe in relaxing together with lots of team activities. We have an unlimited vacation policy, tuition reimbursement, and no employee financial contribution for medical, dental, and vision benefits. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, and an annual bonus based on performance. And last but not least, we provide a free Citibike membership to all employees!

Company Vision
To be the first place advertisers go to find and scale their high-value audiences and elevate the accountability and performance of their TV and video advertising.

Our Core Values
Help Others Win
Focus on the Right Things
Show, Don’t Tell
Be Inclusive
Make an Impact
Strive to Be Greater

description: We're looking for an iOS and/or Android Developer to help grow our business. We are open to any experience level for an equity stake. This is a remote and unpaid position. The Developer must be able and willing to work with an iOS app already built with Swift and/or an Android app already built with Java.

We are looking for someone to build a project managment software for our company. We already have one iteration and can provide you the source code. This would be a great portfolio item for all applicants.

Frontend Software Engineer

About Us

RemNote is the all-in-one workspace for note-taking, learning, organizing thoughts, and growing knowledge. It’s built for students, creators, organizers, and anyone looking for thinking superpowers.

Thousands of thinkers and learners from around the world trust and rely on RemNote everyday. We're expanding rapidly and just getting started.

As a small team, we're looking for people who are ready to take ownership of projects. We are looking for people who embrace new challenges and never stop learning. Your impact will be visible from day one. You'll work with people who are smart and motivated, but also kind. We expect the same from you.

What You’ll Do

Our product engineers think deeply about the end-user’s thinking and learning experience. They bring powerful workflows to life through clean, robust, scaleable code.

You will:

  • Work closely with product managers and designers to study user workflows
  • Build features that enhance and fine-tune RemNote’s core experience
  • Lead engineering projects for significant new initiatives or “headliner” features
  • Take ownership over significant parts of the codebase, and make careful architectural decisions
  • Write robust, clean code with TypeScript, React, and CSS

What We're Looking For

Technical Background

  • You're experienced with TypeScript, React, and CSS. You know how to architect code in a clean, extensible way.
  • You’re an experienced web developer and know how to avoid common pitfalls with web technologies.
  • You’re comfortable with the full spectrum of thinking about a user’s goals, translating this into workflow specs, and translating workflow specs into code.
  • You're experienced with writing reliable, carefully-tested code.
  • You're comfortable with basic CS principles and especially thinking about graphs.
  • You're comfortable with front-end performance engineering.

Approach

  • Deliberate Problem-solving: You thrive in a scaling startup, can decompose tricky problems, and work intentionally towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates.
  • Customer Obsession: You think critically about the implications of what you're building, and how a product’s design and code affects the experience and life of users.
  • Team player: You work well In a team of diverse skills (design, engineering, product, advocacy). You're able to communicate technical decisions and trade-offs in writing or brainstorming in real time.
  • Fast Learner: You enjoy learning new technologies as you go.
  • Autonomy: You can implement and deliver without a lot of guidance.

Bonus Points

  • You're deeply motivated by the need to build more efficient learning experiences and to support thinkers.
  • You have experience working with cross-platform applications.
  • You're proficient with back-end technology stack: Node.js, MongoDB, and AWS.
  • You deeply understand our product.
  • You've thought deeply about tools for thought and have a vision that aligns with ours.
  • You’re serious about your own intelligence-augmentation, and have developed workflows that you use to organize your thinking and learning

All of these requirements are not set in stone. We're looking for people who are passionate and ambitious. If you believe you’re the right person for this job, tell us why.

Is this job not right for you, but you love what we are doing? We have other open positions as well.

Please write a few sentences in your AngelList introduction note about:

  • Why you're interested in RemNote
  • What your ideal role looks like
  • What your ideal timeline looks like ("when can you start?")
  • Anything else you think we should know :)

Intake Date: Tuesday 07 September 2021

Duration: 8 Months

Desired Background: For this position, we are specifically targeting students who have an interest in using data analysis as a tool to make informed business decisions and to drive strategic and long-term business planning. Mining or natural resources processing knowledge is an asset but not required.

Minimum Qualifications: Must currently be enrolled in a recognized and accredited Canadian post-secondary institution

Why consider Teck Resources Ltd. for your Co-op Placement?
Teck Resources Ltd. is Canada’s largest diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with business units focused on steelmaking coal, copper, zinc and energy. Teck hires more than 150 co-op students each year to work at our various Canadian operations.

We have received several awards and recognitions that are worth noting. Teck was selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers in both 2018 and 2019, Teck was recognized as one of the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in 2019 and in 2018 and Teck was also ranked on the Corporate Knights Best 50 for the 12th straight year based on our dedication to environmental sustainability, and social responsibility.

Ideas at Work & RACE21™
Digital technologies are transforming our industry and contributing to improvements in every step of the mining process. We enhance our productivity, safety, sustainability, and growth by putting smarter ideas to work and creating advancements in our technology and our practice. At Teck, we don't just embrace ideas, we employ them. We are fostering a culture where employees are encouraged to bring ideas forward, test innovative approaches and implement technologies that can help make us a better company.

RACE21™ was started in 2019 as an initiative to take a company-wide approach to renewing our technology infrastructure, looking at opportunities for automation and robotics, connecting our data systems to enable broad application of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, and empowering our employees, with a focus on making real progress between now and 2021. With the expansion in analytics, automation, and digital tools, we are in an era that will lead to a transformation in the mining industry, and you can be a part of it!

Professional benefits of working as a co-op with Teck Resources Ltd:

  • Our values guide every decision we make as a company and as individual employees. In everything we do, Teck is led by our values of safety, sustainability, integrity, respect, excellence, and courage
  • A co-op with Teck will offer you the opportunity to work on challenging projects alongside a team of professionals who are experts in their respective fields, you will experience a combination of projects in the field as well as in the office
  • Teck offers a competitive salary for our co-ops as well as assistance with travel costs and co-op fees
  • Make an impression! Successful co-ops with Teck are given first consideration for professional positions upon graduation

Qualifications:

  • Preference will be given to students who have previous related co-op experience
  • Able to work effectively independently as well as part of the team
  • Proven ability to learn new technologies and platforms quickly, accurately and efficiently
  • Ability to communicate with precision in a technical environment
  • Interest in pursuing a career in data science and/or in a complex business environment in the future

Responsibilities:

  • Supports the data science team in developing advanced analytics, machine learning models, and drive data-based insights.
  • Joins data scientists in conducting exploratory data analysis, research, and insights for end-users
  • Able to articulate complex concepts clearly and in a way a diverse audience would understand
  • Participation in Agile and Scrum ceremonies
  • Conducts data preparation and modeling

About Teck
Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal and zinc, as well as investments in energy assets. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK. Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

Why consider Teck Resources Ltd. for your Co-op Placement?
Teck Resources Ltd. is Canada’s largest diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with business units focused on steelmaking coal, copper, zinc and energy. Teck hires more than 150 co-op students each year to work at our various Canadian operations.

We have received several awards and recognitions that are worth noting. Teck was selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers in both 2018 and 2019, Teck was recognized as one of the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in 2019 and in 2018 and Teck was also ranked on the Corporate Knights Best 50 for the 12th straight year based on our dedication to environmental sustainability, and social responsibility.

Ideas at Work & RACE21™
Digital technologies are transforming our industry and contributing to improvements in every step of the mining process. We enhance our productivity, safety, sustainability, and growth by putting smarter ideas to work and creating advancements in our technology and our practice. At Teck, we don't just embrace ideas, we employ them. We are fostering a culture where employees are encouraged to bring ideas forward, test innovative approaches and implement technologies that can help make us a better company.

RACE21™ was started in 2019 as an initiative to take a company-wide approach to renewing our technology infrastructure, looking at opportunities for automation and robotics, connecting our data systems to enable broad application of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, and empowering our employees, with a focus on making real progress between now and 2021. With the expansion in analytics, automation, and digital tools, we are in an era that will lead to a transformation in the mining industry, and you can be a part of it!

Professional benefits of working as a co-op with Teck Resources Ltd:

  • Our values guide every decision we make as a company and as individual employees. In everything we do, Teck is led by our values of safety, sustainability, integrity, respect, excellence, and courage
  • A co-op with Teck will offer you the opportunity to work on challenging projects alongside a team of professionals who are experts in their respective fields, you will experience a combination of projects in the field as well as in the office
  • Teck offers a competitive salary for our co-ops as well as assistance with travel costs and co-op fees
  • Make an impression! Successful co-ops with Teck are given first consideration for professional positions upon graduation

Qualifications:

  • Conceptual understanding of coding languages and coding experience is an asset
  • Preference will be given to students who have previous related co-op experience
  • Able to work effectively independently as well as part of the team
  • Proven ability to learn new technologies and platforms quickly, accurately, and efficiently
  • Ability to communicate with precision in a technical environment
  • Able to articulate complex concepts clearly and in a way a diverse audience would understand
  • Prior experience working with Structured Query Language (SQL) and/or database management is an asset

Responsibilities:

  • Assists Software developers in delivering products that meet the needs of the end user
  • Looks for and resolves any errors in the digital products that are created
  • Involved in conducting asset health management
  • Participation in Agile and Scrum ceremonies
  • Conducts data preparation and modeling

About Teck
Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal and zinc, as well as investments in energy assets. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK. Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

Position Title: Software Developer Intern

Location: Remote (Canada)

Employment Type: Summer Intern

Timeframe: 8–10 weeks

Hours: 30-40 hours/week

Applications due: Saturday, June 26th, 2021

Who We Are:

Yasa is a pre-seed FitTech startup bringing a virtual yoga instructor into your home through computer vision to make your at-home yoga sessions more personalized and interactive. Without the high cost of a human yoga instructor, yasa allows for real-time audio and visual feedback while you complete personalized yoga sessions at home. With enhanced movement tracking, users can have a dedicated instructor at their fingertips providing constant recommendations both during sessions, and on our platform to achieve their goals. We are looking to democratize personalized fitness instruction at home through the use of technology and building personalized experiences for our users.

At yasa, we are part of NEXT Canada’s Next36 accelerator program, allowing for our team to have access to an amazing alumni base, a world-class entrepreneurial curriculum, and workshops that will allow us to have innovative projects for you to work and have impact on as an intern!

Job Description:

Yasa is looking for a self-motivated, innovative, and resourceful Software Developer Intern to join our team. The ideal candidates are action-oriented and hungry to take on different responsibilities in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. We encourage you to apply if you are passionate about AI and interested in building the future of fitness through technology.

The Software Developer will be able to work remotely throughout the summer and will be working directly with the CTO to design and develop our web-based platform.

Primary Responsibilities:

Work directly with digital technology and Yasa’s development team to program our web application to bring to market.
Work in a variety of capacities in the development space, including back-end, front-end, machine learning and AI.
Work to develop a front-end using Next/React and a Back End using Django REST API and PostgreSQL.
Develop and integrate machine learning models to run on yasa’s platform.
Work independently to diagnose platform issues and provide solutions to our product.
Handle the app’s deployment.

A candidate can choose between working in each or some of these areas to align with a Full-Stack role or focus on one area and own it.

Qualifications & Skills:

Must be at least enrolled in a relevant Bachelor’s Degree (CS, Engineering, etc.) OR 1+ years experience in coding.
Experienced in front-end development and knowledgeable in frameworks such as React or Next
Some experience in Python development
Knowledge of software design practices

Nice to Have (Not Required):

Experience using Django, mainly for back-end development
Projects to showcase using React/Next/Django
Some Machine Learning knowledge in Python using Sklearn or Tensor-flow

How to apply:

To apply for this role, please fill out our talent form (https://airtable.com/shrMbGgx1dREyuolG) and kindly attach your resume and contact information for us to review!

For more info, please check out our website at https://www.joinyasa.com, our our Instagram or LinkedIn page! If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Liam (liam.hough@queensu.ca)

position: Fullstack Developer - Intern and / or cofounder
description:
We're an early stage start-up developing an application for language learning using Japanese comic books and our unique teaching method. We're looking for a person to help us develop and improve the product.

At this moment our team consist just of one of not technical person and one technical person. That is why it is important for us that a candidate will be able to find himself/herself in a rapidly changing, uncertain environment and at the same time enjoy working on a project, in which he/she would have a lot if impact on the final effect.

If you are confident of your skills or ability to learn fast, you are welcome to apply even if you don't have many years of experience working in the industry.

We are looking for somebody, who would work for just 2 - 3 months in order to help us to create an MVP (mangadou.jp is a proof of concept made with Wordpress, currently we are building a new website with Nodejs and React). However at the same time we are looking for a third co-founder, so when applying, please be ready to answer for a question if you would just work with us for few months for payment, or after that you would consider also joining our team as cofounder.

  • Experience with or confidence to learn TypeScript, JavaScript, React, and Node
  • Decent English level (min. B2 since you'll need to communicate mostly in English during work)
  • Comfort adapting to new tools by reading existing code or searching online
  • Ability to write well-structured and readable code
  • Can find and solve problems independently
  • Ability to translate business language to technology and vice versa

Nice to have:

  • Interest in Japanese language and/or manga

We offer:

  • 100% remote work
  • B2B contract
  • $2500 per month
  • flexible working hours

Recruitment process

  • 15 minute conversation to tell you more about the project and hear your experience
  • 1 hour problem solving and coding evaluation
  • 15 minute break for Q&A
  • Optional 2 hour software engineering evaluation

position: Internship Data Scientist / Full stack developer
description:
At Kerberos.io we are building the next generation video management platform or VMS that allow enterprises and end-users to configure their own small or large scale video surveillance/analytics landscape. We work with the latest technologies such as Golang, React, Flutter, Tensorflow, Kubernetes, etc to create a never seen user experience.

Within the Kerberos.io solution stack we have different technologies such as, Kerberos Open Source to support and bring a super cool and affordable VMS to anyone on this planet, and on the other hand Kerberos Enterprise suite which brings through scale and performance for enterprises with an ever growing video landscape.

You will leverage all the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Golang, React, Tensorflow, etc to create a unique user experience for our customers.

We will help you grow and understand how working in a startup environment feels like, and you will have the chance to share new ideas, and implement themself.

What are you waiting for? Let’s have some fun.

🏀 About GoodRun
Basketball is a passion of mine -- since I was young, I've been looking for a way to make a career of basketball (the NBA didn't pan out). When I couldn't consistently find pickup basketball in NYC, I found a problem I wanted to work on. To that end, the GoodRun mission is to advance basketball culture by digitizing the ecosystem of basketball-related activities and transactions.

Today, GoodRun is a platform to help users find competitive pickup basketball games in their city. Eventually, GoodRun will be the online destination for all amateur pickup basketball activity: play games on-demand, host games using admin tools, track skills and performance, and meet new hoop friends.

🙋‍♂️ Me: My primary skillset is product management and marketing. I've independently operated and managed a few small businesses in the past and hope to continue building businesses for the foreseeable future. I studied Mechanical Engineering in college and built the current MVP myself. I hope to meet an enterprising intern who can help build critical features for GoodRun to expand into other sports, and then into other group activities. Starting with basketball, I hope to change the way people and communities are brought together for recreation. More on me here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/brandonshuang/

🖥️ The Business: The MVP I've built is on Rails, is profitable with X50+ users across 2 countries. ~$X000 monthly recuring revenue, ~$X00 monthly recurring profit.
Web App: https://www.goodrun.app
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/goodrun.app/

🔍 You

  • Have experience writing code that for a side project or class project
  • Are looking for remote work (unless you're in Taipei)
  • Are able to frame problems, validate assumptions, and work and learn independently
  • Will own the code for all features you develop

Your non-technical skills...

  • You're organized and love details
  • You're intellectually curious, and love to build things
  • You value open communication and feedback
  • You can work independently while still maintaining excellent communication
  • You’re biased towards action and thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment
  • You love to learn and constantly look for ways to expand your skillset
  • You're fluent in verbal and written English

Nice to have :)

  • You love to play basketball
  • You have experience working remotely and asynchronously

If interested, please include:

  • Links to side projects you've built (GH or website)
  • How much Rails experience you have (in months)
  • Have you built web app(s) before?
  • How much experienced do you have working in a remote engineering team (in months)?

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Rendezvous, Proximity Operations, and Docking (RPOD) is an essential phase of any satellite servicing mission. Starfish Space is developing CEPHALOPOD, RPOD software that is capable of docking with efficient electric propulsion. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on astrodynamics and guidance navigation and control skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from developing GNC algorithms, to refining concepts of operation, to running simulation analysis.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Software and/or computer programming capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of Astrodynamics
  • Working knowledge of rendezvous, proximity operations, and docking techniques
  • Working knowledge of numerical techniques such as optimization and/or machine learning

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Satellite servicing missions require autonomous, robotic actions in orbit. To fulfill our mission Starfish is developing the Otter space tug and the Nautilus capture mechanism to interact with and maximize the operational value of satellites. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on mechanical engineering, electromechanical prototyping, and system design skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from designing in CAD, to manufacturing prototypes, to designing and executing a test plan.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Mechanical and/or electrical prototyping capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Previous experience designing and/or prototyping space systems
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of mechanical engineering
  • Working knowledge of electrical engineering

INTERNATIONAL VOLUNTEERING INTERNSHIP IN AN INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION

Human Connection Economy 4.0 (HCE 4)

Description: Virtual Internship

Length: Three to six months

Location: Toronto (Canada) or New York (USA). Remote working.

HCE 4 Headquarters: Villeurbanne, Lyon, France, European Union

HCE 4: HCE 4 is a professional, international and innovative federation that accompanies organisations and businesses that wish to migrate towards the 4th Industrial Revolution (also known as Economy 4.0). HCE 4 services integrate new concepts for management and marketing through putting the human, human connection and the planet at the heart of companies; and all around them through their clients. This is the Human Connection Economy 4.0. We are a Social Business that have just launched, seeking to become a part of the Fourth Sector. And we are in our start-up phase. Our outlook is global and we are specifically focussed on North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia. You can find more information about us at www.hce4.com.

Technology 4.0 Strategy Internship (Engineering)

Internship Objectives (to be finalised during the on-boarding process):

  • Participate with the conception and construction of New Technology 4.0 (Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Humanoid Robots) training sessions.
  • Integrate new types of training and conception inspired by neuroscience (e.g. connected creativity). There will be training sessions to prepare the student.
  • Analyse competition and client needs.
  • Lead training sessions.
  • Development towards the co-management of the team.
  • Create and organise HCE 4’s professional seminars and conferences.
  • Create links with the world of New Technology 4.0 and HCE 4 services.
  • Very motivating, diverse and innovative missions.

Student Profile:

  • Undergraduate/Masters student studying Engineering. Also open to students who are very motivated by new technologies who are enrolled in a Masters course.
  • Additional languages than English are appreciated but not compulsory.
  • Good command of Office (Word/Excel/Power Point) and have access to this on their own laptop.
  • Very autonomous and independent – a fast learner.
  • It is not necessary to have existing knowledge of new technology, human management, or human marketing as this knowledge will be developed through training with HCE 4.
  • Ability to work full-time during the period of your missions.

About SKUVision:
SKUVision is an intelligent inventory management platform with a vision to help businesses of all sizes in supply chain logistics and manufacturing. We provide companies with the tools to optimize their base-stock policy, minimize quality control errors and return rates, and reduce operating costs using forecasting and machine learning algorithms. Our goal is to provide companies and their teams with a single source of truth for all of their inventory going forward.

Role Description:
The internship will be REMOTE and unpaid, but we will help provide you with the right skills, experiences, and resources to build off of this position as you continue in your academic and professional careers. Estimated time per week is 20 hours and weekly hours are flexible. You MUST be located in the United States to be considered for this position. The internship duration will be June-August 2021.

There is an opportunity for successful interns to earn equity in the company if they wish to continue with us. More information will be provided in the interview.

Responsibilities:
• Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code
• Integration of external APIs with our platform (ie. AWS)
• Refining new metrics to be integrated in backend algorithms

Requirements:
• Knowledge of 2 or more of the following: Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Django, and Python
• Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, CSS, and ReactJS
• Experience with building internal APIs and working with external ones (or at least a willingness to learn)
• Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system using PostgreSQL (or some other SQL database)
• Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

Below is an overview of our tech stack. It is not important if you are familiar with all of these, but you should be willing to learn them.

Tech Stack:
Back-end Component:
• Ruby on Rails
• Python/Django
• PostgreSQL
• Javascript

Front-end Component:
• HTML/CSS
• ReactJS
• Bootstrap
• Haml

Testing:
• RSpec (unit tests)
• Gherkin
• Cucumber (integration tests)
• Capybara

DevOps:
• AWS
• Terraform

About Us:
At Sybill, we are building a video call mind-reading partner for salespeople. Sybill joins your calls with you and provides insights on your participants’ reactions during various call segments/topics. Imagine demoing the product to your clients and knowing exactly what excited them, what confuses them, and who might be interested in buying. We’re a venture-backed, early-stage enterprise SaaS startup, and our entire team comes out of Stanford, MIT, IITs, and various enterprise SaaS companies.

Role
We are building the world’s pioneering emotional intelligence platform for video calls, and the role involves learning and working with semi-structured, and multi-modal data of video, audio and text.
We bring out rare and highly useful insights about video call participants using our proprietary Machine Learning technology models, which you would be contributing towards.

Requirements

  • Passion for building robust end-to-end data engineering pipelines for real-time systems at scale.
  • Ability to think analytically about data-driven problems and reason among various solutions
  • Proficiency in data science and machine learning using Python

Benefits

  • Join a fast-growing startup and help create your personal J.A.R.V.I.S. assistant
  • Work on some of the most challenging and rewarding AI problems of our generation
  • Get out of the home and enjoy the in-person work environment
  • High-end Apple equipment for work as well food on the house

position: Super Smart Data Engineering Intern for a FinTech (Remote within US and Canada for now only please)
description:
At MacroXStudio, our mission is to become the best alternative data (“Big Data”) and AI based macro asset manager by measuring the world macroeconomy faster and better using thousands of new data sources like twitter, search, credit card, satellite data etc., rather than the incomplete, months delayed, slow, and frequently revised Government data.

For example, even many advanced countries are struggling to quantify the impact of COVID-19 on unemployment rate (“Next US Jobs Report Set to Be Even More Confusing, Bloomberg) and countries like India are using private think tanks to measure unemployment since there is no government data. You can help MacroX change this!

Unique commercial and social mission: In addition to providing superior returns to institutional clients, we will provide free access to our cleaned data to relevant supra-national bodies like the UN to help make better social decisions.

Work with world class experts: We have led teams at MSFT, Wall Street, and have had a Unicorn exit. We are in stealth mode but are super excited about this project. You will also get exposed to other top experts such as faculty at HBS, World Bank leaders etc. Here is a talk on applying AI to Asset mgmt.

About the Role

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

  • Partner with other engineers, product managers, and designers
  • Design & deliver innovative solutions to improve the Sigma user experience by implementing new features.
  • Find innovative ways to optimize the performance of one or more components of the product.
  • Develop automated unit tests to get the relevant code coverage and work with product owners and techpubs to document your work.

These will help you to be successful

  • You must be pursuing at least a Bachelor’s or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Have a solid grasp of Operating Systems, Data structures, algorithms and at least one modern programming language such as Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.
  • Eager to learn and build complex user interfaces, data visualizations, or backend systems.
  • Have a drive and desire to navigate unknowns, after all, that’s what unlocks realizations.
  • Ability to collaborate and work in a team environment.
  • Able to commit 40 hrs a week for 12 weeks OR 30 hrs a week for 16 weeks.
  • Ready to start work full-time by late 2022 to early 2023.

Benefits for our Interns:

  • Competitive pay: $40/hour.
  • Flexible schedule, do the work you need to get done in the time you have to get it done
  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.
  • Fun team events throughout your internship!

What’s next:

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this:

  • Take-Home Challenge
  • Interview to debrief on the take-home challenge
  • Technical Interview with an engineering team member

Do you want to help us re-decentralize the Internet?

Skynet Labs builds uncompromising software infrastructure for the decentralized internet. White Fox Scooters is the first docked electric scooter solution for walkable cities and micro-communities. Our docks have been initially deployed and hosted through partnerships with local governments as well as local businesses such as hotels, parking garages, and apartment buildings. We’re taking the electric scooter sharing model to the streets of New Jersey, hopefully New York soon, (as well as all other walkable cities) since we truly believe it is the most fun and efficient way to get around. We disrupt the electric scooter sharing industry in a key way: we place a strong emphasis on public safety. Our docks keep the scooters out of the path of pedestrians and allow us to share helmets with our riders. The company is led by our founder, Sidd Saxena, who has had prior experience in technology investment banking, ran multiple profitable businesses, and leads the YPO YNG Initiative in New York City.

Interns at White Fox Scooters will have the opportunity to make an impact in a way they never have before. Because of our small team, you will be able to interact and share ideas with all members, ask for feedback, and develop yourself as much as you develop the organization.

White Fox Scooters is looking for someone with experience in backend development. We are looking for a candidate who can create and manage databases for our users and/or scooters. You will be working with Electrical and Computer Engineering Interns who are currently designing the hardware and software running within our docks and scooters to build smart docking station with automated locking and charging features. Docking station and scooters, both will have unique id and several methods defined in computer of docking station. When the scooters are docked or undocked, the database must be updated to reflect who is using which scooter and at which docking station a scooter is located. Interns must be available a minimum of 20 hours/week. Course credit available.

Requirements:

> Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field, or graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in a related field within the last 6 months (Master’s level preferred)
> Strong background in computer programming
> Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Suite
> Strong attention to detail
> Creative problem-solving skills
> Competence in research skills
> Strong written and oral communication skills in English
> Demonstrated experience with database creation or management
> Has knowledge of a web framework or a mobile development framework
> Project experinece with Django,Flask webdevelopment framework required.
> Other Experience: Postman, JWT, JSON, HTTPS Required.
> Has experience integrating different API's, REST API preferred.

Experience with these is a plus, but not required:

>Basic knowledge of hardware and embedded software systems
>Testing and certification of electrical systems
>Python
>Raspberry Pi
