position: BardoVR Internship: BardoVR - An Interactive & Immersive Platform For Change
description:
BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques- calm focus, equanimity, compassion - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their meditation practice.

Who are we looking for? We are looking for smart, motivated, and creative people who are passionate about TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGY to join the BARDOVR. We are looking for people who want to change the world! Do you have an interest in Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking? We are looking for you.

Projects Include:
*Virtual Reality (Vr) Design And Development
*Game Design And Development
*Procedural Generation In Game Design/Procedural Generation In Vr
*Fractal Technology
*Business Development/Partnership Outreach.
*Growth Hacking & Community Development
*Games For Change
*Serious Games

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity - we offer real world experience working in a startup that is improving people’s lives. You will work directly with our management team, technology partners, and wellbeing community .
  • Access - to a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Mentoring - works with you to expand your skillset, add to your domain expertise, and grow your network.
  • Training - project management, software tools, and access to Wellbeing products and services.

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVRavailable.
  • Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

We believe that BardoVR can become a radical platform for change: an awe-inspiring gamified tool, grounded in ancient wisdom, that not only benefits meditators but specifically targets gamers and VR experience-seekers who otherwise might never come in contact with these profound teachings. It is a BIG vision! Are you interested?

position: Internship: Web Development /Community Development - For BardoVR: The Gamification Of Mindfulness/Meditation
description:
Interested in Virtual Reality (VR), VR Gaming and Games For Change? We are looking for you! BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques (calm focus, equanimity, compassion) - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their mindfulness/meditation practice.

Job Description
*We are an early stage startup with lots of VR hats to wear. *

  • Web development intern. Build landing pages to A/B messaging and product market fit.**
  • Front End Development - work with web team to optimize, update, and development web offerings. Including design, development,and analytics.
  • Berkeley/LA-based. Virtual internship - Ok.**

We are looking for candidates that are interested in web development, A/B testing, Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

*This is currently how it works: *

  • Enter Bardo (immersive/psychedelic world) where the practice of mindfulness is employed as a game mechanic.
  • If the gamer has 5X three-minute meditation/mindfulness streaks, they progress thru the Bardo Gates.
  • Ultimately, the meditation/mindfulness needed to progress gets harder in the form of longer streaks and more distractions (just like real meditation!).
  • At the last gate of the Bardo, the player chooses (thru eye gaze) their character rebirth in one of the 6 realms (God, DemiGod, Human, Animal, Ghost, Hell).
  • Each of the 6 realms has psychological qualities (see attachment) that become the foundation for prosocial (tend and befriend) game mechanics.
  • Like life... you die at some point and begin again - "entering the Bardo".
  • Every time you play the game, you have the chance for a new experience.
  • We are exploring ways to measure the mental state/wellbeing of players, pre and post gaming experience to show that exposure to gamified meditation/mindfulness practice and prosocial game mechanics makes us happier and healthier (this is our thesis).

*This Summer we are launching our Build In The Open (inspired by John Saddington at Yen.fm). I am super excited. *

  • We have a team engaing with our communities, having conversations about BardoVR.
  • We are asking for community for input on the development of BardoVR levels, characters, game mechanics, etc
  • We have a team that takes the community inputs and turns them into micro game experiences.
  • At the end of the Summer, we will have received great feedback from our community, built relationships with future customers, and learned a lot!

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: BardoVR is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

*A few things to know about this position: *

  • Position is unpaid (we are actively raising money). We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Requires a minimum ~15 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

Please include your resume, and** tell us what you like about we are doing at BardoVR**! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://www.bardovr.com/. Contact bst@bardovr.com for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder/Executive Producer BardoVR

BardoVR team:

  • Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir. Independent filmmaker. Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.
  • Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the Wellbeing/Digital Therapeutics, 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
  • Grant Anderson - VR Producer. Former Executive Director at Sony’s 3D Center working with filmmakers including Baz Luhrmann, Ridley Scott, Ang Lee. CGI work on Academy Award-winning teams for Titanic, Spider-Man. Former Studio Head, Jaunt VR. Recently produced location-based VR experience of the Marvel Universe for Disney.

TO APPLY
*CLICK HERE to submit our quick volunteer web developer screening form.
*
See below for details on the position and who we're looking for.

Description
We’re looking for collaborative and committed volunteer developers to join our remote tech team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on our flagship product: the AsylumConnect Catalog (the world's first tech resource platform designed for those fleeing persecution due to sexual orientation or gender identity). This is an essential position and a fantastic volunteer opportunity for anyone looking to use their strong knowledge of web and mobile application development for social good.

Time Commitment: This is an unpaid (volunteer) and remote position. We are looking for volunteers who are able to devote 10-15 hours per week to AsylumConnect.

Responsibilities

  • Report directly to our Tech Lead.
  • Contribute to our Catalog web and mobile application development.
  • Collaborate with our volunteer UX designers to develop and deploy new features, and ensure a positive user experience.
  • Write code to maintain server-side logic, manage the application database, and add new features.
  • Ensure the Catalog is mobile-friendly and cross-browser compatible.
  • Plan for future changes to our Catalog website, web application and mobile applications (iOS and Android).
  • Work to efficiently fix any technical bugs as they arise.

AsylumConnect’s Tech Stack:

  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku
  • MongoDB
  • Express.js / Node

Qualifications

  • 2+ years experience with web and/or mobile application development.
  • Familiarity with code versioning tools (GitHub), Redis, User Authentication, User Security.
  • Strong understanding of tech stack:
  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku
  • MongoDB
  • Express.js / Node
  • You are comfortable using online communication tools (e.g. Slack, Asana, G Suite, Zoom).
  • Ability to work closely with team members as well as independently.
  • Passion for LGBTQ+ and/or immigrant rights.

The Role
You will be a crucial member of the core team, from building back-end infrastructure to user-facing applications — and everything in between. You will build features across the platform from user-facing web applications, workflow systems, data modeling engines, and integrations with disparate third party systems. You will help establish technical strategy and direction and will also support growing and developing a world-class engineering team. There are so many important problems to solve that directly impact the lives of the 10,000 Americans entering retirement every day.

We're looking for a software engineer intern to support our core team. As an early team member, you will have broad impact over the technology, the product, and our company's culture.

What you'll need to be successful

  • Passion and excitement for the cause: to re-define how Americans age and transition into their third chapter.
  • Deep software engineering background and proven ability to ship world-class software products.
  • Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, and front-end frameworks. Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, React, JavaScript, TypeScript or similar languages.
  • Proven ability to drive product and engineering strategy.
  • Comfort with ambiguity. While starting from a blank slate is challenging, you find it exciting, rewarding, and empowering. You are able to build products from the ground up.
  • Obsession with end-user experience.
  • Low ego.
  • First-principles thinker: we don't care how others have done things.
  • Ability to define projects and execute. Excited to set goals and be held accountable for hitting those goals.
  • Superlative positional empathy with a strong understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
  • Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.

description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for an enthusiastic software QA engineer to help us update the product documentation and improve the performance and usability of our mobile app and web-based subscription for brands and retailers. This position is both a technical product management position and a QA engineer position.

We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.

QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect campaign workflows and collaboration opportunities with matchmaking brands to creatives.)

The QA technician role plays an important part in our company’s product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets customer needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we'd like to meet you.

Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Responsibilities

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools

DTonomy is a Cybersecurity company solving a critical problem facing Security teams today: too many alerts and incidents that exceed the capacity of skilled professionals to investigate and resolve them. Organizations today have hundreds to thousands of daily alerts from hundreds of sources and these numbers will only continue to grow. Most organizations are short staffed which results in inconsistent investigation processes, high mean time to response, increased risk and analyst burnout.

DTonomy’s Assisted Incident Response platform (AIR) orchestrates hundreds of internal and external data sources and tools into a single platform, and leverages automation and artificial intelligence to enable analysts to triage all alarms and threats, not just the highest rated or most critical, without additional investment in resource.

AIR’s unique adaptive learning engine and automated workflows guide IT teams through steps and procedures, resulting in up to 10 times quicker resolution of incidents, decreased downtime, and reduced alert fatigue for staff.

Job Description:

  • Work with product team and participate in full cycle of product development
  • Analyze internal and external data, deliver high quality model through scientific validation and integrate them to product
  • Build Data Pipeline using state-of-the-art technology
  • Write tech document and provide feedback.
  • Designing and implementing efficient code

Key Qualification:

  • Get Things Done
  • Problem Solver
  • Self starter, highly motivated, comfortable in a fast paced environment
  • Experienced in one or some of these technologies: Machine Learning, Data Mining, Nature Language Processing, Deep Learning, Visualization, Dock, Spark, Scala, Java, Go etc.

We are a software company. Code is what we live and breathe.

But being an iOS engineer at TeraThought is so much more than writing code. It’s about creativity, solving problems, your left and right brain working together. It’s about spreading your wings beyond development and collaborating with other teams. It’s about having the courage to stay at the bleeding edge of technology, not merely keeping up with the industry standard of today, but trailblazing what it will be tomorrow. From the frontend to the backend, we have innovated on all parts of the iOS stack:

  • SwiftUI - Apple's latest UI toolkit that allows for efficient UI development
  • Kotlin Multiplatform - A shared backend with a best-in-class integration experience, even for iOS
  • Firebase, SQLDelight and Coroutines - Tooling that makes backend endpoints simple

We don't expect you to know any parts of our iOS stack, after all these tools are incredibly new. However, we expect you to be excited about learning and developing with the coolest iOS stack!

If all of that’s been the “what” and the “how”, then Connexus is the “why”. Connexus is our flagship product - it defines a new industry as the first resource sharing network. By leveraging circles of trust from existing communities, Connexus helps people borrow and lend nearly anything, saving people’s money as well as the environment.

If you’re wondering how many years of experience you need for this, don’t.

Your enthusiasm and desire to learn is far more important than how much you know coming in. We invest heavily in the growth of each of our teammates, and through our team of domain-experts, there are endless learning opportunities in and outside the world of development.

So, are you a curious, lifelong learner? Do you relish solving creative problems? Do you yearn to make a real and unique impact on the communities around you? Is a tight-knit, agile team of like-minded individuals up your alley? Are you an eager, driven individual who loves code?

Then you’re perfect for our team, and our team is perfect for you. Apply!

About us

Trexo Robotics (YC W19, Techstars) is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots (https://youtu.be/3LW4LJIpa2o). Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

Our work doesn’t stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

About the Job

We currently have Trexos all over North America and an even growing backlog of Trexos we need to ship! We need to ensure that we test each device on all fronts and find issues before our users do so we can fix them and make a product which always works, no exceptions. We are looking for a Robot Destroyer intern to take responsibility of figuring out all the problems conceivable in the Trexo and constantly improving the overall quality and reliability.

About You

You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love when products just work and cant believe how some bugs make it out in the wild. You are detail oriented and love asking why many times till you understand something from first principles.

What you'll do

  • Create, update and run regression tests for regular software updates.
  • Add unit and integration tests across our software stack.
  • Test and provision PCBAs using ICT (in-circuit test) jigs.
  • Update scripts of ICT jigs for additional tests.
  • Setup and carry out accelerated life time testing for full Trexos to simulate 5 years of use.
  • Reproduce customer issues and find fixes for them.
  • Setup hardware in the loop testing (pushed code is built, integrated and automatically run on a Trexo).
  • Assist users with technical support.

Required Skills

  • Hands on experience testing hardware products with a lot of software in them.
  • Previous experience with either python or javascript.
  • Previous experience setting up/working with CI/CD.
  • Previous experience working in a Linux environment.
  • Ability to read electrical schematics.
  • Hands on experience soldering.
  • Hands on experience building something from scratch (software project, robot, machining etc).
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills (able to piece together lots of information and condense it to something useful).
  • Interest in exoskeletons

Nice to Have

  • Previous experience with ROS.
  • Previous experience with C/C++.
  • Hands on experience using tools such as a mill, lathe, drill press.
  • Hands on experience with 3D printers.

Compensation and Benefits

  • Snacks
  • Dog friendly

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

NOTE: Although Epoch Games does have a formal office at the listed address, we have a fully-online team at this time. Communication is mostly done via Slack (an instant messaging application) and Trello (an online project collaboration tool).

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but knowledge of one of the two is required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with); completing monthly reports; and following team policies.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:

  • Either C++ programming experience in Unreal Engine 4 and/or strong Blueprint scripting experience in Unreal Engine 4
  • Providing clear and legible code
  • Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games

Recommended Skill Requirements:

  • Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in Unreal Engine
  • Git Version Control experience
  • AI programming/scripting
  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment before or at the interview.

Minimum Hardware Requirements:

  • The ability to run Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register).
  • The ability to run a C++ IDE. Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) with the Unreal Engine package is recommended.
  • The disk space and Internet Speeds to download (pull) several GB of game files, as well as upload (push) files to an online version control repository.

position: Front-end Developer/Intern Web Developer (WordPress) - Immediate start
description:
*CFTE: Front-end Developer/Intern Web Developer *

About the role:

*Immediate start date required

We are looking for a Front-end Developer intern for our London office, joining the Infrastructure team in charge of building a new learning platform. This is an opportunity to upskill yourself in all things Fintech as you will be exposed to working closely with the Product and Marketing team to drive the vision and message of CFTE’s future platform. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated recently graduate/current student interested in pursuing a career in web development. This is a paid internship in the UK, however we are flexible with remote-working and will hire from other countries for the right fit.

The role is a 3 month internship, with the possibility of converting it into a full-time role. The compensation is between £800-£1000 pm, with many additional bonuses like our WFH allowance and Health & Wellness programme. In addition, we have monthly team lunches and free drinks at the office!

About your responsibilities:

  • Help building CFTE Think platform front end in coordination with the Product and Infrastructure Team following the high fidelity mockups on Figma.

  • Execute following WP best practices - in terms of performance and optimization.

  • Build dynamic dashboards using WP snippets fetching data from several sources.

  • Rebuild CSS pre built pages / Results from RestricContent / Algolia and Elementor.

Skills:

  • Experience in front-end web technologies such as HTML and CSS to build front-end UI components.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of application architecture and how they interact with various systems.
  • Pursuing/completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology.
  • Wordpress is a plus, but not a prerequisite.

We value your eagerness to learn, and therefore will also hire based on your motivation to learn the appropriate skills to empower your time at CFTE.

About you:

Ownership and accountability: you will be managing the external relationships of CFTE and our stakeholders in Singapore and the region. We expect someone who takes pride and ownership of their responsibilities.

Work ethics: flawless execution is something we expect, we can afford no mistakes in dealing with stakeholders.

Entrepreneurial Mindset: Any new role and projects come with challenges, you need to be a natural problem solver.

Process-driven with the ability to see the bigger picture and build communication processes with all our partners.

Excellent relationship and communication skills, both verbal and written.

An understanding and passion for Finance, Tech and Upskilling.

What’s in it for you?

  • Join a rapidly growing company building the future of education in finance. Size doesn’t matter, we are less than 20 but already reached thousands of learners, worked exceptional people from Harvard, Imperial College, HSBC, Citi, Ping An or Lloyds.

  • Working on some of the most important topics of today: Digital transformation, Technology disruption, Lifelong learning, Shift to an entrepreneurial age. All of which you will need in the future, whether in a corporate or start-ups.

  • Measure rapidly how your input impacts our company and if you can reach hundreds of learners.

  • Expose yourself to the Startup ecosystems in Europe and Asia and be part of the people building it.

  • Enjoy and work from our open office at the WeWork Canary Wharf, (where the coffee machine is an Ipad and the barista is an engineer).

About CFTE:

CFTE is looking for bright talents to join the team and help us push forward our educational mission by scaling our business. We are an education platform, connecting the best CEO, Entrepreneurs and Community member both online and off-line. We started in 2017 and since then grew to 20 team members and have learners from 100 countries.

  • You have what it takes to join us? Tell us who you are, what you can do for the company, and why we should hire you.

NB: The recruitment process includes a video interview, a case study and a meeting with the cofounders.

position: React Native Developer Intern (Unpaid) OPT Available
description:
Job Description

Resolve is a social media app (in development) where users can put up monetary incentives called "bounties" to get things done online. On Resolve you will be able to turn your dollars directly into the actions of others. Resolve supports free market competitive forces for efficiency, but is run with the intent of improving the world and the people in it. Our company culture is one that celebrates productivity for the sake of positivity. If you would like to work for Resolve you will need to see the value in both!

As an intern, you will have a significant and meaningful role in the development of the prototype Resolve Web application. You will be working side-by-side with the Founders of the company, contractors, and interns to help build the beta version of the app. There is an opportunity for full-time employment (with equity compensation) if you prove to be a valuable team member.

What will you be doing?

1. Working closely within your team of interns while taking guidance from the Co-Founders.

2. Turning mock-ups and text descriptions of pages/features into functioning code on a web app.

3. Developing an algorithm to rank posts in a user's feed based on which users they are following and which topics they are interested in.

4. Learning on-the-job to do tasks you may not have experience with. The app will be made from the ground up and while working at a startup, you must wear many hats.

You don't have to be skilled in all of the above, since we will be recruiting team members with complementary skills. If you believe in Resolve and are willing to work hard we encourage you to apply. If you are interested in working for Resolve you may fill out the online application form here: goo.gl/forms/D1jRsgiFxPPYMLGm2

description:
QA Software Engineer

YokD is looking for talented QA engineers to join our growing team. As a QA engineer you understand the importance of ensuring production level code is bug free for a great user experience.

We will achieve this by automating the testing of key features, as well as with manual UI testing. QA is perhaps one of the most important elements in the software development lifecycle and we are looking for passionate individuals who understand this.

We are looking for someone who has the brains to architect our CI/CD pipeline as well as implement it. Your role will involve designing and implementing unit and integration tests at various levels of the stack. You will see the fruits of your work as we grow our user base and become a staple in the fitness industry.

Company Overview

YokD is going to revolutionize the fitness industry. If you have a goal of getting fit or healthy, you’ve surely faced the dilemma of a lack of reliable options to turn to. Personal trainers are too expensive with no quality assurance, with manipulative contracts. Workout buddies drop out after a while, as they’re unmotivated also.

YoKD plans to offer the widest selection of fitness experts ready to help our users with a variety of services. Our team is really looking to change the outdated fitness game, so we are looking for passionate, energetic and fun individuals.

....

About the Role

This is a 6 month (unpaid) internship role which is designed to give you rich experience working in the fitness startup space. You will work at all levels of the stack and with diverse technologies and be actively involved in the design as well as implementation. At the end of the 6 month period, interns may be brought on paid positions with equity, depending on competence and culture fit.

You are a great candidate if:
You have one year of experience and software testing and automation.
You understand the principles of building CI\CD
You have experience testing android native applications.
You have experience building web applications or android applications.
You have experience building CI/CD pipelines for smooth development And deployment.

We are a future of work start-up, building a growing team of innovators passionate about working at an impact-driven company. Our vision is to create a world that provides equal opportunity for work to all.

At Werkit we curate remote self-managed teams from Africa for high growth software companies (targeting the growing AI market) so that they can focus on their core offering or service. And we do this, at scale.

We are a portfolio company of a prestigious global VC, Antler and were selected to be a part of Bowery Capital’s B2B SaaS Sales Accelerator Programme. We are currently focusing on an aggressive sales cycle so we can grow.

We value people who are entrepreneurial, ambitious, collaborative and customer-centric.

position: Internship in React Native Android App (Remote & Unpaid)
description:
If you are looking to be a pioneer in creation of a seamless behavior of devices for its users, an opportunity to be part of an implementation of a new Android app from scratch to deployment, then come help us launch HuTouch (product by Niiti).

At Niiti, we focus on providing real life experiences so that students can:

  1. Gain advanced core skills
  2. Work with teams of different domains
  3. Learn what it takes to deliver on commitments

Outgoing interns see this as a path to their dream jobs.
"one of the coolest projects... it feels great knowing that my work will help impact and augment the end-user experience" - Nitish V (College of Engineering, University of Michigan). Read more about what our interns say on our HuTouch Group on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8991258/

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup with its MVP. HuTouch is Apple Handoff for non-apple devices, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data) from where they stopped when they move between devices.

HuTouch needs a React Native mobile application developer intern (specifically for Android) to help accomplish the below goals & tasks (priority as stated):

  1. Research and development to identify solutions for functionalities designed by our early adopters. You will be required to have problem solving skills, study different materials and come up with solutions for functionalities within HuTouch that are not developed yet. This may take up 40% to 50% of your time on this project.
  2. Deliver code & User Experience not just with high quality but also with a logical flow in mind. The tasks associated to this job requirement is coding and unit testing, where the intern will need to make sure no critical or high defects creep into the developed code. This may take 30% to 40% of your time on this project.
  3. Demo of individual features developed and end to end flow. It'll be required for you to present the working app to the founder over a call while you screen share. There is no need for powerpoint presentations here, as this will be a pure demo of the app. This will take up 10% to 20% of your time on this project.
  4. Understand the flow within HuTouch and apply it to design frameworks for HuTouch. An intern will be asked to read about HuTouch, React Native for Android, to think like an architect and identify any foreseeable risks during implementation. This will take up the remaining time on this project.

Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

Skills required:

  1. Knowledge of coding skills in React Native platform for Android
  2. Client side coding to interact with APIs for AWS or cloud solutions
  3. Problem solving skills that drives the urge to solve by looking at a problem from different angles/scenarios and presenting with multiple solutions.
  4. Communication skills to articulate the problem and clarify assumptions

We are looking to hire Software Development interns for the tech products we are building for venture capital and private equity markets. It is a great opportunity for people looking to make their careers as a software developer in product based tech companies.. We understand that the role does not offer much in terms of monetary compensation but is a great way to kickstart your career in core full stack software development and learn state of the art full stack web development skills.

The intern should be able to join us at least for 2 months and should be willing to commit 2-3 hours of dedicated development time on a daily basis. You’ll have a chance to push your code to production within a week of joining the team. Interested candidates should include their CV (and past work samples).

Culture

Our team is completely remote with team members based in Japan, India and Canada. We are a company working in the space of Venture Capital and Private Equity focusing on startups from emerging markets and are (primarily) catered towards Japanese investors and companies (we don’t mind working with global players either)

Tech Stack:

Our tech stack is written in:

  • ReactJS for Frontend
  • NodeJS/Flask for backend (depending on which tech product team you join)
  • Cloud hosted MongoDB for database
  • Github for issue and project management
  • AWS (Amazon Web Services) for Deployment

Ideal Candidate

An ideal candidate should have some knowledge of concepts above and willingness to learn. We value commitment and dedication over past experience.

Software Development Methodology

We follow lean startup methodology and value iterative development over full-on product development cycles. We incorporate agile methodologies into development (we are not onto the stage for sprint planning YET). We follow continuous integration development style for deploying code.

About Investocracy:

Investocracy (https://www.investocracy.co/) is one of a kind startup and investment deal discovery platform focused on connecting startups from Africa and other emerging markets and is targeted towards Japanese investors and companies. We also operate a bi-lingual (English and Japanese) news and media platform invc.news catering to global startup information and updates. The company founder is an alumnus from IIT Kanpur, India.

  • News and Media website (https://www.invc.news/) covering exclusive interviews with founders, funding related news, resources for entrepreneurs
  • Top startup and venture capital lists for a particular domain (example MedTech) in a particular geography (example: Singapore)

Our purpose is simple: Provide Information Democracy for global investments.

• Experience with peristaltic pumps, valves and fluidic handling automation

Something really cool..!

Awesome, Right..!

About Us

We secure services and APIs running in any cloud, any platform.

We are small but put a special emphasis on learning and culture. We inherently believe in risk taking and challenging the status quo. We welcome ideas and strive for creating a fun and energetic environment.

Benefits

About Knorex

Established in 2010, Knorex is a cutting edge advertising technology MNC with offices across USA, Australia, China, Singapore, Vietnam, India, Thailand and Malaysia. Knorex provides Precision Performance Marketing products and solutions to the world’s leading brands and media agencies. With its full-stack platform, Knorex XPO™ (https://xpo.knorex.com) supplies the technology platform to deliver the right marketing message to the right audience at the right moment and right place, underpinned by a multi-layered data-driven approach. Knorex XPO shields its customers from dealing with the complexity and fuss while delivering immersive, dynamic and personalized marketing experiences that connects with their users. Knorex also provides managed services to complement its offering.

Why Knorex

We are constantly on the lookout to recruit the best and the brightest - from engineering to sales to account management to operations and HR.

Knorex offers you many different opportunities to scale your ambition and creativity far and beyond. We embrace a dynamic and pragmatic way of doing things, setting ourselves up for long term achievement yet relentlessly focused on delivering the short term goals. If you love the joy of building stuffs and seeing them grow, growing yourself and others in the process, and challenging yourself to do stuffs that you once thought impossible, we invite you to explore a career with us.

What Knorexoffers

  • Competitive remuneration package including quarterly bonus pay out.
  • Comprehensive benefits scheme such as W3F (Work, Wellbeing, Welfare) Fund for courses, materials, personal health and wellbeing.
  • Work from home benefit.
  • Quarterly recognition program and long service reward.

  • Career growth and personal development scheme.

  • You will have the advance to influence and drive the changes, at Knorex we welcome good ideas and accept any possibility to make our company great.

  • We offer great learning opportunities, you will have exposure in cutting edge performance marketing and advertising technology.

  • Opportunity to work cross-country and with variety of projects of a different nature.

How your future career look like at Knorex

We have an existing cloud-based, highly scalable, all-in-one advertising platform where Marketers, Media Owners and Agencies can easily create, optimize & publish Dynamic Ads world wide. Product website: https://xpo.knorex.com/

You will work closely with our cross-country teams located regionally to learn about the business and technical analytics requirements and translate them into production system. Owing to the large data and real-time stream of data, coming up with efficient and pragmatic solutions and algorithms to the challenging problems will be come imperative. You will work with other team members to ensure the timely delivery of the systems and solutions and critically assess and monitor the efficiency and/or effectiveness of the developed solution.

  • Work with other members to integrate new features including other third-party systems and plugins into our platform.
  • Ready to learn technologies, softwares and platforms.
  • Document and maintain software functionalities.
  • Respond and follow up to incorporate feedback.
  • Prioritize tasks to meet multiple deadlines

Requirements

  • Backend (Java) or Front End (HTML, ReactJS)
  • Strong in analytics and problem solving technique
  • Willingness to learn and able to pick up new technology or new concepts fast;
  • Possess good work ethic, attitude with good follow-through;
  • Good communication in written and spoken English.

Benefits

  • Ample opportunities to grow. You get to propose your own ideas and see it through.
  • Work with passionate, talented and driven colleagues who get things done!
  • Opportunity to work cross-country and with variety of projects of different nature.
  • Challenging and exciting problems that await you to solve.

Armada is a 4-year old startup funded by a major Silicon Valley VC.

Unique opportunity to have a real hands-on experience in an upcoming trillion dollar industry - flying cars. Personal Aerial Vehicle (flying cars) is a combination of a VTOL aircraft, drones, and airplanes.

ABOUT ARMADA:

Armada is a startup funded by major Silicon Valley VCs. Office, where you will be working, is in Santa Clara, CA. There are about 20 people on the team. Soldering

Electrical troubleshooting skills.

Assists engineers in the research, design, development and test of a variety of electronic equipment and systems, including communications equipment and systems; circuitry components; analog and digital computers; and control and test equipment.
Work with expert engineers as they provide technical/engineering support to Electronics teams for issues related to the performance of the various electronics hardware.
Assist more senior engineers with the design, development, and test for electrical support equipment.
The scope of these tasks ranges from conceptual development and initial design to production and deployment support.
This position will also require the ability to understand, design and fix custom electronic circuitry and assemblies.

To Apply:
Apply online at bluestamp.campmanagement.com/apply.
AngelList applications will not be considered, you will be sent to our online application.

Instructor:
BlueStamp, LLC is looking for independent, motivated, kind, and technical people to join our summer staff in all locations. The position requires staff to work together to assist students in creating their projects. This will include teaching engineering techniques and concepts, tools and safety, technical documentation, and troubleshooting methods. Staff will guide students to ideas, approaches, and sources of solutions without "just doing it for them." The position will involve the following responsibilities:
Help students troubleshoot their projects.
Help students create their own student page.
Motivate, inspire, and share the love of building with students

Education and practical experience in one or more of the following three areas:
(1) Electronics Hardware, (2) Firmware/Software, (3) Mechanical Design and Drafting.

Significant experience with building, designing, and troubleshooting devices or prototypes of similar scope to student projects shown here: bluestampengineering.com/the-students.
Applicants should be able to showcase and discuss, in depth, any of their projects.

Skilled in troubleshooting problems and using the engineering tools of their discipline.

Experience teaching/leading students (e.g. instructor roles, youth camps, tutoring, mentoring, etc).
Ability to think and act quickly on a project to identify solutions that can meet goals on a structured, fast-paced schedule in a busy environment.

Desire to share the excitement of designing and engineering with high school students, while motivating students through the challenging and frustrating stages of prototype construction.
Excellent communication skills, unfettered honesty and integrity, and the ability to work with minimal supervision are all a must.

Program Logistics
The student-to-staff ratio is approximately ~3:1. Typically we assign 4 staff members to each section. The skill set for each section consists: of an electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, computer scientist, and Junior TA (previous exemplary BSE student).
Class meets Monday-Friday for 6 weeks (excluding 4th of July). Program start dates are typically mid-June to late July or early August and vary slightly by city.
Compensation: The position is paid on a stipend, depending on experience.
Instructors are eligible for an additional merit based bonus of 25% of total compensation.

All staff must pass a background check.

position: Data Scientist Intern in Travel Tech
description:
About the job

Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Have you ever heard of the Travelling Salesman Problem or the Orienteering Problem? 🙋 If the answer is yes, and you want to apply your skills to solving what is considered in the field as a true complex challenge, then this opportunity is for you so keep on reading!

We are looking for a talented and motivated Data Scientist Intern to join our team for a period of 3-6 months and help us build a product that customers love.

WHO ARE WE AND WHAT DO WE DO

Trippers is a B2C group travel planning platform helping travellers plan their next weekend getaway from A to Z. We are enabling remote and seamless end-to-end group travel planning through our mobile app: from finding suitable dates, to choosing a destination that matches everyone's tastes and budgets to booking and optimizing the group's itinerary for opening times, most efficient route and more. We are an international start-up based in Monaco, but working fully remotely, and are extremely passionate about shaping the future of travel. We are a team of 5, working to add efficiency to a painful outdated process.

As with most personalisation-focused companies, algorithmic plays a very important part in our product, from our city selection algorithms to our itinerary-maker, the options to grow and learn with Trippers as a data scientist are endless.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an Data Scientist Intern who doesn't shy away from a complex challenge, someone passionate about travel and finding the best solution to any one problem. You will join the team at the best possible time, in their final sprint towards getting an MVP out to market, within the next 3 months.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You will join the team as a data scientist, to design and implement complex algorithms in order to create or improve the different solutions developed by Trippers. Your main tasks will include :

Improving our city recommendation algorithm
Reviewing scientific literature on combinatorial optimization problems
Experimenting on various algorithmic solutions to solve the combinatorial optimization problem that the Trippers itinerary-maker functionality is
Designing and implementing the solution identified as the best one
Visualizing data so that non-technical people understand it
Interfacing with the development team for final implementation

MUST-HAVES
Background or degree in Data Science, Computer Science or similar.
Previous experience with optimization algorithms
Knowledge of Javascript
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done
Excellent communication skills.
Fluent in English and internationally-mined (we speak Italian, French, Portuguese and more)
Critical thinker and good problem-solver.
Demonstrated autonomy while also capable of working as part of a team
Interest in the future of travel tech is a plus

WHAT WE OFFER
A huge learning curve
One of the biggest responsibilities to take over
Insights into all parts of a start-up
Working directly with the CEO and CTO
Flexible working hours and remote working
Opportunity to be part of a rapidly-growing industry and to shape the future of travel

We are looking forward to getting to know you, so don't hesitate and reach out!

About the job

description:
Description:
We are looking for a passionate security intern to join our Cybersecurity team. The responsibilities include to ensure to secure the client applications from potential breaches. Assist to create, leverage automation, continuously develop, maintain and mature Offensive Security Program. Be a resourceful part of the talented team responsible for application and infrastructure penetration testing, supporting external vulnerability reports and overall vulnerability management.

Perform penetration testing coverage across the global organization. Perform independent manual penetration tests of cloud and global IT infrastructure, web application, APIs, and IOT devices.

To be successful as a security analyst for a startup, you should be an inspired self-starter and have passion to learn and explore.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Plan scope and timing of static/dynamic application security testing.
  • Coordinate and execute testing plan.
  • Ensure security defects are documented and tracked for all releases, major technology and process changes.
  • Analyze testing results to validate, classify risk and rank findings.
  • Prepare and deliver reports with findings and recommendations.
  • Support remediation activities.
  • Perform penetration tests and validate cyber security controls.
  • Exposure to security research and publishing.
  • Experience of Application (Web or Mobile) Penetration Testing.
  • Familiarity with Security Standards and groups (OWASP, SANS).
  • Hands - on experience of Security Testing tools.
  • Basic Knowledge of Programming and scripting languages.

Job Requirements:

  • Experience in performing penetration testing on web and mobile applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical audiences at multiple organization levels.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to develop good relationships with current and potential clients.
  • Any Graduate or Post Graduate with passion in the security domain.
  • Certifications: CEH or any application security training from well recognized training institutes with at least 6 month training.

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, social orientation, nor on the basis of disability.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.*

Whym.tech

About Anyscale:
Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We’re commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund.

With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.

We are looking for passionate, motivated people who are excited to build tools to power the next generation of cloud applications.

We are hiring strong software engineer interns for a variety of roles. Examples include:

Distributed systems
Machine learning
Frontend
Observability
Production serving
Ecosystem
C++
Reinforcement Learning

As part of your role you will:

  • Develop high quality software to empower software developers and simplify programming
  • Work with a team of leading distributed systems and machine learning experts
  • Communicate your work to a broader audience through talks, tutorials, and blog posts
  • Help us to build and shape a world class company

Must be willing to work onsite in our office.

We are excited to build a diverse team and encourage all to apply!

Why Adaface?

Adaface is B2B SaaS company founded by IIT alums- Siddhartha Gunti and Deepti Chopra. Combined we've done research in NLP/AI at institutions like Caltech, led product teams at startups taking them from seed to series A and developed quant models at enterprises like Goldman Sachs.

With Adaface, we are changing the way tech recruitment works for generation-z with our chatbot Ada. Ada is the world's first skills assessment chatbot- top candidates prefer Adaface because Ada engages with a friendly chat involving relevant challenges as opposed to asking trick questions on a test. With Ada we enable companies to identify the best engineers faster and build strong teams.

We are incubated at Enterpreneur First, Singapore based accelerator funded by Reid Hoffman of LinkedIn. We are at a crucial point in the company with high m-o-m growth and ambitious goals. We are excited to grow our core team with talented and entrepreneurial members.

What will you do?

  • Develop high-quality, creative questions involving various Computer Science and/or Aptitude concepts. The questions will be used by companies like Amazon, Singapore Govt, PayPal etc in hiring next generation of engineers using Ada

What impact will you have?

Ada is on track to have a chat with every developer in the world and is being used by top companies to build best teams. Every qualified content piece written by you will help Ada expand the library and help achieve the mission faster. You would be a reason candidates will leave a pre-employment chat with a smile :)

Chat with Ada followed by interview. Short and simple.

  • Knowledge of algorithms and competitive programming experience is preferred but NOT a mandatory requirement.

We are looking for interns to mentor for the summer. This position will allow you to apply your Deep Learning and Computer Vision theoretical knowledge (which you gained by doing online courses or at your university) to build state-of-the-art models and deploy them in real world applications

Interns should have the following skills

  1. Python
  2. Numpy, Scipy, matplotlib, jupyter, scikit-learn
  3. Any Deep Learning Frameworks - Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch (Keras and Tensorflow preferred)

  5. Unsupervised - K-Means, MoG/GMM, EM
  6. Fundamentals like - loss, cost, accuracy, Gradient Descent, Linear Algebra, Batching, variance, bias, regularization, Hyperparameter tuning, Dimension Reduction (PCA, NMF)

  8. Projects in Computer Vision, NLP or Speech
  9. Docker and Kubernetes experience is a plus
  10. Experience Deploying models on cloud and/or Edge Devices is a plus

This mentorship program will have two rounds of interviews.

  1. Preliminary Round

Project List for Preliminary Round.

  1. Face Recognition
  2. Gesture Recognition
  3. Pose Estimation
  4. Counting Number of people in a frame
  5. Pedestrian Detection
  6. Age and Gender Recognition
  7. Object Tracking
  8. Counting All Vehicles in a Video Stream
  9. Emotion Recognition through Facial Expressions
  10. Tumor Segmentation

  12. Action Recognition
  13. Group Activity Recognition

About Compa

Compa is a new way to create offers with software. Our data science engine scales compensation analysis so that every decision is data-driven. Data-driven decisions help us make better human decisions. Our tools are designed to make compensation easy to understand and communicate so offer decisions are consistently fast and accountable.

Creating offers should be simple, unbiased, and designed to win. Compa makes this possible, and opens up incredible new ways to understand and manage compensation outcomes at scale.

About the role

Compa is looking for interns to join our team. As an intern, you will join Compa for 10 weeks and work on our core product and systems.
We’re looking for interns that want to code, grow, and have an impact on the world:

Code

  • Work with Compa’s engineers and CTO to build a core product feature end-to-end.
  • Work on Compa’s React frontend and Django backend.
  • Coding is a team sport at Compa - we work together to build the best features and scalable systems.

Grow

  • As intern, you will be giving meaningful work and contribute directly to Compa’s core product and systems under the guidance of experienced engineers.
  • Our founding engineering team is passionate about helping engineers grow to their full potential - and has a track record of doing so at Facebook and Oculus.
  • Compa is a safe place to learn and to grow - we have a no blame culture. Human error is a consequence of complex systems, not bad people. When mistakes happen, we work together to make our systems more resilient, not hunt for blame.

Impact

  • We’re applying technology to build scalable solutions to one of society’s toughest challenges - making compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • Pay is deeply personal and affects everyone who works for a living. At Compa you’ll be part of a small team on the frontier of making compensation better for everyone.
  • We’re a VC-backed early-stage startup, you’ll have the opportunity to influence matters of company culture, strategy, go-to-market, and fundraising.

About you

  • You want to make compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • You want to learn in highly ambiguous and constantly changing situations.
  • You have a bias for action - transform ambiguity and uncertainty into concrete next steps.
  • You are able to overcome obstacles to ship - done is better than perfect!
  • You are a collaborative problem solver.
  • You are looking to realize your potential by engaging with challenging problems, both technical and societal.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with React and/or Django

Go Off is an emerging social platform that hosts small live-chat discussions which are moderated to help break echo chambers and enhance engagement. With over 150 active users within our first month of our Beta Launch, we are a growing company and have recently met with interested corporations and companies such as IBM and Edelman. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground level of emerging wave and demand of niche marketplaces and the quickly expanding nonalcohlic beverage vertical.

Hobo Video is a vernacular fun video based localized community driven marketplace for billions of generation Z and millennials where everybody can earn.

We are on a mission to make online shopping real via video streaming in a language the audience is most comfortable with and to provide revenue streams to influencers and small sellers by making an ecosystem of video commerce.

We are extremely passionate about what we’re doing and want someone that is going to share in that belief and attitude.

We value our interns as team members. As a Digital Presence and SEO Executive, you get to be a part of the revolution! At Hobo, you can take on big responsibilities to solve some of today's greatest problems.

  3. We keep transparency and equality as the first thing for employees and learning as the utmost priority.

Job Description
VertiGrow builds tools for urban vertical farmers who are reshaping our food supply chains by growing food closer to end markets. Our systems empower urban farmers by managing farm logistics and growing processes, allowing farmers to more easily manage and expand their operations. Urban vertical farming reduces the environmental impact of farming through reduced land and resource consumption and shortening of supply chains. Urban farming also increases the number of local jobs and entrepreneurs, and keeps more money in local economies.

Our current product offering, FarmWare, is a full scale farm management software designed for these types of farms. The Backend Software Developer will frontrun development of FarmWare's backend codebase with support from our development team.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Add new functionality to our backend
  • Optimize the current backend codebase to reduce process times and server load
  • Optimize existing features based on beta tester feedback
  • Work with our engineer to connect our farm automation systems to our new web based application, FarmWare.

Knowledge and skills

  • Experience with Python and SQL languages
  • Experience with server/client architecture
  • Experience integrating hardware with software
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Familiarity with distributed version control systems such as Git

Education required
Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Computer Sciences or similar discipline

6 month internship with potential for full time hire afterwards

About the company:

Unilingo translates videos for top YouTube creators who want to reach a global audience and increase their ad revenue. We provide tools that make it easy and affordable to translate, distribute, and manage translated IP. In a world where 80% of content consumption is not in English, Unilingo’s premise is that small to medium sized content creators should have a single system for content translation, distribution, and management to reach a global audience. AI Translation is not good enough, human translation is expensive, no single management system exists to reach new audiences beyond one language, and high production value user-generated content is heavily undersupplied in emerging markets (1MM people come online for the first time each day). Unilingo works with creators with a combined following of 45MM subscribers and 7B lifetime views including WatchMojo and Veritasium 7% MoM viewership growth. Our translated content was viewed over 20m times in the last 30 days.

At unilingo, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. Responsibilities:

We are a Pricing software solution.

We allow our customers (CDiscount, CMA CGM, Rent a Car, Kiloutou, Skiset …) to better manage their prices. With every industry going through an omnichannel revolution with different competitors on every front, Excel is starting to be really behind the curve to manage and optimize pricing. That’s were we come in with a solution that allows our customer to obtain huge revenue and productivity gains through better price management.

Pricemoov develops revenue optimisation strategies for marketplaces, retail, rental and corporate clients. Different methods are used for this purpose: demand prediction, optimal price optimisation, elasticity estimation methods, customer clustering methods and learning-by-doing methods. Around these building blocks, several modules based on ML methods can be used in the product: alerts, simulations, product intelligence, etc.

We have different operating regimes: The retail/marketplace context requires generic methods with rapid inference frequencies (adaptation to market variations in near-real time) whereas in B2B we create customs models with batch inference on a very large amount of data. The infrastructure to run these models is therefore significantly different.

As part of the Pricemoov Delivery Team, you will have to work on complex and high value-added customer cases.

Missions :

  • Analyze and understand large volumes of data in various fields (rental, logistics, retail, logistics, shipping) in order to identify all revenue optimization levers,
  • Think and design the optimization engines needed to activate these levers,
  • Build, test, and deploy the necessary predictive models (time series prediction, segmentation, etc.),
  • Format results in a clear and concise manner.

Required Profil :
You have excellent qualifications in mathematics and statistics, a strong taste for business issues, as well as a first experience (or personal projects) with Python and the usual Machine Learning algorithms.

  • You have an excellent knowledge of Pandas, Scikit-Learn and SQL,
  • You know how to use and explain the main ML algorithms,
  • You are autonomous, able to make decisions,
  • You are able to solve complex problems,
  • You have a perfect command of English,
  • Mastery of Tableau Software, Dataiku, or AWS are pluses.

Our technical stack :

  • Backend : Python, Redis, Prostgre, SQL, Celery,
  • Frontend : React JS, Redux.js,
  • DevOps : Terraform, Sagemaker, Kubernetes, GitHub, Docker, AWS lambda, AWS,
  • Data : Tableau, Snowflake, Scikit-learn, Python (Data Science), Mixpanel, Kuberflow, Dataiku, Apache Spark

  • Great location: work either from our office in the heart of Paris or remotely,

Yup is a system for determining the agreed-upon social value of anything on the Internet, from Tweets and YouTube videos to blogs and news articles. It provides stronger incentives for giving meaningful opinions online by allowing users to earn money and influence if their opinion is supported by other influential members of the community. When users rate content, people, or products they have both their reputation and potential income at stake, which results in better incentives for judging content meaningfully. Our goal is to create a universal, disintermediated layer of social consensus, where the agreed-upon social value of anything online can be determined without reliance on centralized platforms like YouTube or Twitter

SoCreate is an Equal Opportunity Employer. About SoCreate
We are going to change the way content is developed for screens of all sizes. We are going to make screenwriting accessible to everyone. We are going to open doors to people with amazing stories who never thought they could contribute.

SoCreate, founded in 2015, is a privately held company that’s funding the development of revolutionary cloud-based screenwriting software. The SoCreate Screenwriting Platform will make it fun and easy to turn anyone’s amazing ideas into a TV or movie script. In addition, SoCreate is building an e-commerce backend that will power financials for SaaS companies (such as SoCreate Screenwriting Platform) in direct to consumer sales. Since its inception, SoCreate has completed hundreds of hours of research, design, and development on the screenwriting software and its elements. In 2019, SoCreate will launch beta trials to interested screenwriters who are tired of wrestling with frustrating, traditional screenwriting software, who want a single place to take their ideas from inspiration to completion, and who desire a software that will allow their creativity to flow in new, unbounded ways. We believe that if we work hard and stay focused, we will become the primary service for writing dialogue-driven stories for stages and screens.

About the Company

VenturX is a mobile/web platform that helps entrepreneurs through their journey from idea to launch and beyond. I am currently working with incubators, Canadian banks and accounting firms to perfect the process and define the right tracking metrics for the first phase - validating the business idea. The end result will be a system that drives entrepreneurs to adopt Lean principles throughout their journey, using gamification to drive their engagement and provide tangible metrics and scoring systems. The end result is a platform that would allow mentors, incubators and investors to assess the maturity of a startup. In subsequent phases, this system will expand to cover more of the startup journey, becoming a great tool to track a startup's overall progress towards launch, growth and financial independence.

InterNex Capital is seeking a Data Scientist Intern with the ability to convert to a full-time position. You will work with business, technology, and executive teams. This is a fantastic opportunity for individuals that have an interest in business lending, financial technology or commercial finance and love to learn and synthesize in a high-performing culture. We are looking for someone with dedication and an entrepreneurial spirit that is ready to join an innovative startup positioned for high growth.

The Data Scientist Intern is responsible for experimenting with and deploying various machine learning algorithms, maintaining and developing reports, and implementing scoring models. Key traits for the individual in this position are strong analytical skills, good communication skills, quick understanding of business concepts, team player, change agent, strategic and creative, and eager to uncover data insights that drive performance from all areas within the company.

The Business

InterNex Capital LLC (“InterNex”) is a digital lender providing small and mid-sized B2B companies with working capital solutions. Founded by Commercial Finance and Fin-Tech veterans, our vision is to transform invoice finance for small and mid-sized B2B companies. InterNex is powered by integrated data and technology to optimize underwriting, monitoring, and user experience.

The Team

The technology team oversees and manages the development and deployment of software and data analytics across the company. The technology group consists of technology professionals who are responsible for developing, testing, and monitoring the company’s software systems and databases.

Role & Responsibilities

  • Develop, test, and maintain InterNex's data analytics platform
  • Construct models, analysis, and solutions in response to questions and problems
  • Build robust predictive models, showing capabilities of feature and model selection
  • Manage the data preparation process from collection through cleaning
  • Write complex SQL queries to help answer important questions in our business
  • Help build robust data pipelines and ETL tools
  • Maintain existing SQL reports, alerts, and dashboards

Minimum Qualifications

  • Graduated or graduating in the Spring or Summer of 2021
  • Solid knowledge of probability, statistical, and machine learning methodology, as evidenced by an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline
  • 0-2 years of on-the-job data science experience using Python and R
  • Knowledge of common database systems, particularly Redshift/Postgres
  • Sound understanding of algorithms, data structures, and object-oriented design
  • Self-starter with the ability to independently acquire the knowledge required to succeed on the job
  • Experience or ability to work in a fast-paced complex environment where priorities change frequently
  • Proven ability to successfully manage multiple projects
  • Good communication skills and comfortable communicating with non-technical team members

Desired Skills

  • Master’ s degree in data science or similar field
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as: k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Comfortable with command line tools and GitHub
  • Ability to build predictive models on large, structured datasets
  • Start-up experience within a company and/or as an entrepreneur
  • Experience with lending or financial services a strong plus

Company Mission:
Our Mission is to connect student-athletes with college coaches for athletic recruiting and secure their future to play college sports.

A BIT ABOUT US
GBatteries was founded six years ago to tackle one of the world’s most pressing issues: the transition to a cleaner future through electrification. We are pioneering battery technology which enables ultra-fast charging of Li-ion batteries without compromising battery life — and without changing the battery’s chemistry or manufacturing process. Ultimately, our mission is to accelerate the mass adoption of electric vehicles.
We are working on some of the biggest challenges in energy storage, and are looking for the right people to join us as we develop our technology and continue to scale.

THE OPPORTUNITY AND THE ROLE
As a DevOps Engineer on our Software Development team, you'll help us build out the core web applications and tools that will serve to enable our research and development teams to effectively test and analyze state-of-the-art batteries. In our small but growing engineering organization, you'll not only be developing and shipping new features but also designing core aspects of GBatteries' testing and data analysis product.
In this role you’ll build a continuous integration pipeline to allow the Software team to release features faster and more frequently. You’ll be also creating a QA testing framework so that the team can write and run automated tests in a predefined environment. You will be involved in identifying and fixing bugs, documenting our research platform, and providing support to the Research team in using the research platform.

We've not set it in stone, however our preferred salary range for this position is $17-28 per hour, depending on experience and background.

THE TEAM
You’ll join a small but growing software team where everyone—including you—is striving to constantly improve their knowledge of infrastructure, systems, and cares about creating dependable products. While we are still growing and have plenty to do, we are incredibility supportive of each other and pitch in to support our peers when problems arise.

THE TECH STACK
This is the tech stack our development team works with.
Web Development: React.js, Flask
Data Warehousing: Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Azure, Terraform, Ansible

THE SKILL SET
Computer science or related background
Previous experience in at least 1 software development role in industry

Must haves:

  • Strong proficiency in Python
  • Experience with Git version control (personal projects and/or work experience)
  • Familiar with Docker (personal projects and/or work experience)
  • Familiar with working using the command line in Linux/Unix/Ubuntu (or similar environment)

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with Kubernetes (either deploying applications or managing a cluster)
  • Experience with a cloud service provider (Azure preferred)
  • Experience writing queries for Elasticsearch
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines (CircleCI, Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub CI)

WITHIN 1 MONTH, YOU'LL...

  • Become familiar with our vertically integrated technology stack and get a high-level understanding of the projects the team is working on and how they fit in with the company’s goals
  • Start development on your first Python-based project which will be a continuous integration pipeline to allow the software team to release new features faster and more frequently
  • This tool will be capable of executing/managing Helm charts to deploy new versions of the software to a Kubernetes cluster

WITHIN 2 MONTHS, YOU'LL...

  • Begin working on a QA testing framework that will allow for developers to write and run automated tests in a predefined environment
  • This will be python based, and will be integrated into the CI/CD pipeline built in the previous project

WITHIN 4 MONTHS, YOU'LL...

  • Continue to implement new features for the CI/CD pipeline and QA testing framework you build during your term. This may involve integration with a second Kubernetes cluster hosted in Azure, and any bug fixes that may arise

THE ENGINEERING CULTURE

  • Autonomy: There's no red tape on what technology frameworks you can use, or what language you should be coding in. We believe in using the best tool(s) for the job, and learning any new ones along the way.
  • Scope: You won't be adding small features to a monolithic codebase; you will be building entire products from start to finish. Your team members will recognize you for the products you build and the impact these products have on their workflow. You will have the opportunity to identify the business needs for a particular product, work through the development life cycle, and interact with your customers directly.
  • Interesting Problems: Much of what we do is in uncharted territories. As a result, we are often posed with interesting and challenging engineering problems, which will encourage you to prototype, iterate, and innovate. It's part of the company culture to encourage crazy ideas, and celebrate failures as learning opportunities. Many of the design problems you will encounter won't have answers on Google or Stack Overflow, they will encourage you to come up with unique approaches and strengthen your design thinking.
  • Growth: Working at a start-up is a great way to supercharge your skillset, and accelerate your learning. You will be put in a fast-paced environment where you're always working at the bleeding edge of technology.

WHAT WE OFFER
We are working on many exciting projects towards our ultimate goal of breaking down the final barrier preventing the adoption of electric vehicles; range anxiety. We’re a growing company working with some of the largest manufacturers in the world, and there’s still a huge amount to do. Even as an intern joining us, you’ll be able to see the impact of your work from day one and have the opportunity to see the final effect on real world products. We encourage unconventional thinking, and seek resilient problem solvers who aren’t afraid to get their hands dirty.

During the pandemic, we are operating remote-by-default.

HOW TO APPLY
Is the idea of enabling the global mass adoption of electric vehicles exciting to you? We’d love to hear from you! To apply please include a short message addressed to Henry Rearden within the application below; no cover letter necessary. If you have any questions, or just want to say hello, feel free to reach out to Vlad Belov on LinkedIn.

We particularly value diversity, and we know that experience comes in many forms. If your unique experience is close to what we’re looking for, please still consider applying.
