About Lair East Labs

For Founders with a Global Vision

Lair East Labs is a startup accelerator based in New York that empowers founders to expand internationally. At the heart of Lair East Labs lies the 10-week accelerator. Each year 8 -12 startups take on our program and receive investments of $50K. Our 10-week program combines the best of two worlds - learn from alumni founders of top Silicon Valley-style accelerators and gain access to a network of mentors and investors with extensive experience navigating the U.S. and Asian markets. In the first three years of operation, our portfolio companies have raised $30 million funding after completing the accelerator. We support founders in their quest to build successful and sustainable ventures that solve global problems. We are founders accelerating founders. For more information: please visit: laireastlabs.com.

About the Role
We are currently seeking prospective Venture Fellows who are highly analytical and deeply passionate about startups. During this fellowship, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our team to find and evaluate transformative, breakthrough technology companies.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with our portfolio companies to support them on strategic initiatives
  • Conduct ad-hoc analysis (e.g., market sizing, analyzing survey data, pricing analysis, web analytics data)

  • Help program manager organize events, including product and growth sprints, program kickoff week, alumni and recruiting events
  • Conduct financial, market, and company diligence on new potential investments; desk research on industries and trends.
  • Improve current deal pipelines and optimize the overall communication flow with startups
  • Thought Leadership: each fellow will also work on thought leadership writing based on research about the topic of choice, which is to be published via Lair East Lab’s channel at the end of the fellowship program

Requirements:

  • A deep passion and /or interest in startups, technology, venture capital, etc.
  • Self-starter – able to take the initiative, prioritize and run on own with limited guidance
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and in an entrepreneurial environment where things change constantly
  • Organized with high attention to detail
  • Team player – happy to do whatever is required to support the team
  • BA/BS/Master candidate currently pursuing a degree in STEM/Economics/Investment/relevant degrees at a prestigious university and/or investment analysis experience
  • Strong written and oral communication skills; ability to synthesize and articulate thoughts about companies and markets concisely
  • Experience at a competitive startup or VC firm highly preferred but not required
  • Bilingual fluency in both English and Chinese preferred but not required

We are looking for energetic and passionate youngsters to join our team. This role needs no job description and requires no formal experience. We're looking for raw talent with oozing energy, sky-high ambition (check our mascot) and a desire to make a name for yourself!

We're offering you a sandbox environment with the next generation of creative technology that will allow you to make content in formats that were not possible earlier. We're looking for people that can thow us off our chairs with ideas that are beyond our creative imagination.

Here is something about us
Nexweave (https://nexweave.com) helps you create hyper-personalized images, GIFs, and interactive videos to display in emails, LinkedIn messages, chatbots, and web pages.

Think of us as someone like Canva with superpowers.

With Nexweave, you can create a video, make it interactive and add a dash of personalization (or a boat load of it), within minutes! Even a 6th grader can use nexweave, and we intend to make it easier still (and affordable!)

What do we expect from you

  1. Create Magic - The right people with the right resources can solve any problem. Join us if you think you're 'right' and are determined work your magic.
  2. Communicate Freely - We're all for transparency and feedback. We think we're building for Gen-Z and you definitely need to have a say here.
  3. Take challenges head on - Be ready to be on your toes and be ready to dive into ambiguity to make sense from chaos. It's your time to play Joker!
  4. Embrace Versatility - We're going to ask you to learn like crazy and do things you've never done before so be sure to be convinced that you're ready for it.
  5. Be creative and scientific - We bring ideas from our gut, get feedback from our customers, and validate with insights from data. Rather than 'I think', we prefer 'As per our experience' and we intend to keep it that way.

What are we looking for

  1. You should be pursuing a degree / diploma or a post-graduate programme.
  2. You should have impeccable writing skills AND/OR oral communication skills AND/OR camera skills.
  3. You should be familar with using Google docs, MS Office and atleast two social media platforms
  4. You should be available for at least 10 weeks (and if you wish to work alongside your studies, we would be appointing Student Ambassadors soon)
  5. You should be willing to hustle and challenge yourself.

What we need to get started
No resumes please.
Make a 1 minute video showcasing why we should hire you and send it to connect@nexweave.com!
Feel free to use Nexweave (https://nexweave.com) to make this video or any other tool that you feel like.

Restyle Closet strives to be the force behind making secondhand fashion trendy. We want the modern woman to be able to afford the fashion we see and love everyday - on screens, advertisements, in malls. We also strongly support the production of high quality designer items, which has been the bread and butter of the fashion industry, and everyone in the supply chain, from the leather tannery, to the clothing factories where each item is individually hand stitched.

Fast fashion in Australia has resulted 6000 kg of clothing is dumped in landfill every 10 minutes. Restyle Closet hopes to make its social imprint by up-cycling designer items in a painless and secure way, giving each piece a second lease of life and reducing wastage of these quality items.

We’re looking for passionate, driven and ambitious candidates who want to make an impact in a growing startup that is environmentally conscious and promotes up-cycled fashion through innovative service. We need a number of people on a Part-Time basis to work alongside with in driving this cause to greater heights. Individuals who perform well will be invited to join the company on a Full-Time basis.

We are looking to hire data science interns to work part time (~10 hours/week) on a short term basis (~3 months) on full remote working to join our exciting startup (Specrom Analytics) and work on products based on natural language processing and text analytics.

What we are looking for?

Basically proficiency in one programming language such as Python,R, Java or Javascript and an open mind to learn new things.

What we do?

We are an integrated data analytics company that extracts raw web crawl data, parses it into structured formats (CSV/JSON) and creates advanced ML/DL models to enable best data extraction.

All of these are packaged and sold as rest APIs grouped into three product categories such as

  • web extraction/scraping APIs that extract JSONs/CSVs from job postings on indeed, monster, glassdoor. We also have restaurant listings from yelp, yellowpages.com etc.
  • Data APIs: these include a news database that extracts news from 20,000 sources in real time as well as a email addresses database like hunter.io
  • Text analytics APIs: these include all the text models such as NER, text summarization, text classification etc.

What our interns do?

Our goal for the interns is to have something tangible out of the internship that can be used to not only boost their resume and future employability but more importantly, to learn a few skills necassary to make a transistion into working in real world datasets with all the inherent messiness, complication etc.

With that view, you should aim at writing insightful analysis based on key datasets that can be packaged as a blog post worthy of major magazines such as towardsdatascience, kdnuggets etc.

What you will get out of this?

Since there is no time monitoring, and you can create your own schedule, we do not put our interns on our payroll. You will get tons of things out of this internship. Some of it is described below:

  • Authorship and credit: You get full authorships and copyright rights on all the blog articles/projects/code you write which can be used to enhance your portfolio.

  • Mentorship, Education and Learning: We got over 20% of our revenues in current fiscal year by hosting educational workshops and seminars for our corporate clients (it includes fortune 500 company). You will get the same educational resource for FREE and also a 1 on 1 biweekly zoom call with our founders where you can ask anything.

  • Server and Data: While we do give you a list of potential projects to work, you can come up with your own project and get free server time to run it.

  • Free Books: You will get access to our vast ebook library and also a copy of a new book by Jay (https://www.apress.com/gp/book/9781484265758).

  • Cash Bonus: In years past we have handed cash bonuses to interns all of whom were able to publish impactful articles and we plan to do the same this year too.

Your day-to-day responsibilities include:

  1. Research and develop leads, customers, and markets in India;

    Assist to create, plan, and execute campaigns coordinated with the marketing team;
    Develop and grow relationships with partners, leads, and accounts, through phone, email, and social media communications;

    You would also smartly strategise the research and data collection process. Business development would require you connect with our clients for further engagement. You will also follow the content
    plan to create and post content on the social media and for the marketing promotion.
    Working directly with business development head, intern would benefit from various aspects of a digital business.

What We Do:

Datawallet is the world’s leading data privacy compliance blockchain platform. It’s all-in-one compliance solution, the Datawallet CMP, covers enterprises’ compliance requirements for all major international data privacy regulations, from CCPA (California), SB 220 (Nevada), GDPR (Europe), POPIA (South Africa), and beyond.

The Role:

We are looking for a back-end engineer intern. You will be at the core of ensuring that our hosted datawallets provide users with maximal control and transparency, with all directives being recorded on our Cosmos-based blockchain. Our current service-oriented architecture consists of many multi-tenant PostgreSQL-backed Node.js services and numerous Cosmos blockchain clusters.

You should be comfortable jumping into code anywhere in our stack, from setting up and improving our continuous deployment mechanisms and writing .tf files, to writing services (in both Node.js and Go) that will respond to heavy loads of user requests.

What We are Looking For:

[Minimum Qualifications]

At least 2 years of software engineering experience, with at least 1 year experience in a backend role
Node.js and Go
AWS (ECS, S3, AmazonMQ, RDS, SQS and Lambda are our most used technologies)
Docker
Terraform
Continuous integration / deployment

[Desirable Qualifications]

Cosmos SDK (Polkadot experience also welcomed)

description:
Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience and a performant platform that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in back end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in connecting various APIs, libraries, and creating modules in NodeJS.

These are some of your personality traits:

Reliable and an effective communicator
A strong commitment to quality and deadlines
Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team
Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain
Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence
Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises the following:
JavaScript application design and testing
Creating Node.js applications
Designing and implementing webhooks and APIs (REST, SOAP, etc.)
JSON, REST, Firebase, Parse, PHP, and the like
Managing back end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users
Asynchronous I/O and NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB
MVC architecture
Unit testing and automation

Bonus points for:
Knowledge of Websockets: deepstream.io, sockjs, socket.io etc.
Experience with golang
Experience with front-end development frameworks like VueJS
Experience working with time-series data (stock market data etc.)

On the job you will:

Write well designed, testable, and efficient code.
Design, code, and build architecture based on new foundation principles established by the team.
Integrate various APIs, libraries and create modules as needed.
Debug issues and address performance bottlenecks.
Coordinate with product managers to meet functional requirements.
Use time tracking and management tools, such as Toggl and Trello.

We are looking for interns who can start ASAP! Remember, even if you don’t have all of the skills listed above, but are very interested in learning, we’d still love to talk to you!

To apply, submit the following information to internships@apollodae.io:

  1. Updated LinkedIn profile link (don’t sweat this!)
  2. What are you studying (or have studied)? (eg. BS Computer Science)
  3. Sample code or repo, if available
  4. Date you can start working
  5. How long you have been working with Node.js
  6. Details of experience with technologies listed above
  7. Number of hours per week you can fully commit to
  8. Something quirky/interesting about yourself

Upon conclusion of the internship, which shall last no longer than six (6) months or one (1) semester, but only for those interns with exemplary performance and work ethic may be granted an opportunity to interview with Apollo DAE for a paid position within the company if the company has the proper funding allocations for that department.

Intern understands, acknowledges, and agrees that there will be no compensation for this position.

Intern will be provided a letter of recommendation that is accurate to their position, work ethic, and performance with Apollo DAE. Intern may apply for college credit and Apollo DAE will work with interns applicable school to aid in this objective.

You will have the opportunity to work on new projects that will have a direct, tangible, and visible impact on operations, logistics and improving the customer experience. If you’re tired to be just a cog in a big machine, this is the perfect job for you! There are no clients to please, our only goal is to make PlanetRate the best it can be.

This is a non-paying internship initially with the expectation that it will evolve into a full time, paying position with a generous equity award component (which will be very valuable, eventually as we see this company being very successful either as a standalone or a valuable acquisition target by a large company, more established company in one of the several markets this platform will aggressively compete and grab significant market share from). We’re looking for a passionate developer who possesses in depth knowledge and understanding of all aspects of software development. Candidate will be expected to work remotely, and report on progress to key stakeholders.

About Fintech Sandpit

We are on a mission to connect the financial ecosystem together. We are building an industry API marketplace to accelerate the development of solutions for the world’s largest institutions.

Innovating within financial institutions is hard, slow, and complicated. It can take months for approvals and many more months for implementation. This stunts the ability for these organisations to learn and digitise. However, there are thousands of developers around the world who need to test capabilities quickly and business owners who need to work with new vendors easily.

We bring the world’s fintech capability into one place for users to test. Our industry sandbox enables users developers and business owners to scan the global market of startups and find a capability that suits them best.

*How can you help? *

To effectively test these new solutions. We are building the world’s largest marketplace of fintech companies. You'll help design the gateway to access these fintechs, and work on our frontend/backend stack. This is an exciting opportunity to get exposure to high quality code, proper development practices, working in a team, and developing real features.

*What you’ll do? *

  • Help design the authentication gateway and widen the scope of fintechs that we can access
  • Design beautiful front end components for our marketplace
  • Build APIs that provide the backbone for our application

This might for you if...

  • You have experience building front end application in Javascript
  • You have previous experience handling APIs in Python (Flask, Django)
  • You have worked/interned in a startup before as a developer
  • You have a sound understanding of collaborative development practices (CI/CD, using Git)

If you love using innovative technology to tackle tough science problems and working in a fast-paced, results-oriented team environment, keep reading to learn more about the Strayos Applied Scientist internship opportunity.

Here at Strayos, we use advanced computer vision and machine learning on images and machine sensors data to build insights for Mining, Infrastructure and Construction industry. Our applied science team uses these datasets to better understand our customers critical business operations and how it is changing. We are seeking three exceptional students with experience interpreting and processing imagery to join our applied science team during a three-month internship based at Strayos’ headquarters in Buffalo, WNY.

Over the course of this internship, you will work directly with our dynamic team of applied scientists who can share their deep knowledge of machine learning, remote sensing, geoscience, and physics. As an intern, you will learn how to implement novel, cutting-edge remote sensing and machine learning techniques to solve challenging research questions. To efficiently execute your solutions, you will access the Strayos' imagery archive and cloud-computing resources, and receive mentorship from one of our applied scientists. At the end of the internship, you will present your findings to the broader applied science team and learn more about future career opportunities at Strayos.

Responsibilities
Leverage our Python-based platform to query, access, and manipulate aerial imagery
Utilize machine learning or other classification techniques to analyze aerial imagery
Produce clear, concise results (e.g. ML models, statistics) for a project that can be completed during the course of the internship

Requirements
Candidates must currently be enrolled in an academic degree program in Geography, Geoscience, Earth Science, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or a related field, within 1 year of completion.
Experience with Python & Numpy
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to work independently

Preferred skills:
Experience with machine learning and image classification
Proficiency with the following Python packages: numpy, scikit-learn, keras
Experience working with aerial or satellite imagery and geospatial data.

We seek an intern with little to no experience, but who is passionate about contemporary frontend web technologies and practices. The platform is currently available only for iOS and is anticipated to go live later in 2019. We would like to take a step forward and make the platform available for desktop users. We are a very tightly knit company with a strong culture and passion for new technologies and services.

The internship is eligible for a permanent part-time or full-time position in the future. We can also vouch for worked hours should your educational institution require them. Develop optimized, cross-platform, desktop friendly reusable front-end code.

- reliable
- high level of integrity
- a self-starter
- hard worker

- communicative
- coachable / high willingness to learn
- open to constructive feedback

Work from home – remote – telecommute type of job. Dates are flexible, we run this internship year-round and can work around your schedule as long as it is fair.

Are you sustainability evangelist? Do you believe that we can end the climate crisis in your lifetime? Think that businesses can do good? Recapture is currently seeking out Corporate Emissions Associates for the Summer 2021 term, to sculpt the next phase of corporate climate action. We are a passionate gang looking for someone passionate, hopeful, data driven, and hardworking to help us fulfill our mission of making Recapture the enterprise carbon removal standard.

About Recapture

Recapture is the first systems-designed approach to carbon removal that makes it profitable for companies to reach true net-zero emissions and scalable to the volumes required to solve climate change. By combining multiple negative emissions technologies working in unison, we’re able to sequester 10 times more CO₂ per acre than just planting trees on their own.

Recapture was created to give the world’s largest companies a way to clean up all their historic emissions and be at the forefront of corporate responsibility. Our end-to-end solution makes it profitable for businesses who want to be both accountable and proactive to remove massive amounts of carbon from the atmosphere. We believe that capitalism can do good.

Our vision is to harness the collective power of the Global Fortune 1000 to reach net-zero and halt the progression of global warming in our lifetime. We pioneered the first profitable carbon removal strategy, have the system-designed model and global partners in place, and the financial flywheel to enable direct air capture (DAC) to scale through finance, construction, and innovation through our actual sales, instead of investment or subsidization alone.

The Program Areas

Recapture invites you to come join us for an an 11-22 week unique remote experience, that involves professional development programming, mentoring, and network-building. This program is designed to provide exposure into climate risk mitigation, corporate sustainability, design, sales, and value driven content creation. You will be placed on key projects across the business and be exposed to a few of the program areas based on your background. Here are just a few areas that we will focus on during the program.

Global Net Zero Commitment Tracking
Corporate Emissions Benchmarking
Carbon Markets Research
Data Extrapolation
Project Operations & Development
Climate Smart Forestry Life Cycle Analysis (LCA)

The Role

The Corporate Emissions Associate program is an internship-for-credit experience. This is not a paid position. Our goal is to create a mutually beneficial experience related to your academic interest, that is creditworthy, and encourages academic, professional, and personal growth.

You will work with our Emissions Analyst and Founding Partners, gathering publically available and proprietary corporate emissions data, extracting insights, and packaging this information for helping the global community understand the risks of corporate climate strategies. This role will require a keen eye for details, as well as the ability to step-away and see the bigger picture. Organization is key.

Qualifications

  • You are energetic and self-motivated--a critical and design thinker with fantastic organizational skills.
  • You have a do it yourself attitude, and have built and analyzed data repositories from scratch in the past.
  • You enjoy strategic planning and can effectively recognize and plan around future consequences and trends that can maintain Recapture’s image as an innovator in the carbon removal space.
  • You are eager to learn or have background in the sustainability, energy, and/or environmental management fields and confident in your ability to navigate a corporate sustainability report.
  • You can differentiate between Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions and how as well as what go into the calculations.
  • You understand the difference between location based market based calculations for energy utilization.
  • You're a skilled communicator and have an act for foreseeing opportunities and challenges before they arise.
  • You pride yourself on your hustle and ability to consistently follow up and follow through
  • You don't fold under pressure, but instead, thrive on setting high expectations for yourself, managing multiple tasks simultaneously, and meeting goals
  • Most importantly, you are passionate about what we're doing at Recapture!

The Perks

  • A sense of purpose by working directly on a solution that will impact large scale climate action
  • Work life balance
  • Recommendations and college credit
  • Access to corporate sustainability directors
  • Collaboration with amazing entrepreneurs in the climate space

How to Apply

To apply please send your resume and brief cover letter outlining why you would be a good fit to careers@recapturecarbon.com. We will only respond to emailed applications. Include "Summer Corp Emissions Associate" exactly as it is written in the subject line.

Build Stuff That Matters

Are you sustainability evangelist? Do you believe that we can end the climate crisis in your lifetime? Think that businesses can do good? Recapture is currently seeking out a Corporate Emissions Associate to sculpt the next phase of corporate climate action. We are a passionate gang looking for someone passionate, hopeful, data driven and hardworking to help us fulfill our vision of making Recapture the enterprise carbon removal standard.

About Recapture

Recapture is a Washington, DC based company founded in 2018 by Philip-Michael Weiner and Trey Pringle’s search for solutions to close the carbon gap. This spurred a two year journey to design economically sensible ways for companies to eliminate their footprint. But now the notion of carbon neutral has changed. It used to be offset what you can’t reduce through projects that avoid emissions somewhere else on the planet; however, now companies need to mathematically remove 1 ton of carbon for each ton they emit.

Since that time, Recapture has evolved from an to a new model for carbon removal that makes it profitable for the largest companies to solve climate change.

At a minimum, 100 billion metric tons of CO2 needs to be removed from the atmosphere by mid-century in order to meet the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement. Unfortunately, the current natural and technological approaches that pull carbon from the air have feasibility or cost limitations when used on their own that prevent them from scaling to the size of the problem. And even though the U.S. might be back on track to reduce emissions, without legislation, the financial mechanism has been missing in the carbon removal space. So we created that missing link.

Our vision is to harness the collective power of the Global Fortune 1000 to reach net-zero and halt the progression of global warming in our lifetime. We pioneered the first profitable carbon removal strategy, have the system-designed model and global partners in place, and the financial flywheel to enable direct air capture (DAC) to scale through finance, construction, and innovation through our actual sales, instead of investment or subsidization alone.

The Program Areas

Recapture invites you to come join us for a unique remote experience, including an 11-22 week for college credit, professional development programming, mentoring, and network-building. This program is designed to provide exposure into climate risk mitigation, corporate sustainability, design, sales, content creation and fund administration. You will be placed on teams across the business and be exposed to a few of the program areas based on your background. Here are just a few areas that we will focus on during the program.

  • Corporate Emissions Benchmarking

  • Report Design

  • Project Financing

You’ll work closely with creative and prolific futurists, designers, strategists, and climate finance investors to catalyze adoption of corporate carbon removal.

  • Building the Recapture brand and helping the company grow in its ability to lead and inspire companies to take action on ending the climate crisis

We are trying to build something revolutionary.

The role
We are currently in beta phase - we’ve opened our platform to a limited number of paying merchants, and are giving them high-touch support to ensure their tests are well-designed and successful.

This associate will help drive the transition from our beta to our scaling phase. Here is a sample of projects this person might own:

  • Determining IntelliGem’s pricing strategy: there are several possibilities for how we might price this service in the long term - a flat fee per test; a subscription price that scales with company size; a shared success model where we take a % of any profit improvement. We need to determine our options, model out the possibilities, and test these hypotheses with real customers

  • Defining the target customer: There are hundreds of thousands of e-commerce stores, if not millions. The question is simple - which of them would be good candidates for the IntelliGems service? We need to segment the market, determine the sizes of various segments, and use this to inform our business development strategy

  • Build the go-to-market plan: Most of our customers have come through referrals and networking. As we scale, we will need to be more proactive in finding customers. We need to determine what channels are most effective for e-commerce enablement companies, and run some initial tests to gauge effectiveness

  • Product development/management: As we better understand our target customer and go-to-market plan, we will need to tailor the product to these segments. In particular, we want to build a feature that suggests which tests a customer should run. This person might talk to customers and work with our engineers to define this feature

  • Lots of other stuff - We’re a scrappy team and have far more to-do than our capacity. Depending on the candidate’s interests and skills, they could plug into content development, design, fundraising strategy, customer success, and data science

You should apply if:

  • You thrive in ambiguous environments where there’s not a single “right” answer - you have an intuition for what’s the most important thing, and a knack for finding 80/20 solutions

  • You are a flexible thinker who loves switching between creative work, data analysis, problem solving, and customer interviews

  • You love tough problems, and aren’t scared off if they can get ‘math-y’ in nature

  • You’re down-to-earth, have a good sense of humor, and like to be friendly with the people you work with

  • You want to get exposure to an early company and see how things work at a young, seed-stage company

You can drop your resume here, but also highly enoucrage you to send one of us a note with your resume and explain why you're interested!

Built by a team of University of Michigan Alum, Appleseeds (currently in Stealth) is tackling student debt by reimagining the gifting and investing experience. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to work with seasoned veterans in the Fintech, programming, and e-commerce industries and help build revolutionary frictionless technology from the ground up. We are looking for someone that is curious and full of ideas, a self-starter, and likes to work with cutting edge web technologies.

  • Help design the Appleseeds experience by working with the team and giving candid feedback
  • Write both end-to-end and unit tests to ensure reliability of the app and API
  • Maintain, measure, and improve performance

Qualifications

  • Strong understanding of vanilla JavaScript (both Node.js and Web)
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented and functional programming
  • Experience with any modern frontend framework (we use Svelte)
  • Experience building REST APIs
  • Experience with TypeScript (we use across the stack)
  • Experience working with databases and writing SQL
  • Comfortable in a remote-work environment
  • A passion for programming!

Halfnote is a very early-stage startup, so this first intern should expect to have a voice in the product roadmap and prioritization.

Our founding team has experience at Facebook, Twitter, and Plaid, and is a good source of mentorship and support. The ideal candidate should have at least 2 years of experience working on front-end web products. We use the following:

We welcome a candidate who is less experienced on the software engineering side, as long as they have experience with building webpages from mocks.

Machine Perception is building a perception-as-a-service product providing obstacle detection and navigation for off-road autonomous vehicles (agriculture, mining, construction, and warehouses). We integrate with existing camera systems on the robot to provide robust anomaly/obstacle detection and navigability of the terrain in challenging environments. Check us out: machineperception.co.

You'll be improving our pipeline of taking in arbitrary video streams and infering depth, segmentation, and obstacle detection. Candidates will need to show proficiency in building 3-D scene understanding pipelines.

Additional requirements: ROS experience, robotics experience. Graduate students preferred, and references to any papers or publications highly recommended.
Looking for full stack web developer to build the web pages and the admin console using Node.JS, HTML, CSS and Javasript.

The Manual QA Tester is responsible for manual end-to-end testing of new features and functionality prior to release to production and works closely with our product and development teams to resolve bugs.
You strive to make your code modular, reusable, and clear for all who come after you. You

• Experience with cross-browser and cross-platform testing
• Excellent attention to detail, with an ability to multitask and meet deadlines
• Capable of working collaboratively in an agile, cross-functional team environment and effectively communicate ideas and opinions to the team
• Working knowledge of testing methodologies, industry tools and best practices, with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

About us:

healthQb is rapidly bringing its chronic pain assessment and patient outcome platform to market in efforts to support a variety of health professionals who provide multidimensional, in-person or tele-health services to their clients and patients. healthQb's platform aggregates biodata from a wearable device, psychosocial-metrics and psychosocial trait assessments to deliver comprehensive and ongoing real-time assessments. The target customers are allied healthcare practitioners and their chronic or persistent pain clients. In 2019, the World Health Organization recognized chronic pain as a condition that is biological, psychological and social. healthQb enables revolutionary insights into the biological, psychological and sociological nature of chronic or persistent pain, which is aggravated in stressful times.

healthQb is looking for a Part-Time Data Analyst Intern (Paid) to work directly with the Lead Data Scientist to help lead the company to the next phase by making sense of the vast heterogeneous data sources available. Furthermore, the intern will be in charge of developing the data analytics pipeline within the production-ready application system. The intern must have a strong programming background, as well as an interest in data analysis, signal processing and statistical modelling. The intern must be able to work independently, be procative and have exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills.

We are looking for a data-driven, self-starting individual who will thrive in a fast-paced environment and wants to see the impact of their work. This role will be part-time (30 hours a week) and would start in May 2021. The role could potentially move to a Full-Time role in September 2021.

Responsibilities and Tasks:
• Develop, maintain and improve current pipeline and algorithms to process wearable physiological data
• Develop, maintain and improve healthQb’s statistical measures that capture user's biopsychosocial health
• Perform statistical modelling and analysis on healthQB’s various data streams enabling a continuous improvement of HealthQB’s biopsychosocial model of health

Skill Set:
• Currently pursuing a degree (Master’s or PhD preferred) in computer science or other highly quantitative field such as physics, statistics, or mathematics
• Proficient use of Python (including numpy, pandas packages)
• Experience with OOP and other software design principles
• Experience with relational databases and SQL
• Experience with signal processing and data wrangling
• Experience with statistical analysis and modelling (e.g., multivariate analysis, regression, time series)
• Experience with version control software (e.g., github) is considered an asset but not required
• Experience with other statistical programming languages (e.g., R) is considered an asset but not required

If this sounds like an exciting opportunity, please send your CV and cover letter to: oswald@yourhealthqb.com.

healthQb is dedicated to helping its employees grow and develop technical and soft skills in an innovative and collaborative environment. healthQb is an equal opportunity employer with an inclusive culture. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Hiring + Application Instructions

We are passionate about our mission, but also about building an extraordinary team. We believe that every person has a superpower, and it is our job to help you hone this talent so you can be your best self, succeed, and make an impact.

If you think you’re the right fit, we welcome you to reach out to hello@parallelhealth.io. Please include your resume/CV and a letter sharing with us why you are interested in the role.

Ideal Candidate
You are:

  • A conscientious molecular biologist
  • Interested in exploring the skin microbiome and building new products to improve general skin health and wellness
  • Are interested in product development
  • A team player who likes working with other curious scientists that take their mission, but not their egos, seriously
  • Looking forward to building your network with some of the most dynamic startups in the SF Bay Area at Illumina Accelerator.

Responsibilities
You will:

  • Help to isolate and identify new skin microbes with state-of-the-art shotgun genomic sequencing
  • Isolate bacteriophages that can be incorporated into ground-breaking gentle skin microbiome cosmetic products that will actually improve the appearance of people’s skin
  • Learn about the skin microbiome (including your own!) and contribute to product design and development
  • Troubleshoot molecular biology protocols and contribute to laboratory automation and protocol improvement
  • Conduct other research and/or processes to support product development

Technical Requirements + Extras
You have:

  • Graduated with a B.S. or M.S. in microbiology, molecular biology, or related field
  • Successfully carried out an NGS DNA library preparation protocol (Illumina, PacBio, NanoPore, etc.)
  • Worked with bacteria in a BSL-2 laboratory before (in a BSL-2 cabinet/laminar flow hood)
  • Independently identified and corrected mistakes that you’ve made in complex molecular biology protocols

Extra points if you have:

  • Experience reading and writing Python scripts and want to learn more (nice to have, but not the most important thing)
  • Experience working in a corporate or startup laboratory (nice to have, but not essential)

About Macro Mentors
MacroMentors aims to take the luck out of your professional development. By bringing together best of breed mentors and connecting them with mentee's that wish to invest in themselves, we are levelling the entire finance landscape.

What are we looking for?
We are seeking analytically-minded interns helping us to build no-code applications and systems. You will learn about the no-code tool Bubble, experience the setup of building a marketplace operations process and receive mentoring from two ambitious founders.

Motivation is what we hire, skills are what we will help you learn. We believe in small teams and strong relationships. For us, small teams mean less bureaucracy and more getting things done in a trusted environment.

You are enthusiastic about no-code and would like to become part of a team that values flexibility, efficiency, and direct feedback. You are fluent in English, have great communication skills and the ability to convey what makes our products unique in a fun and upbeat way.

You believe in the power of no-code and want to help us accomplish our mission of connecting the best minds in finance.

Key Guidelines for the Day to Day

Working directly with the founder team, be exposed to how the finance industry really works and who the major players are. You’ll be helping out with work spanning the whole organization.

You’re expected to pick up and learn new software and tools that you’ve never used before. To help you learn faster, you will be enrolled in a no-code Bootcamp taught directly by Bubble instructors.

More often than not, you’ll be given a goal and a rough sketch of how to approach the problem. You WILL NOT be given step-by-step instructions on how to succeed.

You’ll be required to do research, be resourceful, and come up with solutions on your own.

It will be a challenging experience and you will not only learn practical skills but also grow as a person, making it an overall rewarding experience.

About the company:

Equal Pay for Equal Work – Quantified

Salaryse is a salary platform that aims to drive the industry in a direction where both employers and employees have access to salary information in a transparent manner to assess the ‘true worth’ of an individual based on their skillset, education, experience and industry. We want to eradicate conscious and unconscious biases in pay based on colour, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, etc.

As per UK’s Office for National Statistics, gender pay gap among full-time employees stood at 8.9% in 2019. OECD reported a striking 12.9% gender pay gap worldwide. This is an example of just one form of salary discrimination that has come to light. Add to this are the unconscious biases that we as humans have.

The existing job portals and platforms aid this problem through their current means. Most of these portals allow professionals to estimate their expected compensation based on market demand by seeking their previous salary details, worsening the problem of salary discrimination even further. Other times, working professionals find it difficult to understand the exact salary to ask potential employers, or know what salary they deserve or if they are underpaid.

While the job market industry may have many grey areas, we at Salaryse believe it is crucial for you to know what you truly deserve to be paid and that your salary should be based on your experience, education and skillset, that define you as a professional, and is not based on your looks. Salaryse does just that – it estimates your salary based on YOUR unique experience, skills and education, along with the market demand. We believe your previous salary shouldn't determine your next salary. Our mission is to equip and empower you with a solid benchmark before you enter your next salary negotiation. The key to our future is our team and data. Our ambition is to create a platform for our current and future talent to thrive and grow with the business.

We are a small team of young entrepreneurs with a vision to eliminate salary discrimination and bring equal pay at workplace. You will be working with a socially relevant and commercially important idea in today’s trying times. As we are a growing start-up, this 3-month internship may lead to a longer engagement.

Equal Pay for Equal Work – Quantified

Salaryse is a salary platform that aims to drive the industry in a direction where both employers and employees have access to salary information in a transparent manner to assess the ‘true worth’ of an individual based on their skillset, education, experience and industry. We want to eradicate conscious and unconscious biases in pay based on colour, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, etc.

As per UK’s Office for National Statistics, gender pay gap among full-time employees stood at 8.9% in 2019. OECD reported a striking 12.9% gender pay gap worldwide. This is an example of just one form of salary discrimination that has come to light. Add to this are the unconscious biases that we as humans have.

The existing job portals and platforms aid this problem through their current means. Most of these portals allow professionals to estimate their expected compensation based on market demand by seeking their previous salary details, worsening the problem of salary discrimination even further. Other times, working professionals find it difficult to understand the exact salary to ask potential employers, or know what salary they deserve or if they are underpaid.

While the job market industry may have many grey areas, we at Salaryse believe it is crucial for you to know what you truly deserve to be paid and that your salary should be based on your experience, education and skillset, that define you as a professional, and is not based on your looks. Salaryse does just that – it estimates your salary based on YOUR unique experience, skills and education, along with the market demand. We believe your previous salary shouldn't determine your next salary. Our mission is to equip and empower you with a solid benchmark before you enter your next salary negotiation. The key to our future is our team and data. Our ambition is to create a platform for our current and future talent to thrive and grow with the business.

We are a small team of young entrepreneurs with a vision to eliminate salary discrimination and bring equal pay at workplace. You will be working with a socially relevant and commercially important idea in today’s trying times. As we are a growing start-up, this 3-month internship may lead to a longer engagement.
